z:row.description: "L", 1908-50 At the junction of the two ridges leading up from Subic Bay lighthouse and from Biniptican Pt. It is at an elevation of about 360 m. and shows on the skyline as seen from the bay near the lighthouse. From the station Port Silaguin is visible to the W, and Biniptican and Sampaloc Pts. to the S; Ologanpo is seen in range with Mt. Malasimbo. It is in an open grassy region with a few small, scattering trees, and stands on a detached knoll overlooking the entire valley to the SW of the lighthouse. A short distance away toward the N and NW the ground again rises toward Mt. Silaguin and becomes heavily wooded with timber extending down into the gullies toward the NE. Station mark is a 3.2 cm. iron pipe set in the center of a block of concrete 20 cm. x 25 cm., and 20 cm. deep. A line was cleared through the woods to station Macmany and in the opening Mayanga Island was also visible. A dead stump was on the edge of the knoll to the NNE of the station, a fairly large pine is 18 m. to the W, and a wide branching tree is 18 m. toward the SW. At a distance of 18.64 m. from the station on the line to Subic Bay lighthouse an arrow pointing to the station was cut on a large rock.

AGAIN, 1905-06 On a hill on the mainland shore due E of Capon Grande Island, and 500 m. SW of Bo. Pundaquit. It is on a small knoll at an elevation of about 50 m., on the spur leading down to the point immediately W of the mouth of the Pundaquit River. It is 170 m. W of the river mouth, 140 m. S of the extremity of the point and 80 m. E of the outer coast line. Station mark is a drill hole in the rock. Arrows were cut in the rock 3.47 m. to the E, 4.15 m. to the S and 3.20 m. to the W of the station.

AGAIN 2, 1977 On the W coast of Luzon, Province of Zambales, Municipality of ìSan Antonio, about 500 m. SW of Bo. Pundakit. Station is on a ìsmall knoll at an elevation of about 50 m., and about 140 m. S of ìthe extremity of the point, 80 m. E of the outer coast line. The ìbest approach is on the NE side of the hill. Station mark is the ìcenter of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod drilled and cemented on a hard ìrock about 50 cm. in dia. inscribed by a 10 cm. equilateral ìtriangle and marked "AGAIN, 1977, PCGS", RM 1 and RM 2 are ìsimilar. It is the center of a 3 in. copper screw, nailed and ìcemented on a hard rock with an arrow pointing towards the ìstation, named RM 1, RM 2 respectively. RM 1 is 7.94 m. from the ìstation with azimuth 295° 19.8'. RM 2 is 4.51 m. from the station ìwith azimuth 2° 18.0'.

AGOSEAN LIGHT, 1947-50 On the W coast of Luzon, on the W side of Subic Bay, on the ìextreme outer part of the low, rounding point called Agusuhin ìPt. The station is the center of the light structure painted ìwhite, made of concrete and cylindrical in shape.

AGOSOEN, 1908 On the W side of Subic Bay on the extreme outer part of the low, ìrounding point called Agusuhin Pt. It is about 180 m. S of the ìriver mouth, about 120 m. S of the last shack in the barrio of ìAgusuhin, 18 m. SE of the end of slough leading toward the S and ì5 m. back of high water line. The entire outer part of the point ìwas cleared of trees except a single pine left standing 12.5 m. ìSW of the station. This tree was about 30 cm. in dia. at the ìbottom and was about 14 m. high. All is branches were trimmed off ìexcept a few at the top. Subsurface mark is the center of the ìneck of a quart bottle, filled with cement and buried at a depth ìof 38 cm. below the surface of the sand. The bottle was placed on ìa cement base. Station mark is a square block of concrete 30 cm. ìsquare and 20 cm. deep, with the letters "U.S.C.G.S." on its ìsurface and a section of 2 cm. pipe set to mark the center. A ìlarge beacon was built over the station and will probably be ìmaintained by the Navy as the station is the S range mark ìdefining the course for the measured mile for speed trials in ìSubic Bay.

ALAPAY, 1959 Is in the island of Luzon, in Pampanga province, municipality of ìMasantol, about 130 m. on the N side of the Bebe-San Esteban ìcut-off channel and about 2.06 km. E of the junction of Guagua ìRiver and Bebe-San Esteban cut-off channel. Mark is a mouth of a ìbottle on the center of a cylindrical concrete block 25.4 cm. in ìdia., buried 30.5 cm. into the ground at the foot of the Sampaloc ìtree with an inscription "ALAPAY, 1959, PC&GS".

ANGELES CHURCH, NORTH BELL TOWER, 1905 Is the N one of the two bell towers on the church in the town of ìAngeles. Although this point is unchecked it may be verified by a ìcomparison on the ground of the relative location of the two ìtowers. Should this show discrepancy the S tower should be given ìpreference.

ANGELES SOUTH CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-50-51 Is the center of the S church bell tower of the Angeles Catholic ìChurch, S of the intersection of Rosario St. and Santo Intiero ìSt. in the municipality of Angeles.

ANN, 1905 On the beach 2.7 km. S of the seaward end of the road leading from San Narciso to the barrio at the landing place. To reach the station from San Narciso leave the main road to San Antonio on the N side of the second river of San Narciso and follow a road which will lead to the station by continually bearing toward the left. Just before reaching the station the road crossed a stream and leads alongside a row of trees facing the beach. The last tree was marked with a triangle. The station is on a little knoll about 100 m. back of high water line and 50 m. outside the road. The following azimuths may assist its location: Capones Lighthouse, 35° 33'; outer edge of coconut trees at San Narciso, 184° 46'; nearby house, 211° 48'; nearby house, 335° 24'. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried neck down at a depth of 1.07 m., surmounted by a section of bamboo.

APALIT CHURCH CROSS ON DOME, 1905-50-59 Is the cross on the prominent dome of the Catholic Church at ìApalit. The dome is covered with plain G.I. sheets painted white ìand is about 31.09 m. high. It is reached from Km. 54.2 on the ìnational road by way of a street in an E direction to about 1.5 ìkm. The church is on the right side of the street.

APEX, 1904-05 About 2.2 km. N of the town of Masinloc, and 270 m. SE of the ìroad following the beach around the SE part of Oyon Bay. It is ìon a sharp little cone-shaped hill, clear of trees on top but ìwith a few scattered ones around its base and sides. The station ìis on the highest part of the hill which is of small area. ìStation mark is a drill hole in a stone set in the ground on ìedge, with about 8 cm. projecting above the surface.

ARA-1 Station is located on the playground of Baler Central School in Baler town proper. Mr. Roger Quirijero and Mr. Onipas, superintendent of school is familiar with station. About 8 to 9 hours travel from Quezon City to the station. Station mark; original mark with inscription `BALER 1977 MAGNETIC' was refurbished. A 0.15 m x 0.01 m. diameter brass rod was set in a drilled hole in the original mark and additional concrete cast in place. Reference mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. diameter brass rods set in concrete blocks, 0.45 m deep and 0.15 m above the ground; flushed with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name and RM number.
*Note: Reported LOST by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol (January 2007).

ARA-10 Is located inside the compound of PAGASA Weather Radar Station, situated on the rooftop of the employees' quarters, about 0.9 m. SW of the ENE corner of the rooftop. The quarters is SW of the said station and E of the power house. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "ARA-10 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-11 Is inside the compound of Paaralang Sentral ng San Luis, situated on the plant box parallel, approx. 6 m. S, to the abandoned school hall. The L-shaped plant box, where the station is located, is about 0.44 m. high, 0.84 m. wide and E of the flagpole and the Manuel L. Quezon Monument. It is also 11.2 m. E of the corner of the plant box. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 10 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-11 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-12 (DPL-12) Is located on the school grounds of Ditale Elem. School, situated 7 m. E of the entrance gate, 7 m. N of the stage and 35 m. W of the flagpole of the said school. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 20 cm. x 20 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "DPL-12 2006 NAMRIA DENR".

ARA-13 Is located on the grounds of Borlongan Brgy. Plaza, situated on the E side of the S end of the second plant box from the main entrance arc of the said plaza, about 30 m. N of the main entrance arc. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and centered in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 20 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-13 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-14 Is located on the school grounds of Dinadiawan Elem School, 51 km. drive from Dipaculao Municipal Hall along the road leading to Casiguran. It is situated 1.5 km. S of the flagpole, 7 m. SE of the DepEd marker and 40 m. N of the stage of the said school. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block flushed and leveled on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-14 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-15 Is located on the NW corner of Abuleg Brgy. Plaza, situated 1 m. from each of the N and W fences, about 7 m. SE of the intersection of the roads bounding the N and W side of the plaza and 15 m. W of the stage. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 20 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-15 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-16 Is located on top of the concrete water tank in Aurora Animal Breeding Station in Brgy. Galintuja. It is situated 40 m. S of the nat'l. road leading to Baler, 15 m. S of the sleeping quarters of the said breeding station, 0.5 m. from the E edge and 1 m. from the S edge of the water tank. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty flushed on top of the said water tank, with inscriptions "ARA-16 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-17 Is located on the school grounds of Francisco Q. Dagyapen Memorial Elem. School in Brgy. Dianawan. It is attached on the W side of the concrete stand of the flagpole of the said school. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embbedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 20 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-17 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-18 Is located inside the Umiray Brgy. Health Center compound, situated on the concrete pavement between the brgy. road leading back to Brgy. Ibona and the said center. It is about 3.5 m. from each of the N and w edges of the pavement and 12 m. S of the flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 24 cm. x 23 cm. cement putty flushed and leveled on concrete pavement, with inscriptions "ARA-18 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-19 (MBM-5) From Dingalan Proper, travel NW going to Gabaldon for about 10 mins. (7 km.). Station is located at the boundary of Brgys. Pinamalisan, Gabaldon, Nueva Ecija and Tanawan, Dingalan, Aurora. It is on the E corner of the waiting shed beside house no. 30, about 40 m. S of Pinamalisan Primary School, about 7 m. SW of the road centerline. It is also 3.5 m. SW of the km. post indicating "7 km. to Dingalan and 5 km. to Gabaldon". Mark is a 10 mm. rebar, set on top of the municipal boundary monument 28 cm. x 28 cm. x 70 cm. from the ground, inscribed on top with "MBM No. 5".

ARA-2 Station is located in the Dinalongan Barangay High School's playground, about 100 m. north of the school grandstand. Mrs. Roxas the school principal and Mr. Bartolome Jamora are familiar with this station. Travel time from Baler is approximately 7 hours by boat. road from Baler is accessible only by 4-wheel drive vehicle during good weather. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in standard concrete block 0.7 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Sub-surface marks bottle set in concrete block. Top of bottle is 0.76 m. below station mark. Reference mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in concrete blocks 0.06 m. deep flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name and R.M. number.
*Note: Reported LOST by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol (January 2007).

ARA-20 From Brgy. Sabang, Baler, travel by banca going to San Luis. Station is located on Dibayabay Brgy. Proper, about 15 m. NW from the back of the stage near the basketball court, 17 m. W from the brgy. hall and about 10 m. NE from the Health Care. It is also situated inside the wooden fence surrounding the resthouse of the Brgy. Tanod about 0.5 m. S from the N corner of the fence. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument 20 cm. above ground surface, with inscription "ARA-20 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-21 From Brgy. Sabang, Baler, travel by banca going to San Luis. Station is located inside the compound of Paaralang Elementarya ng Dikapinisan, about 28 m. SE of the flagpole. Station is situated beside the plantbox, with one attached to the W end of the main gate of the school. It is 0.93 m. W of the plantbox and 11.4 m. N of the W end of the gate. It is also situated between the 5th and 6th, starting from the gate, small ornamental plants. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 20 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-21 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-22 From Brgy. Sabang, Baler, travel by banca going to So. Alasanay. Station is located inside the school compound of R. Tangson Elem. School, situated on the higher part of the school ground about 7 m. ENE of the N corner of the classroom. It is also situated at the intersection of the line extending to the flagpole and the line extending to the NW side of the classroom. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 20 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-22 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-23 From Brgy. Aplaya, Dingalan, travel by banca going to the shore and walk for about 30 min. going to the barrio. Station is located inside the compound of Dikapanikian Elem. School, along the NE side of the school's septic tank. It is also situated along the imaginary line extending to the SE side of the teacher's quarters, about 3 m. NE from the corner of the said quarters. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 15 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-23 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-24 Is located on the town proper of Dingalan, N of Pamilihang Bayan ng Dingalan and S of the mun. bldg. It is situated 0.35 m. W from the NW corner of the mun. basketball court, about 14 m. SW of the flagpole, approx. 9 m. E of the Health Office. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-24 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-25 From Dingalan Proper, travel S for about 30 min. (16 km.) to Brgy. Ibona. Station is located inside the brgy. plaza beside the NE side of the solar drier. It is about 8.6 m. SE of the N corner, about 11.8 m. NW of the S corner, about 60 m. NE of the mun. extension office, about 30 m. SE from the road centerline and NW of the basketball court. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block and flushed with the said drier, with inscriptions "ARA-25 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-26 Is located at the Dinalungan Municipal Hall compound, between the mun. hall/bldg. and M. L. Quezon St. It is situated 20 m. W of the said hall, 10 m. NW of the flagpole and 1 m. N of the concrete pavement fronting the flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-26 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-26 Is located at the Dinalungan Municipal Hall compound, between the mun. hall/bldg. and M. L. Quezon St. It is situated 20 m. W of the said hall, 10 m. NW of the flagpole and 1 m. N of the concrete pavement fronting the flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-26 2006 NAMRIA".
"ITRF 2000 COORDINATES" Latitude: 16° 8' 25.19052"N Longitude: 121° 57' 24.33118"E Ellipsoidal Height: 50.803 m

ARA-27 From Casiguran, travel S going to Brgy. Bianoan. Station is located inside the brgy. hall compound, about 9 m. NW of the mun. road centerline. It is also about 2.5 m. NW of these fence, about 12 m. SE of the S corner post of the multi-purpose hall and about 70 m. S of the brgy. hall. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block protruding 20 cm. above the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-27 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-28 Is locayed on the school grounds of Casiguran Elem. School, about 1.5 m. N of the NNE corner of the basketball court. It is situated along the imaginary line extending the SW end of the gate about 25 m. SE. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-28 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-29 Is located inside the compound of Manggitahan Brgy. Hall, along the W side of the N-S concrete pathway. It is situated 5 m. W from the centerline of the pathway, about 9 m. WSW of the SW corner of the multi-purpose hall and about 25 m. NE of the NE corner of the market. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 20 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-29 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-3 From Baler, Aurora, travel North towards the Municipality of Dilasag for 142 kilometers or 10 hours drive, passing through the towns of Dipaculo, Dinaluyan and Casiguran. Upon reaching Dilasag town, take a motor boat and cross Diapitan bay; travel Northeast towards Tarigtig Point for 10 minutes. The station is located on the highest grassy hill on Tarigtig Point, which can be seen from Dilasag town at Northeast direction. It can be reached by following the foottrail from the Northwest part of Tarigtig point for 45 minutes, (loaded), up to the station. Another access to the station is by motor boat from Baler Aurora, up to Casiguran town for 4 hours. Then a jeepney ride going Northeast for 30 minutes up to Dilasag town. Upon reaching Dilasag town, take a motor boat again and cross Diapitan Bay and sail for 10 minutes up to Tarigtig Point. Then to reach the station follow the same access as above upon reaching Tarigtig Point. Station mark is 0.005 meters diameter drilled hole, centered in a triangle on top of 0.30 m. x 0.61 m. rock; 0.08 meter above ground surface. Sub-surface mark; none. Reference mark numbers 1, 2, 3 and 4 are cross cut on top of 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. diameter brass rod, set in drilled holes on top of triangular shape boulders. With cement putty on top and inscribed with reference mark numbers.
*Note: Reported LOST by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol (January 2007).

ARA-30 Is located inside the old mun. hall compound, 4.2 m. NE from the SW corner of the compound. It is situated 3.5 m. from the two pillars nearest the SW corner. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 20 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-30 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-3001
It is located infront of Malamig Elem. School. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3001, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3002
It is located in front of the flagpole of Cabug Elem. School. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3002, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3003
It is located along Recto St. going to fish port at the right side of the port guard gate. Station is concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. long brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3003, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3004
It is located att he right side of the road after the Aguang Bridge going to Baler proper. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3004, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3005
It is located before the waiting shed going to Macdol. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3005, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3006
It is located beside the stage of the basketball court which is at the right side of the road going to Dinajawan. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3006, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3007
It is located beside the basketball court of Diarabasin at the right side going to Dinajawan. Station is concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, 'ARA-3007, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3008
It is located beside the basketball court in the right side of the road going to Baler. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3008, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-3009
It is located within the compound of brgy. plaza, 45 m from the left side of the court and 30 m from brgy. hall. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3009, 2007, NARMIA".

ARA-3010
It is lcoated in front of the rice mill going to Brgy. Detawini. Station is a concrete monument 30 cm x 30 cm with a mark of 5/8 in. diameter, 4 in. brass rod with inscriptions, "ARA-3010, 2007, NAMRIA".

ARA-31 (COZ-1) Is located in Brgy. Cozo, about 20 min. ride on a banca from the pier of Brgy. Lual, Casiguran. It is situated on the ground 12 m. W of the brgy. chapel and 8 m. E of the E edge of the basketball court of the said brgy. Mark is the head of a 3 in. umbrella nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 5 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "COZ-1 NAMRIA 11-10-05".

ARA-32 Travel by banca going to Sitio Dumaguipo, Brgy. Cozo, Casiguran. Station is located inside the compound of the Dela Rosa Family, on the top center of the septic tank, about 18 m. S from the gate and approx. 10 m. SW of the house.

ARA-33 (CAS-2) Travel by banca going to Brgy. Dalugan, Casiguran. Station is located inside the San Idelfonzo Elem. School compound, about 5 m. S from the Grade II Bldg., about 2 m. E from the Kinder room and approx. 8 m. SE from a gigantic tree. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 10 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "CAS-2 NAMRIA".

ARA-34 To reach the station, travel SW by motorized banca from Casiguran for about 2-1/2 hrs. (35 km.). Station is located near the SW end of San Ildefonso Peninsula, inside the property of Mr. Cornelio Tordil. It is about 15 m. E of the shore, about 6 m. NNE of the gate, about 8 m. W from the SW corner of the house, about 4 m. NNW of the S coconut tree and about 4 m. S of the N coconut tree. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block and flushed with the ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-34 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-3401 The station is located at the vacant lot outside the compound of Brgy. Hall and Health Center of Brgy. Umiray. It is situated near the wooden electric post and on the right side of brgy. Road leading to the boundary of dinagalan and Gen. Nakar. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm. with a mark of 5/8 diameter copper wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with the inscription ARA, 2008 NAMRIA".

ARA-3403 The station is located inside the compound of Municipa Hall extension office at Brgy. Ibona. It is located at the right side of the entrance gate near the concrete fence. It is situated near the old monument of NAMRIA-DENR. Station is located concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark 5/8 diameter copper wire nail a narrow hole at the center; set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3403, 2008 NAMRIA"

ARA-3404 The station is located along brgy. Road at brgy. Matawe. It is situated on the left side of the riad going to brgy. Umiray and about 5 meters before crossing a spill way. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark 5/8 diameter copper wire nail and a anarrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3404 2008 NAMRIA".

ARA-3405 The station is located at brgy. Matawi along brgy. Road near the passengers waiting area and the tricycle terminal. It is about 15 meters away from army check point before going to brgy. Umiray and about 100 meters away from ARA-3404. Statio is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark 5/8" copper wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3405, 2008 NAMRIA".

ARA-3406 The station is situated at brgy. Cabog basketball court, It is situated NE side of the concrete pavement of the said court with the distance of .5 meter. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark of 5/8" diameter wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3406, 2008 NAMRIA"

ARA-3409 The station is situated inside the compound of dingalan centeral school. It is permanently placed infront of the flagpole. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark of 5/8" diameter copper wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center; set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3409 2008 NAMRIA.

ARA-3410 The monument is situated at brgy. Caragsakan. The station is located at the right side of National Road leading from municipality of dinagalan to cabaldon. It is situated near ARA-3411 within the concrete barriers at the edge of the road. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark 5/8" diameter copper wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3410, 2008 NAMRIA

ARA-3411 The monument is situated at brgy. Caragsakan sitio horse shoe. The station is located at the right side of National Road leading from municipality of dingalan to cabadlon. It is situated near the concrete barriers at the edge of the road. It is about 20 meters away from KM 178. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark of 5/8" diameter copper wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3411,2008 NAMRIA.

ARA-3412 The station is a cement putty located at the right side of the national road going to dinagalan. The station is placed in between the concrete barriers and it is about 50 meters away from the DPWH field office. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark 5/8" diameter copper nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3412, 2008 NAMRIA

ARA-3413 The monument is situated at brgy. Villa M. The station is located at the left side of National Road leading from municipality of Baler. It is situated near km post 190 going to Baler. Station is a concrete putty monument 30 x 20 cm with a mark 5/8" diameter copper wire nail and a narrow hole mark at the center, set level on the ground with inscription ARA-3413 2008 NAMRIA.

ARA-3414 It is situated at the left side of the national road from bongabon to san luis, 10 meters NW of miracle revival church. Situated at brgy. Detiki, 10 meters away NE from the center line of the national road. Station is a concrete putty monuemnt 30 x 20 cm with a mark of 5/8" diamter copper wire and a narrow hole mark at the center, set on the ground with inscription ARA-3414, 2008 NAMRIA.

From Casiguran Town Proper travel for about 1 hour going to Barangay Dibacong then walk for 900 meters where the station is located.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-116; 2010; DENR/LMS-11."

From Dinalungan travel for about 1 hour going to Barangay Nipoo where the station is located beside the basketball court.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-117; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

ARA-3496-AIC-118

Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-118; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

ARA-3497-AIC-128
From Casiguran town Proper take a motor boat going to San Ildefonso port then walk for about 1 kilometer towards Barangay Hall where the station is located.

ARA-3498-AIC-129
From Dinalungan Town Proper along Baler-Casiguran road until reaching Sala Bridge where the station is located at the left side of the road near the bridge.

ARA-3499-AIC-142
From Dipaculao Town Proper travel for 2 kilometers towards Barangay Janit where the station is located.

ARA-35 Is located on the E part of the school grounds of Pedro Orata Elem. School, situated between the 3rd and 4th circular plant box starting from the flagpole. It is about 2 m. from each plant box, about 20 m. NE from the flagpole and about 20 m. N of the E side of the main bldg. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-35 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-3500-AIC-143
From Dipaculao Town Proper travel towards Barangay Ditale for about 1 hour until reaching intersection roads leading to Baler Proper and Dilasag where the station is located.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-143; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

ARA-3501-AIC-144
From Dipaculao Town Proper travel for about 3 kilometers going to Barangay Dimabuno where the station is located.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-144; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

From Barangay Galintuja travel towards Sitio Dilaktan for about 30 meters where the station is located near the river.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-146; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

ARA-3503-AIC-158
From San Luis Town Proper travel for about 20 minutes going to Barangay Diteki where the station is located.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-158; 2010; DENR/LMS-11."

ARA-3504-AIC-159
From Baler Town Proper travel towards Barangay Reserva where the station is located about 2 meters from the edge of the road.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-159; 2010; DENR/LMS-11."

ARA-3505-AIC-160
From Baler Town Proper travel towards Barangay Gloria for about 1.5 kilometers then continue travelling for 1 kilometer heading to Barangay Pingit then proceed to Barangay Zabali for another 3.5 kilometers where the station is located.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-160; 2010; DENR/LMS-11."

ARA-3506-AIC-161
From Dibut Elementary School walk for about 50 meters where the station is located towards the open sea.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-161; 2010; DENR/LMS-11."

ARA-3507-AIC-162
From Municipality of Baler take a boat ride heading towards Barangay Dikapinisan where the station is located.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-162; 2010; DENR/LMS-11."

ARA-3508-AIC-163
From Barangay Dimanayat Proper walk for 3 kilometers along the road where the station is located about 100 meters from the shoreline.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-163; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

ARA-3509-AIC-168
From Bongabon Town Proper travel towards Bongabon-Dingalan road then continue travelling until reaching Barangay Aplaya where the station is located about 20 meters from Petron Gas Station.
Station mark is the head of an umbrella nail flushed at the center of a 10cm. x 10cm. x 30 cm concrete monument with inscription "AIC-168; 2010; DENR/LMS-111."

ARA-3510-AIC-169
From Dingalan Town Proper travel towards Barangay Umiray for 11/2 hours thru rough road where the station is located at Sitio Iyapit about 3 meters from road centerline and 1 meter from triangular post.

ARA-36=CB-1 Station is located at the Casiguran Airport situated on the NE corner of the runway. The station is at 180 m SE of the ASEZA Administration building and 300 m NE of the security tower. Mark is a 3 inches copper nail centered and embedded on 15 cm x 15 cm concrete putty with inscription CB-01 2010 NAMRIA.

ARA-4 Is located on the concrete rooftop of Museo de Baler, 30 m. E of the statue of Manuel L. Quezon, in Quezon Park. It is situated on the NE corner of the said museum, 1 m. from the N and the E edge of the roof. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 20 cm. concrete block flushed on the roof surface, with inscriptions "ARA-4 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-5 Is located on the school grounds of Maria Aurora Central School. It is situated 5 m. from the E side of the said grounds, 35 m. NE of the flagpole and 50 m. S of the multi-purpose hall of the said school. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block flushed and leveled on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-5 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-6 Is located on the compound of Dipaculao Municipal Hall, situated 1 m. W of the volleyball court, 10 m. NW of the polygonal multi-purpose hall and 30 m. W of the municipal hall. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 20 cm. concrete block flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "ARA-6 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-7 Is inside the compound of L. Pimintel Brgy. Hall, 2.7 m. S of the ESE corner of the basketball court, 10 m. NE of the NE corner of the stage and about 9 m. NNE of the NE corner of the Health Care. It is situated along the imaginary line extending the N side of the said hall E. It is also 3.2 m. SE of the lamp post and 2.4 m. W of the E concrete wall of the compound. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 20 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "ARA-7 2006 NAMRIA".

ARA-8 (AUR-2) Is located at the SW side of Baler-Bongabon Nat'l. Rd., situated near and outside the compound of Paaralang Elementarya ng Diteki, about 1.6 m. NNW of the NW end of the main gate. It is also located 0.66 m. NW of the concrete bench along the main entrance and 0.77 m. NE of the NE concrete wall of the school compound. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding 10 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "AUR-2 2004 NCIP".

ARA-9 Is located on the center of the concrete pavement on top of a small mountain (former military camp), about 1.5 km. from Dipawan Bridge going to Bongabong. It is situated approx. 30 m. S of the small wooden chapel, which is about 400 m. from Km. Post 190. The access to the top is the ruins of a concrete stair W of the nat'l. road. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 20 cm. x 20 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "ARA-9 2006 NAMRIA".

ARAYAT, 1905 Is on the solitary and conspicuous mountain of the same name ìrising abruptly in the N part of Pampanga from the extensive ìplains of the central valley of Luzon. The best way to reach the ìstation is by rail to San Pedro Magalang and thence through the ìbarrio of San Vicente, from whence it is about 5 hrs. walk over a ìtrail leading up to the mountain past the foot of a conspicuous ìcliff of white rock. At this point, the last water is found and ìthe trail continuous up the steep ridge to the summit. The entire ìmountain is heavily wooded but at the top the timber is not over ì15 m. in height. The station is on the N and highest of the ìseveral peaks forming the summit. This N peak terminates in a ìnarrow ridge about 80 m. long by 15 m. wide, running E and W. The ìslopes on the N, S and W are very steep but there is a sheer drop ìof about 100 m. on the E. The station is at the W end of the ìridge on a large fixed rock projecting about 0.5 m. above the ìground. Station mark is a drill hole and a triangle chiseled on ìthe rock. The timber was cleared to permit of a view of about ì270°, from Candaba to San Isidro. The remaining quadrant towards ìthe E is obstructed by the E part of the ridge, which is about 4 ìm. higher than the station.

ARAYAT ECCENTRIC, 1905-11 It was established near station "Arayat". The station is on the ìridge mentioned in the description of station "Arayat". The ìstation is on the highest point of the mountain at a distance of ì60.81 m. from Arayat, in azimuth 291° 2'. The timber was clear ìonly for the view to the E, but were it all cleared the station ìwould command a view of the entire horizon, except for places in ìthe valley close to the W. Station mark is a drill hole ìsurrounded by a triangle chiseled in a rock projecting 12 cm. ìabove the ground. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 1 m. below ìthe surface.

ARENAS POINT, 1904-06 On the extremity of Arenas Pt., the first long sand point S of ìCandelaria landing. It is about 2.5 km. due W of Candelaria. ìThe point is long and low with no sand hills of any height. It ìis covered back to the low hills with a growth of low trees and ìyoung coconuts. Station is on a little rise of sand about 21 m. ìfrom high water line and about 1.7 m. above ordinary high water. ìStation mark is a drill hole in a large coral rock set in the ìsand and projecing some 25 cm. On account of its low elevation ìit is likely to be changed by storms.

ASLAT, 1917 Is on the N side of Manila Bay, 5 miles N of the mouth of Pasag ìRiver near where it turns sharply to the W and on the E side of a ìnarrow passage called "Aslatan", which flows S into this bend. ìThe passage is well known as it is in constant use by bancas and ìcascos that cut through from the Pasag to the river that leads ìdirectly N to Sexmoan and Guagua. 140 m. N of station is a short ìstrait that connects the Aslatan River with the large river just ìmentioned. Station mark is the same as at station "Api" (which ìsee) and is in a small grass plot awash at high water, surrounded ìby small mangroves, 4 m. from the water on the W and 8 m. N of a ìnarrow estero that makes back but a few rods. Reference mark (see ìApi) is between the station mark and the corner formed by the ìsmall estero, distant 4.13 m., in azimuth 45°.

BACOLOR CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-59 Is a cross on top of the church bell tower of the Catholic church ìat Bacolor, Pampanga. The structure is on the W side of Ceferino ìJoven St. It is built of massive concrete and about 30.48 m. ìhigh.

BACUL, 1904 On a hill known among the natives by the same name. It is 5.6 ìkm., in azimuth 234°, from Masinloc church and is reached by ìtrails known only to the natives. Station is at an elevation of ì114 m., on the top of a small cleared knob or shoulder on the ìheavily wooded N spur or ridge extending up to Mt. Bakil, an ìisolated mountain 476 m. high in the Lauis Valley. The little ìknob is covered with grass and from a distance looks like a light ìspot on the ridge. Station mark is a drill hole in a large, ìirregularly shaped rock set in the ground with its top level with ìthe surface. Witness mark is a tree with a triangle cut on it, ì1.95 m. distant, in azimuth 290° 25'.

BAGSIT, 1904-53 2 km. due N of Bo. San Agustin, which is about midway between Palauig and Iba. Follow the main road N from Iba to the Bagsit River, cross the river and turn to the right along the N side of the river for about 1 km. to the little hill on which the station is located. A trail from the main road leads up over the hill passing about 3 m. S of the station. The hill is the only one nearby and is visible from the main road at the river crossing. The hill has 2 knobs on it, a wooded one on the S end and a bare one on the N end. Station is on the highest point of the N knob. Station mark is a drill hole in a large irregularly shaped rock set in the ground with about 8 cm. projecting above the surface. This rock is the only rock in the vicinity.

BALD, 1904-05 On the first rounding, bare peak E of Mt. Botolan at a distance of about 3 km. This peak is entirely devoid of trees. A trail leads from the valley E of Mt. Botolan to the ridge and to the station, which is at an elevation of 366 m. About 0.6 km. N is another bare cone-shaped peak considerably lower than the station. The highest point in the mountain range is about 3 km. E of the station and is considerably higher, at 738 m. elevation. Station mark is a drill hole in the solid rock on the highest point of the hill.

BALIBAGO, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìMasantol, Bo. Balibago. It is 1.2 km. NE of the junction of ìBulacus cut-off channel and Pampanga River, 30 m. from the S bank ìof Pampanga River, beside an acacia tree 61 cm. in dia. inside ìthe lot of Irene Sangil and 2 m. from the E boundary of the lot. ìStation mark is the head of a 4 in. nail embedded in a 10 in. ìcylindrical concrete monument on which is inscribed "PC&GS ìBALIBAGO, 1959".

BAMBAN SOUTH BASE, 1951 (29TH ENGINEERS) To reach station from Municipality of Bamban, procced S across ìBamban River approx. 1 km. Station is located on the first curve ìapprox. 1 km. S of railroad bridge and 1/2 km. W of Bo. Tabun, ì150 m. S along railroad tracks from Km. Post No.91, 0.87 m. E of ìE track and 25.4 cm. lower than top of E track. Station is a ìstandard Corps of Engineers bronze disc set in concrete 7.6 cm. ìbelow the road bed. Surface, R.R. # 1 is a concrete telegraph ìpole (painted with a triangle), azimuth 70° distant 2.30 m. RM #2 ìis a wooded telegraph pole W of track, azimuth 260°, distant ì11.41 m.

BANI, 1904-06 On the N side of Port Masinloc on Bani Pt., on the N and highest one of several small, low hills. It is about 0.8 km. N of the extreme end of the point, which is low and sandy. It is close to the coast on a low, rounding hill which was covered with high grass, bushes, and small trees. Another low hill to the S cuts off the view to the town of Masinloc. The station is on the highest part of the hill. Station mark is a drill hole in a fixed rock projecting about 8 cm. above the surface. Witness mark is a triangle cut on a tree, distant 4.57 m., in azimuth 138° 13'.

BATASAN, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìMacabebe, Bo. Batasan. It is 45 m. from the N bank of Pampanga ìRiver, 9 m. W of the dirt road from Macabebe which ends at the N ìbank of Pampanga River, and 9 m. S of an old public market. ìStation mark is a cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod ìembedded on a 25.4 cm. x 25.4 cm. concrete monument on which is ìinscribed "PC&GS, BATASAN, 1959". RM No.1 is a 3 in.nail embedded ìin the concrete slab at the foot and S of the middle concrete ìpost (one of 3 posts in line and parallel to the dirt road) of ìthe public market. The nail is held in place by a cement putty on ìwhich is inscribed "RM No. 1" and an arrow pointing to the ìstation, distant 16.16 m., in azimuth 157° 33' 20". RM No.2 is a ì3 in. nail embedded in a 25.4 cm. x 25.4 cm. concrete monument on ìwhich is inscribed "RM No. 2" and an arrow pointing to the ìstation, distant 12.85 m., in azimuth 296° 23' 40". RM No.3 is a ì3 in. nail embedded in the concrete slab of the public market and ì61 cm. S of the foot of the last post (one of 6 posts in line on ìthe S perpendicular to the dirt road), distant 16.31 m., in ìazimuth 65° 15' 0".

BBM-5
The monument is located in a large field known as the Tri-Boundary of Mangandigay, San Felipe and San Miguel.
Station mark is the head of 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "BBM-5; 2009; DENR/LMS III."

BEACH, 1905 On the beach just W of Bo. Apari which is about 3 km. S of ìCabangan. Between the barrio and the station is a river about 100 ìm. wide separated from the sea by a high sand strip about 75 m. ìwide. From the point where the trail from the barrio to the beach ìcrosses the river, in front of the S end of a high sand island in ìthe river, the station lies about 800 m. to the S. On the E side ìof the sand strip were 2 large clumps of bushes which were the ìonly ones in this vicinity. They were to the N of the station at ìdistances of 50 m. and 200 m. The station was 30 m. from the ìriver bank and 25 m. from mean high water line. Subsurface mark ìis a bottle buried neck down.

BENAS, 1970 Is located at the mouth of Palobenas River approx. 3.5 km. SSE of ìthe mouth of Pasag River in Pampanga. Station is the ìinteresection of fishpond dikes, and is further identified by ìbeing 8 m. SSW of a concrete sluice gate, 25 m. SW of a nipa hut, ìand 33 m. W of a bend on the E - W dike.

BINALAYAN, 1904-53 On a hill of the same name 7.7 km. due E from Iba church and 4.5 ìkm., in azimuth 215°, from Botolan church. Trails lead from both ìtowns. The hill is rounding and partly cleared, and stands out ìdistinct from the first range. One branch of the Bangcal River ìruns around the N and W sides of the hill. A tail on the W side ìleads from the bottom to the top. The top is a small rounding ìknoll with a few large trees and covered with high grass. The ìstation is on the highest point on a large rock projecting some ì75 cm. above the surface. Station mark is a drill hole on the ìtop of the rock.

BINU 2, 1956 Is located on the NE coast of Manila Bay and on the SE side of ìthe Bulacan River, about 680 m. from the church bell tower at the ìtown of Binungan, which bears N 23° E and about 925 m. SE from ìthe mid-channel of the mouth of the Bulacan River. It is on the W ìside of a N-S dike of the W most salt bed owned by Mr. Moises ìEvangelista. Station mark is a 1/2 in. brass rod embedded on the ìtop of the 30.5 cm. x 30.5 cm. concrete monument, "C&GS" is ìinscribed on the top of the concrete monument. RM No.1 is the ìhead of a 4 in. nail embedded on the top of a 17.8 cm. x 17.8 cm. ìconcrete monument with inscription "RM 1" and an arrow pointing ìto the station, which bears N 59° E distant 7.397 m. from the ìstation. RM No.2 is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded on ìtop of a 22.9 cm. x 22.9 cm. concrete monument with inscription ì"RM 2" and an arrow pointing to the station, which bears S 09° E ìdistant, 13.052 m. from the station. RM No.3 is similar to RM ìNo.2 but with inscription "RM 3". It bears N 66° W, distant ì10.480 m. from the station. Witness mark is a 6 in. triangular ìblaze on the trunk of a lone Camachile tree and located 8 m. N of ìthe station.

BLN-1 From Sta. Rita exit (38-A) at the North Expressway, approx. 40 min. drive from Quezon City, turn right; take the road going to Plaridel town proper, approx. 2.5 km. from Sta. Rita Exit; then after the town proper of Plaridel, approx. 900 m. is a road intersection; straight on; after the bridge over Angat River, about 400 m. is a road junction going to Baliuag and Pulilan town proper; straight on going to Baliuag town proper; after 400 m., turn right at a dirt road after the bridge; after 20 m. turn right again at the intersection over a culvert. Station is located at the W side of the dike, about 300 m. from the dirt road and dike intersection. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in the center of standard concrete block, 0.70 m. deep, 0.15 m. protruding above the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Sub-surface mark is a bottle set in a concrete block, top of bottle is 0.75 m. below the station mark. Reference mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in concrete blocks, 0.60 m. deep, 0.15 m. protruding above the ground surface and inscribed with the station name and RM numbers.
BLN-10 Is in Brgy. Tawiran, municipality of Obando, province of Bulacan.

BLN-11 Station is located in the province of Bulacan, municipality of ìBulacan, Brgy. San Jose. On the road's concrete pavement between ìthe Bahay Pamahalaan ng Bulacan, Bulacan and the Sta. Ma. ìAssumpta Parish Church, and at the tip of the pointed island ìpointing to the road leading for Malolos. It is situated 2.20 ìm. NW of the center of the pedestal supporting the Rotary ìInternational tablet. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set in ìa drilled hole and centered on a cement putty with inscription ì"BLN-11, NAMRIA, 1995".
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 14 47 41.07159 E 120 52 44.64815
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 46.92235 m.

BLN-12 Is located in the Province of Bulacan, Municipality of Bulacan, Brgy. Maysantol also known as Cupang. On the N sidewalk of the Cupang concrete bridge, 3.14 m. SE of the NW corner. Mark is the head of 4" copper nail set in a drilled hole and centered on a cement putty with inscription "BLN-12, NAMRIA, 1995".

BLN-13 Is located in the Province of Bulacan, Municipality of Paombong, Brgy. Poblacion. On top of the concrete roof beam of the Santiago Apostol Church frontage, 0.82 m. SE of the roof beam apex where a concrete cross is erected. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set in a drilled hole and centered on a cement putty with inscription "BLN-13, NAMRIA, 1995".

BLN-14 Is located in the Province of Bulacan, Municipality of Paombong, Brgy. San Isidro I, on San Isidro I concrete bridge. It is situated on the NW sidewalk of the bridge, 4.3 m. SW of the NE corner. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set in a drilled hole and centered on a cement putty with inscription "BLN-14, NAMRIA, 1995".

BLN-15 Is located in the province of Bulacan, Municipality of Hagonoy, Brgy. San Roque on San Roque Bridge. It is situated on the concrete pavement adjacent to the bridge W sidewalk, about 29.4 m. NE of the E corner of the Pamahalaang Barangay ng San Roque Building. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set in a drilled hole and centered on a cement putty with inscription "BLN-15, NAMRIA, 1995".

BLN-16 Is located in the Province of Bulacan, Municipality of Hagonoy, Brgy. Sto. Rosario. On top center of the concrete roof deck of the Sto. Rosario Church bell tower. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set in a drilled hole and centered on a cement putty with inscription "BLN-16, NAMRIA, 1995".

BLN-17 Is situated at Graceville Subd. about 10 m. SW corner of a house owned by Mr. Benedicto Pantaleon, 4.35 m. from the centerline of the road. Mark is a crosscut on top of a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in the center of a standard concrete block, 0.8 m. deep, 0.15 m. protruding above the ground surface, with inscriptions "BLN-17 STDM 1998". The station is intervisible with station BLN-18.

BLN-18 Is located inside the 500 m. square property of Ms. Gloria Lapitan at Block 16, Lot 7 Graceville Subd., Muzon, San Jose Del Monte. To reach the station from the town proper travel S toward Brgy. Muzon and then to Graceville Subd.

BLN-19 To reach the station from the Municipal Bldg., travel towards Brgy. Gaya-Gaya for about 3 km. until reaching a vacant lot owned by Vitarich. Station is located inside the Vitarich compound about 10 m. S of the N perimeter fence and about 20 m. off the main gate. It is beside a signboard and 15 m. S of the concrete boundary monument. Mark is a 12 mm. dia. steel rod centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 0.9 m. concrete monument and protruding about 0.5 m. above the gradeline, with inscription "BBM-13".

BLN-2 (LOST) Station is approximately 7.1 km. from the Tabang Exit up to the bridge at the municipal boundary of Paombong and Hagonoy, passing through the town proper of Malolos and crossing the three bridges. The first bridge is 1 km. from Tabang exit and fronting Malolos church; the second bridge to cross is in the municipal boundary of Paombong and Malolos, approximately 1.4 km. from the first bridge; and the third bridge is in the municipal boundary of Paombong and Hagonoy, approximately 3 km. from Paombong town hall. Then upon reaching the Y road junction, about 0.3 km. from the bridge, turn right and go eastward to the river, passing by the pump house. BLN 2 is on an open area on the West bank of the river and east of the irrigation canal. Accessible by 2-wheel drive vehicle in dry season. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. diameter brass rod set in standard block, 0.70 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Bottle set on concrete block. Top of bottle, 0.754 m. below station mark.

BLN-20 To reach the station from Brgy. Muzon, San Jose Del Monte, travel S on a barangay road leading to Graceville and Harmony Subds., continue further until reaching So. Patulo near Marilao River. For easy access try to contact Mr. Ricardo "Carding" Reyes who is the caretaker of the lot own by Sarmiento, where the station is located. It is about 20 m. on a sloping gradeline towards the river and 50 m. N of Mr. Carding Reyes' residence. Mark is a 12 mm. dia. steel rod centered on a frustrum of a square base pyramid with dimension of 14" x 14" and 20" x 20" and about 0.5 m. protruding above the gradeline.
BLN-22 No description
BLN-23 No description
BLN-24 No description

BLN-25 From Bulacan town proper, travel Southeastward along direction toward Obando Bulacan for about 8 km until reaching Bryg. Ubihan, Meycauayan. BLN-25 is located 6 m south of the Brgy. Ubihan boundary marker, 20 m S of the south approach of the bridge and about 10 m south of the centerline of the barangay road which leads westwards. Mark is the head of a3 inches steel bolt centered & embedded on a 0.25 m x 0.25 m concrete monument with inscription BLN-25 DENR 3.

BLN-26 From Bulacan town proper, travel southeastward along general direction toward Obando, Bulacan for about 8 km until reaching Brgy. Ubihan, Meycauayan Bulacan. BLN-26 is located on the west side of the road. About 15 m N from the NW approach of the concrete bridge. Mark is the head of a 3 inches steel bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m x 0.25 m concrete monument with inscription BLN-26 DENR 3.

BLN-27 From Obando town proper, travel southeast direction towards the road leading to Brgy. Dampalit, Malabon. BLN-27 is located along Navarete street, Brgy. Panghulo, Obando, Bulacan beside the concrete walling of the fisht pond, about 300 m west from Pinagkalian bridge. Mark is the head of a 3 inches bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m x 0.25 m concrete monument with inscription BLN-27 DENR III.

Sub-surface mark; none. Reference mark; none.

BLN-3A

BLN-9 Is in Brgy. Tawiran, municipality of Obando, province of Bulacan.

Station is located on the NE corner of Dirita Bridge (KM 163+470), on the E side of the Highway between San Narciso and San Antonio Municipalities. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 15 by 15 cm cement putty, set flush to the surface, with the inscription “NAMRIA, 1992, BM ZA-50A”.

BOA, 1950 On the W coast of Luzon, S coast of Triboa Bay, E of Grande ìIsland, Subic Bay. On a rocky shelf NE of Nabasan Pt. about a ìfoot above MHW. Station is a cross on a brass rod cemented in a ìdrill hole and surrounded with cement patty on a 50.8 cm. dark ìgray rock which is itself embedded in the said rocky shelf. ìStation is on the middle of an equilateral triangle around which ìis inscribed "C&GS BOA 1950". RM No.1 is a cross on a large ìboulder, offshore toward station "TRIB 1950" and about the same ìelevation as the station, distant 13.55 m., azimuth 185° 30' 37". ìRM No. 2 is a 50 caliber empty shell cemented to a drill hole NE ìof the station, distant 5.87 m., azimuth 254° 05' 12".

BOLJA, 1904 On a small knob or shoulder on the first ridge S of the point ìwhere the Lipay River leaves the mountains. The ridge or spur is ìheavily wooded, except this one knob, and extends up to the high ìmountains to the E. The place is called Bolja by the natives. ìThere is a dense growth of bamboo around the knob on all sides, ìgiving it a light colored appearance from a distance and making ìit very easy to pick up, especially when the sun shines when it ìshows as a light spot on the ridge. Station mark is a drill hole ìin a large fixed rock on the highest part of the knob, projecting ìabout 75 cm. above the ground.

Station is located in Brgy. Porac, Botolan, Zambales. It is situated about 100 m W of the Porac Brgy. Plaza and about 6 m NW of a house along Damayan Street. It is right beside the Purok marker. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground with inscriptions, "BOT-51, PRS-92, DENR-III".

BOTOLAN, 1904-05-53 On the highest point of Mt. Botolan which is a very prominent ìpeak about 565 m. high. It is 6.5 km. S of the town of Botolan ìand 3 km. back from the coast. Follow the trail leading up the ìmountain from the N to the first peak and thence along the crest ìof the ridge to the summit. The whole mountain was heavily ìwooded, but the top was cleared of timber to give a view in all ìdirections. Station mark is a drill hole in the top of a large, ìirregularly shaped boulder about 1 m. long and 60 cm. in dia., ìset in the ground lengthwise. The soil on top of the mountain is ìcompact brown clay and decayed rock.

BOTOLAN, 1904-05-53 About 5 km. from the town of Botolan, 2.5 km. S of the mouth of ìthe Bucao River and 1 km. S of Bo. Porac. At this point the road ìfrom Botolan to Cabangan is crowded out to the beach by a spur ìfrom the NW side of Mt. Botolan. The station is in the center of ìthe spur at a distance of about 70 m. from the road and about 100 ìm. from high water line. It is at an elevation of 47 m. The ìobserver omitted a description of the marks but the station is ìevidently easily distinguished as it was recovered without ìdifficulty in 1905.

BTN-1 (LOST) Station is located on the highest point of a small hill locally known as "Barbarin". It could be reached by using motor vehicle for about 2 km. along the narrow gravel road on the western slope of the hill leading to Sitio Damulog of Brgy. Daang Pari; on to the highway near Km. 13, where the road branches off from the main highway at Barrio Pandan. A trail in the northeasterly direction through the mango and bamboo groves leads to the top of the hill. Approximately 4.6 km. from the town proper of Orion to the foot of Barbarin hill; and approximately 10 minutes walk from the goot of the hill to the station. Orion town proper is approximately 2 hours travel from Quezon City. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set 0.10 m. deep in a drilled hole in a rock, with non-standard cement putty as shown on the reverse side (rock is 0.90 m. above the ground). Reference mark is RM-6 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a drilled hole in a rock, 0.30 m. in dia. and 0.20 m. above the ground. RM-7 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a drilled hole in a rock 0.80 m. in dia. and 0.40 m. above the ground. RM-3 is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a drilled hole in a rock 0.40 m. in dia. and 0.35 m. above the ground. RM 8 is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a drilled hole in a rock, 0.30 m. in dia. and 0.15 m. above the ground.

BTN-13 lost Station is located at Lamao Pier approximately 600 meters from Bataan Expressway road junction leading to Bo. Lamao. It is about 124 m. from the pier's gate and 10.6 m. N of the SE corner of the small jetty at the south side of the pier. Station mark is a 3" copper nail set flushed on center of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty with inscription " BTN-13, 1993, NAMRIA".

BTN-14 (lost) Station is located at Lamao Point about 500 meters south of Lamao Pier. It is about 35 m. south of the south bank of Lamao River mouth and 12.4 m SE and 9.6 m. NEE of the two nipa houses nearest corners respectively, located close to Lamao Point. Station mark is a 3" copper nail set flushed on center of a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument with inscription "BTN-14, 1993, NAMRIA".

BTN-15 (LOST) Station is located at Margaja Pt. and can be reached from Bataan expressway thru the dirt road leading to Brgy. Margaja approximately 1 km. from the expressway road junction. It is 2.6 meters west of Margaja Pt. cliff edge and about 60 m. NE of the barangay's house near the end of the dirt road. Station mark is a 3" copper nail set flushed on center of a 30 cm x 30 cm x 50 cm concrete monument with inscription "BTN-15, 1993, NAMRIA".

BTN-16 (LOST) Station is located on top of a small hill of Tobong Point and can be reached from Bataan Expressway thru the dirt road leading to Brgy. Pita,, Batangas II about 1.3 kms. from the expressway road junction. It is set on the concrete block which is part of the remains of Mr. Johnny Delgado's former rest house. It is 9.7 m. west of Tobong Point and can be accessed by passing thru the concrete stair of the hill. Station mark is a 3" copper nail set flushed on center of a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty with inscription "BTN-16, 1993, NAMRIA".

BTN-17 Station is located in Philippine Refugee Processing Center at barangay Sabang, Morong, Bataan. On the S side of the center's main asphalt road, about 58 meters SE of the Regional Resettlement Transit marker. Situated about 400 meters NE of the center's checkpoint and is 4.5 m. SE of the center of the road intersection. Mark is the center of the head of a 4 in. cu. nail set flushed and centered on a 0.30 m. x 0.30 m. concrete block with its top protruding 2 in. above the ground and inscripted "NAMRIA, BTN-17, 1996."

BTN-18 Station is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Morong, barangay Sabang, inside the Philippine Refugee Processing Center. It is about 80 meters north northeast of Lowman Youth Center steel gate, 60 meters north of the intersection going to the Vietnamese Cemetery, on top of a concrete box culvert about 1.360 meters east of its west edge and about 9.00 meters northeast of another gate. Station mark is the center of a copper nail set flushed on a drilled hole on the concrete culvert with inscription. "BTN-18, 1996, NAMRIA".

BTN-19 Station is located in the Philippine Refugee Processing Center compound at barangay Sabang, Morong, Bataan. On the N side of the asphalt main road, 7 meters NW of its centerline. Situated about 95 meters W of the ruined center's outpost, about 200 meters SW of the powerhouse, the first one to be found upon entering the premises and is about 1 km. away from checkpoint. Mark is the center of the head of a 4 in. cu. nail set flushed and centered on a 0.30 m. x 0.30 m. concrete block which is 2 in. protruding above the ground and is inscripted with "BTN-19, NAMRIA, 1996".

BTN-2 From Pier 15 at the South Harbor, ride on a Coast Guard Sea Craft and head SW towards Corregidor Island for 2 hrs. There are 2 piers on the island, on the N side and the other pier is on the S side. Upon unloading at the pier, travel W by motor vehicle going upward to Brgy. Topside, where in the Vehicle Traffic Scheme (VTS) structure and the Corregidor Lighthouse are located. Station was established on the NW corner of the overhanging flooring of the 5th floor of the VTS structure. It is about 13 m. high from the ground surface. A drilled hole 1 cm. wide and 1 cm. deep, centered in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. square cement putty, and inscribed "BTN-2, 1991, NAMRIA".

BTN-20 Station is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Morong, barangay Sabang, inside the Philippine Refugee Processing Center. It is about 60 meters north of the United Evangelical Chapel, 50 meters north of a Chinese Marker, 11 meters east of street crossing set flushed on the concrete pavement of the concrete box culvert and 0.845 m. northwest of the southeast edge of the culvert. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set flushed in a drilled hole on the culvert with inscription, "BTN - 20, 1996, NAMRIA".

BTN-21 Station is located in Philippine Refugee Processing Center compound at barangay Sabang, Morong, Bataan. To be found at the Freedom Plaza, on the concrete platform supporting the Carlos P. Romulo peace marker, 1 meter NW of the middle concrete support holding the metal marker. Marker is the center of the head of a 4 in. copper nail set flushed and centered on a cement putty with an inscription, "BTN-21, NAMRIA, 1996".

BTN-22 Station is located in the Philipiine Refugee Processing Center compound at barangay Sabang, Morong, Bataan. Situated about 100 meters E Lao Temple, 14 meters SE of the center of intersection of the compound's main asphalt road and the road leading to the partially ruined Community Sports and Socio Cultural Affairs Office. Mark is the center of the head fo a 4 in. cu. nail set flushed and centered on a 0.30 m. x 0.30 m. concrete block which is 2 in. protruding above the ground and inscripted with "BTN-22, NAMRIA, 1996".

BTN-23 Station is located in the Philippine Refugee Processing Center compound at barangay Sabang, Morong, Bataan. Situated 0.80 m. E of the W side of the 1.83 m. x 6 m. concrete block covering of an open drainage canal, about 14 meters W of the asphalt road and between NBHD 1 and NBHD 3 refugees housing. Mark is the center of the head of a 4 in. cu. nail set flushed and centered on a cement putty with inscription, "BTN-23, NAMRIA, 1996".

BTN-24 Station is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Morong, barangay Sabang. It is situated inside the Philippine Refugee Processing Center, on top of the slab roofing of a 24.27 m. x 112.80 m. x 4.0 meter high water reservoir, about 1.587 meters south of the northern edge, and 15.300 meters west of the eastern edge of the concrete reservoir. Mark is the center of the head of a 4" copper nail set flushed in a drilled hole on the slab roof of the reservoir with inscription, "BTN-24, 1996, NAMRIA".

BTN-25 Station is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Morong, barangay Puerte. It is situated on top of the concrete walkway of PAGSAKIAN Bridge (2-175), about 0.82 m. east of the northwest edge of the bridge, about 200 meters west of Morong municipal hall, 50 meters north east of a wooden bridge, 0.46 meter below the bridge paraphet and 0.30 m. above the asphalt pavement. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set flushed in the concrete walkway with inscription, "BTN-25, 1996, NAMRIA".

BTN-26 Station is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Morong, barangay Nagbalayong. It is about 600 meters northeast of the WELCOME sign, 4.60 meters northeast of the centerline of the highway, on top of the walkway of PAGSAKIAN bridge (KM 173.43) which is across the boundary creek of Poblacion and barangay Nagbalayong, 60 cm. from the south east edge and 54 cm. from the southeast edge of the walkway. Mark is the head of 4" copper nail set flushed with concrete walkway with inscription, PC&GS, BA-163, 1987".

BTN-27 It is located on an elevated ground NE of the MAFSA-PNP firing range (formerly-Camp of Presidential Guard of Marcos), about 0.50 km. E of Talaga Beach. It is situated on a cylindrical concrete pedestal, about 1.50 m in dia. and 0.30 m. high with a cylindrical base footing of about 3.20 m. in dia. and 0.40 m. high. Mark is a round gash made by a star drilled at the top center of an octagonal steel plate about 7.0 mm thick measuring 28 cm x 28 cm cemented on top of the cylindrical pedestal protruding about 5.0 cm above the top surface. "BTN-27, 1998" was inscripted at the surface near the plate.

BTN-28 Is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Mariveles, barangay Maligaya, inside the compound of the Jet Ferry Terminal landing, about 500 m. S of the Bataan Economic Zone Building. The station is about 30 m. S of the Jet Ferry Technical Building, 6.5 m. from the W side of the landing and about 2.12 m. from the S side of the landing. Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set flushed on the concrete pavement with cement putty and inscribed with "BTN-28, 2001, NAMRIA".

BTN-3 Is in the island of Luzon, province of Bataan, municipality of Mariveles, inside the compound of the Bataan Export Processing Zone. It is located on the rooftop of Hilltop Hotel, situated at the fourth concrete roofing, right of the entrance door when facing the facade of the hotel. Mark is a 1.5 cm. brass rod set flushed about 0.1 m. from the edge of the concrete roof with cement putty, with inscriptions "BTN-3, 1991, NAMRIA".

BTN-3001 From San Fernando City proper, travel for about 1 hr to reach Brgy. Gabon. Station is located at the intersection of the roads going to Letran College, Manila, Balanga and Abucay town proper. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscriptions BTN-3001 2007 NAMRIA.

BTN-3002 Is located at Orion town plaza, E part of Orion Municipal hall. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed on the ground, with inscriptions BTN-3002 2007 NAMRIA.

BTN-3003 Is located along the national highway at Northwing, NE of Golden Heights Subdivision and the waiting shed, approximately 30 m E of another waiting shed, about 40 m NW of Iglesia ni Cristo Church and about 50 m NW of Mt. View Brgy. Hall. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscriptions BTN-3003 2007 NAMRIA.

BTN-3004 From Mariveles Municipal Hall, travel along the road going to Porto Del Sur until reaching the rotonda at Brgy. Balon. Travel straight ahead until reaching the fifth island from the circle. Station is located on the W end of the island, about 2 m E from the said end, approximately 1 m E from the concrete footing of the lamp post and about 15 m S of the abandoned concrete house. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscriptions BTN-3004 2007 NAMRIA.

BTN-3005 Is located on the bridge which is the boundary of Brgys. Liyang and Diwa in Pilar. It is situated on the SE end of the bridge. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscriptions DA 97 1986 PUG 8.

BTN-3006 Is located in Brgy. Banawang on the SW corner of Limutan bridge, the second of the three concrete bridges along the Bagac-Morong National road of the said barangay. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed on the ground surface with inscriptions BTN-3006 2007 NAMRIA.

The station is situated at Brgy. Simoun, along the brgy. road approx. 300 m E of BTN-3008. The monument is made 20 cm above the ground surface with reference mark 1, 2, and 3.
RM-1 = 10 m NW across the road of the electrical post. RM-2 = 5 m N parallel of the brgy. road. RM-3 = 300 m E of BTN-3008.

The monument is made 20 cm above the ground surface with reference mark 1, 2, 3 and 4.

BTN-32 From the Layac intersection of the roads Gapan-Olongapo and Roman Highway, travel W to NW for about 420 m. to reach a concrete bridge. Station is located at the top of the concrete guide rail of the SW end of the said bridge. *Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, the surveyor must be equipped with a navigational grade GPS, topomap and compass.

BTN-33 To reach the station from the road junction in Bagumbayan, Bagac where the historical World War II landmark "Freedom Bell" is situated, travel NW along the general direction of the national road leading to Morong for about 1.2 km. until reaching Umagol Bridge. Station is located on the SE end of the Umagol Bridge, being the third bridge from the Freedom Bell. Mark is the head of a 10 mm. dia. hexagonal bolt embedded and centered on a concrete monument with top dimension of 30 sq. cm., with inscription "BTN-33, 2004, NAMRIA".

BTN-34 Is located in the town plaza of Abucay. It is situated on the S portion of the park facing the municipal hall about 20 m. W of Abucay Police Station, 100 m. SE of Abucay Elem. School, 150 m. NE of Abucay Church. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail centered and embedded on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscription "BTN-34, 2004, NAMRIA".

BTN-35 To reach the station from Limay town proper, travel SW towards Brgy. Duale for about 750 m. crossing Mariveles-Dinalupihan Highway. Upon crossing the highway, a steel fabricated sign identifying the said barangay is visible to which an overpass is prominent from this point. Head further E 50 m. along the barangay road until reaching the first intersecting road to a subdivision, turn left and locate the station on the E sidewalkk 5 m. from the corner. Station is located 40 m. E of the E end of the overpass and 120 m. NW of Shelltex gasoline station. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail centered and embbedded on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscription "BTN-35, 2004, NAMRIA".
* Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, the surveyor must be equipped with a navigational grade GPS, topomap and compass.

BTN-36 To reach the station from the crossroad in Ala-uli, municipality of Pilar, travel SW to W along the general direction of the Balanga-Bagac Highway for about 4 km. until reaching a barangay intersecting road which leads to the barangay proper of General Lim. Turn left and head S following the barangay road for about 1.5 km. passing by General Lim Elem. School until reaching the poultry farm lots in the said barangay. Station is situated on the W side of the road, about 100 m. S of the N poultry farm and 3 m. W of the centerline of the road. Mark is a 4 in. copper nail centered in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement monument, with inscription "BTN-36, 2004, NAMRIA".
*Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, the surveyor must be equipped with a navigational grade GPS, topomap and compass.

BTN-37 To reach the station from the main gate of Bataan Petro Chemical Corp. in Mariveles, locate an intersecting road from the national highway and travel W towards Brgy. Aleon. Thence, from the barangay hall locate Diversified Plastic Chemical Corp. compound to which a dirt road intersects this road and head for the mountain ranges. Follow the dirt road for a couple of hundred meters until reaching a Mango orchard farm. Station is located on the SE end of the orchard about 5 m. S of the centerline of the road. It is intervisible to BTN-38 about 200 m. N of the station. Mark is the head of a common wire nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument set protruding the grade line by 10 cm., with inscription "BTN-37, 2004, NAMRIA".
*Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, the surveyor must be equipped with a navigational grade GPS, topomap of the area and compass.

Thence, from the barangay hall locate Diversified Plastic Chemical Corp. compound to which a dirt road intersects this road and head for the mountain ranges. Follow the dirt road for a couple of hundred meters until reaching a Mango orchard farm. Station is located on the NE end of the orchard about 8 m. S of the centerline of the road. It is intervisible to BTN-37 about 200 m. S of this station. Mark is the head of a common wire nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument set protruding the grade line by 10 cm., with inscription "BTN-38, 2004, NAMRIA".

BTN-65 Is located at Brgy. San Pablo, Municipality of Dinalupihan. It is situated along the road leading to San Pablo Elem. School. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered in a 12 cm. x 12 cm. monument, with inscriptions "BTN-65 2004 NAMRIA".

BTN-66 From Abucay town proper, travel W along the general direction of the municipal road towards the Mariveles-Dinalupihan Highway. Thence, upon reaching the crossroad of the said thoroughfare, adjacent Abucay's Cafe, proceed W crossing the national highway along a dirt road which leads to Colegio San Juan de Letran about 5 mins. ride from the crossroad. Locate Gabon Elem. School further W and the irrigation canal which runs along the road. Station is situated 40 m. W of Gabon Elem. School and on the corner of the irrigation canal. BTN-67 Is located in Brgy. Sabang, 1 m N of the second bridge from the road junction going to the said Barangay proper Matico Creek. BTN-68 Is located outside the property of Bataan Nuclear Power Plant in Napot Point. It is situated on the N end of a box culvert, about 15 m E of the national highway leading to the Municipality of Bagac, 75 m S of km post 165 and about 200 m N of the main entrance of the said power plant. BTN-69 From Mariveles Municipal Hall, travel along the road going to Porto Del Sur. From Aplaya, travel by banca for about 45 minutes going to Aglaloma. From the shore, follow the pathway going to Sangalang residence. Station is located about 20 m N of the said residence, about 3 m N of the canal and about 5 m S of the barangay road. It is situated about 10 m S of the lot boundary monument owned by Felix Sangalang, Fernando and Domingo Malibiran. Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete monument flushed on the ground with inscriptions BTN-69 2007 NAMRIA.

Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete monument flushed on the ground BTN-70 2007 NAMRIA.
