Mark is the head of a 4 inches copper nail centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete monument flushed on the ground, with inscriptions BTN-72 2007 NAMRIA.

BTN-A Is located inside Orion Port, which is approx. 5 km. S of Orion Town Proper. It is situated 93 cm. from the E edge and 18 cm. from the S edge of the platform of the third bollard, counting from the SE corner of the port. It is elevated 27 cm. from the port's flooring. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in an 11 cm. x 11 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "BTN-A 2006 NAMRIA".

BTN-B Is located inside Orion Port, Purok 2, Brgy. Puting Buhangin, approx. 5 km. S of Orion Town Proper. It is situated 3.23 m. from the N corner edge of the port, on top of the platform of the first bollard, counting from the NE corner of the port and elevated about 23 cm. from the port's flooring. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in an 11 cm. x 11 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "BTN-B 2006 NAMRIA".

BURNT, 1905 On the shoulder of a prominent hill in the valley 6 km. W of ìCastillejos and 5 km. S of San Marcelino. The station is on the ìsummit of a knob on the SE spur of the hill at an elevation of 80 ìm. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried neck down in the loose rock ìat a depth of 60 cm. Station mark is a nail in the center of a ìpost 15 cm. in dia. The post projected 20 cm. above the ground. ìA stone crain 0.6 m. high was erected over the station.

BUWAN, 1970 Is located on the W side of the mouth of a river about 2 km. W of ìthe Pasag River in Pampanga. Station is the SE corner of the ìfishpond beside river mouth, and is further identified by being ì68 m. E of a dike intersection and about 150 m. S of another dike ìbend which is 60 m. S of a hut.

CAB, 1905 On the middle one of 3 small hills 1.2 km. S of the town of ìCabangan. The hill just E of the station is somewhat higher and ìthe one to the W lower. The ground slopes down in all directions ìfrom the station which overlooks the lowlands to the N and the ìcoast to the SW. A trail leads to the station from the main ìroad. Station mark is a hole 2 cm. in dia. in a large rock which ìprojects several decimeters above the ground.

CABAN, 1974 Is in Cabangan Pt., N coast of Subic Bay, Subic, Zambales, about ì0.45 mi. SW of Subic Church Tower. The 3 reference marks are ìdrilled holes on top of boulders near the triangulation station ìinscribed RM 1, RM 2, and RM 3 with arrows pointing toward the ìstation respectively. Station mark is a 1/2" dia. cross cut brass ìrod embedded on a rectangular concrete monument inscribed ì"TIMTIMAN".

CABANGAN, 1947-50 Is located on the N shore of Subic Bay, SW of the town of Subic, ìon the slope of the ridge of the bluff at Cabangan Pt. It is ìlocated at that part of the slope where it starts to form a ìsharp-edged ridge running down the water line, about 1/3 of the ìslope from the water line to the highest point of the bluff. ìStation mark is a cross on top of 1/2 in. brass rod set in a ìcement monument 20 cm. in dia. x 40 cm. in length buried with the ìtop 10 cm. above the ground surface. RM No. 1 is a nail centered ìon a cement patty, azimuth 151° 48' 12", distant 6.831 m. from ìthe station, and in range with the highest point of the bluff. ìRM No. 2 which is a similar nail centered on cement patty 5.23 m. ìfrom the station and in range with the S edge of the Town of ìSubic was not recovered. RM No. 3 is a nail on a cement patty ìabout the same elevation as the station, azimuth 207° 47' 42", ìdistant 6.368 m. NNE of station.

CAIMAN LIGHT, 1947-50 On the W coast of Luzon, on Caiman Shoal, on about the middle of ìPort Olongapo, Subic Bay. Station is the center of the concrete ìcylindrical structure painted white on top of which is a red ìlight.
CAMILING CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 The center of the bell tower of the church at Camiling.

CAMILING WATER TANK, 1968 On the W coast of Luzon, province of Tarlac, town of Camiling at ìthe poblacion, S of the town plaza, E of the public market and S ìof the main road leading to Dagupan City. The station is the ìcenter of the top of the concrete water tank. A public address ìis attached at the top.
CAMP STOTSENBURG BAND STAND, 1905 Is the peak of the roof of the band stand at the military post of Camp Stotsenburg.

Station is located in Brgy. Malimanga, Candelaria, Zambales. It is situated inside the lot owned by r. Marcelino Mora. It is about 6 m N of the road centerline and about 10 m E of the house. It can be accessed from the highway by turning right just after the police station when heading N. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground with inscription, "CAN-15, DENR-III".
CANDABA CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 Is the center of the bell tower of the church in the town of ìCandaba.

CANDELARIA CHURH BELL TOWER, 1904 The observations on this point were recorded simply "Candelaria ìchurch bell tower" but subsequent computations made by the ìobserver add the expression "southeast corner post".

CAP, 1905 On the beach about 650 m. N of Bo. San Miguel and 25 m. from high ìwater line. A line toward the NE passes just S of the gable of a ìhouse on the E side of the channel parallel to the beach, and ìjust N of the gable of a more distant house. Subsurface mark is ìa bottle buried at a depth of 1 m. below the surface of the sand.

CAPONES, 1906-77 On the W coast of Luzon, Province of Zambales, Municipality of ìSan Antonio, about 1.5 km. SW of Bo. Pundakit. Station is in the ìhighest point of Capones Pt., about 3 m. from the corner of the ìbluff. To reach the station, take a motorized banca from Bo. ìPundakit and land directly on the NE side of Capones Pt. which is ìthe best approach. Station mark is the center of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod drilled and cemented on a 30 cm. x 90 cm. hard rock, ìinscribed by a 12 cm. triangle and marked "CAPONES, 1906".

CAPONES LIGHTHOUSE, 1905-06 The center of the top of the lantern on the tower of the ìlighthouse on Capon Grande Island. The tower is a square one of ìred brick rising from the NE corner of the keeper's dwelling on ìthe hillside near the W end of the island.

CATALINA, 1946-49 Is located on the N side of Manila Bay about 12.32 km. N of the ìmouth of Pasag River and about 2.52 km. S of Sexmoan. The station ìis on the left bank of the river going upstream and is on the N ìside of the top of a concrete sluice gate about 6.096 m. N of a ìnipa house. Station mark is a 3/4 in. dia. drill hole 5.1 cm. ìdeep inside an equilateral triangle etched on top of the concrete ìsluice gate. From the station, Sexmoan Church bears N 34° E.

CATUNO, 1905-11 Is on the highest of the bare ridge of mountains in the foothills ìabout 8 km. WNW from Bo. Dolores in the municipality of Porac. ìBo. Dolores is about 15 km. from Angeles, over a good road. A ìgood trail leads through Bo. Banaba and thence up the ridge to ìthe station. The ridge is just to the S of a stream passing N of ìBo. Dolores and is entirely bare of trees, being covered with a ìheavy growth of cogon. The surrounding hills are inhabited by ìNegritos. The general locality of the station may best be ìdetermined by the following azimuths: Camp Stotsenburg bandstand, ì226° 47'; Angeles Church, S tower 265° 7'; Porac church bell ìtower, 303° 36'; Floridablanca Church, W bell tower 336° 39'. ìStation mark is a drill hole at the center of a triangle cut into ìthe top surface of a large irregularly shaped rock weighing some ì500 kg. This rock was placed with its top projecting about 15 ìcm. above the ground. Subsurface mark is the center of the mouth ìof a bottle buried 0.9 m. below the ground. Reference mark is a ìdrill hole in a fixed rock with a chiseled arrow pointing to the ìstation. The hole is 5.26 m. from the station, in azimuth 228° ì35'.

CAYUAG, 1947-50 On the N shore of Subic Bay, at Cayuag Pt. N of the mouth of ìCayuag River, about 10 m. back of the prominent vertical face of ìthe point. It is located about midway on the slope from the ìhighest point of the bluff to the water line. Station mark is a ìcross mark on top of a 1/2 in. brass rod set in a concrete ìcylindrical monument 18 cm. in dia. x 50 cm. in length buried ìwith its top 20 cm. above the ground surface. The rod is ìcircumscribed by an equilateral triangle and the inscription ì"C&GS 1947". RM No. 1 was found dugged and lying on a side ìnearby. RM No. 2 is a 4 in. nail on the center of a 3 in. ìequilateral triangle blazed on a tree about 25.4 cm. in dia. ìazimuth 151° 33' 41", 3.94 m. from the station in range with the ìhighest point of the bluff. RM No. 3 is similar to RM No. 1, ìdistant 12.985 m., azimuth 159° 56' 21.4".

CAYUAN, 1974 At the E side of Cayuan Pt., NWmost side of Subic bay, W coast of ìLuzon. Station mark is a cross-cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded on the biggest rock (awash at high water) in a ìgroup of 3 about 10 m. seaward from the high water line. There ìare no accompanying inscriptions except on 2-28-74.
CHAPEL, 1947-50 Station is the center of the top of the cross of the Navy Chapel, ìU.S.N.O.B., Ologanpo, Zambales.

CHIQUITA BEACON, 1908-47-50 The beacon is the front or W mark on the range defining the N end ìof the measured mile course in Subic Bay. It is at the top and ìclose to the rounding edge of the low bluff at the extreme SW ìpart of Chiquita Island. It is on the N side of slightly rounded ìpoint where the contours project westward a few meters beyond the ìgeneral line of the W side of the island. The entire S end of ìthe island was cleared of trees and bushes as the line of sight ìto Camayan passes over Chiquita Island very close to the ground, ìwhen viewed from the bridge of a small vessel on the measured ìmile. On the highest part of the island is a triangulation ìstation established by the Navy and called "Chiquita". It was ìmarked by a pipe set in the center of a concrete block 30 cm. ìsquare set flush with the ground. Station is 50.05 m., in ìazimuth 68° 54' from "Chiquita". Station mark is a nail set in ìthe center of a galvanized iron nail filled with cement and ìburied nearly flush, in a foundation of concrete. Large holes ìwere broken in the bottom of the nail to insure the continuity in ìthe pail and in the foundation.

CLIFF, 1904 About 2 km. due E from the mouth of the Uacon River and the ìBo. Lucapon and about 2 km. NE of the center of the large lake ìformed by the river. It is on top of the most southeasterly hill ìin the barrio. The hill is 100 m. high and is bare of trees ìexcept for a few large scattered ones NE of the station. The S ìside of the hill is an abrupt cliff about 30 m. high, while the N ìside is very steep and covered with tall grass. About 40 m. NE ìof the station, the hill is some 3 m. higher and has large trees ìon it. Station is on a rocky ledge which forms the backbone of ìthe hill. Station mark is a drill hole 8 cm. deep in the solid ìledge. Witness mark is a triangle cut on a large tree, distant ì14.86 m., in azimuth 232° 47'.
CON, 1947-50 Is located at the center of the green light located on the immediate SE of Alava Dock, Port Olongapo, Zambales.
CONCEPCION CHURCH NBT, 1905-53 The center of the northern bell tower of the church in the town ìof Concepcion.

CONE, 1904 About 5 km. ESE of Candelaria in the E part of Bo. Babancal, on top of a sharp, conical, rocky peak almost bare of trees. The hill shows brown from the W being covered with tall grass. The road running E from Candelaria leads into a good trail or wood road about 5 km. out of town. This trail leads into the mountains beyond the station and passes close to the foot of the peak, leaving it on the N. The upper 15 m. of the cone is almost a solid rock, forming a sharp cliff on the E side. Station mark is drill hole on the highest part of the rock.

COW, 1953 To reach station from Camp O'Donnell, proceed SW along artillery ìroad for 2.08 km. to the base of the hill on W side of road. ìStation is located on the highest point of a very prominent hill ìcovered with cogon grass. Station mark is a pipe driven in the ìground with a plug in the top.

CROOK, 1905 At a distance of 1.3 km. SW of the church at San Antonio and on the northernmost prong of the mountain. The station is on the edge of the highest bluff in this vicinity at an elevation of 65 m. and overlooks the Pamatuan River at the ford on the road from San Antonio to Pundaquit. Station mark is a hole in the rock, with a cairn of stones erected over it.

CUBI 2, 1947-50 Is located on the E side of Subic Bay, Zambales, at the highest ìpoint of the bluff at Cubi Pt., W of Bo. Banican. It is located ì2.70 m. E of the W edge and 2.80 m. S of the N edge of the bluff ìabout 35 m. high of nearly vertical clay precipice. Between the ìstation and the N edge of the bluff is an excavation evidently ìused as foxhole which is not partly covered with dirt and twigs. ìStation mark is the pointed end of a nail set in a cement block ì30 cm. square buried into the ground with surface slightly ìcovered with dirt. The nail is circumscribed by a 3 in. ìequilateral triangle and the inscriptions "C.G.S. 1947 CUBI 2". ìA trail leads from Bo. Banican to the station, passing through a ìburial ground which is about 30 cm. E of station.
CUPOLA, 1917 Is the cupola of the wine factory at San Esteban, N of Manila ìBay.

TRC-4023 (CVGR-23)
From 600 Air Force Base travel southeast going to Brgy. Maruglo with the aide of a handheld GPS. From barangay proper walk for about 3 hours going to station 23 located at the top of a hill.
Marked is the head of a 4" concrete nail centered on a 30cm. x 30cm. concrete block mark with "CVGR-23; 2009; PAF."

DAO, 1959 Is on the NE coast of Manila Bay, on the E bank of Guagua River ìabout 1.7 km. from the junction of Pasag River and Guagua River, ìon top of a fishpond dike belonging to Mr. Roman Santos about 40 ìm. S of the concrete sluice gate of the said fishpond. Subsurface ìmark is the top of a Coca-Cola bottle set in an upright position ìin a 15.2 cm. square concrete monument embedded in 91.4 cm. below ìthe ground surface. Surface mark is the center of the cross on ìtop of a 3/8 in. dia. brass rod set in a standard concrete ìmonument with the inscription "DAO, 1959, PC&GS". RM No.1 is the ìtop center of a 3/8 in. cm. brass rod embedded in a drilled hole ìat the SE corner of the concrete sluice gate surrounded with ìcement putty. Inscription is "RM 1" and an arrow pointing towards ìthe station, distant 40.57 m. from the station. RM No.2 is the ìcenter of a 3 in. nail set in a 15.2 cm. square concrete ìmonument, 45.45 m. from the station with the inscription "RM 2" ìand an arrow pointing towards the station. RM No.3 is the center ìof a 3 in. nail set in a 15.2 cm. square concrete monument 24.475 ìm. from the station with the inscription "RM 3" and an arrow ìpointing towards the station.

DEAD TREE, 1908 On the first ridge N of Subic Bay Lighthouse. At the bottom of ìthe ridge are a number of small rocks jutting out into the sea of ìthe same nature as those at Shark's Pt. but very small in ìcomparison. The station is on the first shoulder of the ridge ìabove sea level. Shark's Rock is visible on the beach to the N. ìA large dead tree trunk, prominent from the lighthouse, stand 6.7 ìm. S of the station, leaning over the crest of the hill. Directly ìup the ridge about 45 m. away is a large pine. Another large pine stands off to the left 25 m. away. Station mark is a 3 cm. ìpipe set in the center of a 23 cm. concrete cube. 2 large, ìblack, outcropping rocks subtending at the station an angle of ìabout 100° are marked with arrow pointing in the direction of the ìstation. Their distances and approx. directions are 8.56 m., in ìazimuth 50°, and 22.07 m., in azimuth 150°.

DEL CARMEN WEST SMOKE STACK, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìFloridablanca, Bo. del Carmen. It is best reached by way of a ìdirt road from Km. 82.9 running in a N direction for about 3.5 ìkm. It is 20 m. S of a similar stack. Mark is the top center of ìthe Pasumil N smoke stack. The structure is built of riveted ìsteel plates painted black and is about 57.915 m. high.

DIVIDE, 1905 Near the seaward extremity of the ridge which passes 3 km. NE of the town of San Felipe and approaches the beach at the same distance N of the town. The station is 0.6 km. from the beach. It is on the clump of hills just W of the point where the main road crosses the divide. It is near the extremity of the SW arm of these hills and is a little below the highest part of this arm. As the surrounding ground was covered only with grass, no adjacent objects for reference were available, but the station can be easily found. It was on a narrow rock, 75 cm. long in a N and S direction, and tapering from a breadth of 12 cm. at its S end to 8 cm. at the middle which breadth also continuous to its N end. The rock projected 20 cm. above the ground. Station mark is a drill hole at the lowest point of its upper surface about 1/3 of its length from the N end.
DOLORES CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 Is the center of the bell tower of the church in Bo. Dolores in ìthe municipality of Porac. It is about 3.1 km., in azimuth 151°, ìfrom the Porac Church.

DRILL 2, 1904-53 On the highest point of the hill on the S side of Santa Cruz ìharbor. Station mark is a drill hole in a fixed rock. Witness ìmarks are triangles cut on 2 trees at distances of 6.82 m. and ì10.67 m., in azimuths 65° 20' and 101° 49', respectively. RM No. ì1 is the S end of pier, azimuth 34°. RM No. 2 is the S end of a ìruined water tank stand, distant 11.887 m., azimuth 118°. RM No. ì3 is a small rock, distant 10.058 m. azimuth 208°.

FAM, 1971 Is located on the highest point of Familiar Peak, a wooded peak ì244 m. high, 4.6 km. due E from Olongapo and about 1.2 km. of a ìtrail from Bo. Bangal Bridge which borders the provinces of ìBataan and Zambales, at the center of a small plateau forming the ìsummit of the peak. Station mark is a drill hole on a fixed rock ìabout 0.4 m. in dia. and projecting 0.15 m. above the ground. RM ìNo. 1 is a drill hole on a fixed rock 6.92 m. N of the station. ìRM No. 2 is a similar mark set 4.38 m. NE of the station. RM No. ì3 is a similar mark set 6.49 m. SE of the station.
FLORIDABLANCA CHURCH WEST BELL TOWER, 1905 Is an unchecked point at the center of the W tower of the church ìin the town of Floridablanca.

FRAILE, 1906 On the most W rock of the Fraile group. This rock is longest in ìan E and W direction and runs to a point at its W extremity. The ìstation is 8.5 m. from the most W point of the rock. Station ìmark is 2.5 cm. drill hole 2.5 cm. deep in the solid rock. A ìshallow triangle was cut on the rock surrounding the drill hole.

G-14A The station is approximately 130 m NW of Gate 14. Marked at the center of the head of a 4" concrete nail embedded on a10 x 10 x 100 cm concrete monument protruding about 20 cm above the ground and with inscription G-14A.

G-14B The station is approximately 120 m NW of gate 14. Marked at the center of the head of a 4" concrete nail embedded on a 10 x 10 x 100 cm concrete monument protruding about 20 cm above the ground and with inscription G-14B.

GAVIOTA, 1947-50 Is located in Subic Bay, 1.2 km. SE of the mouth of Matagan River, on the highest point of Gaviota Rock. Station mark is a 2 cm. drill hole on the top of the highest boulder, 1.219 m. above the high water line. RM No. 1 is a nail in cement patty distant 2.93 m. from the station and marked "RM 1" with an arrow pointing to the station. RM No.2 is a nail in a cement patty distant 4.30 m. from the station and marked "RM 2" with an arrow pointing to the station.
GERONA CONVENT, NORTH GABLE, 1905 The gable at the northerly end of the roof of the convent ìbuilding in the town of Gerona.

GONO, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìMasantol, Bo. Bebe. It is 495 m. W of the junction of Pampanga ìand Pulo Rivers, 240 m. N of Bo. Bebe Elem. School, 30 m. from ìthe N bank of Pampanga River, 30 m. SE of a rice mill and beside ìa camachile 40 cm. in dia. inside the lot of Cipriano Lacap. ìStation mark is the head of a 4 in. nail embedded in a 25.4 cm. ìcylindrical concrete monument with inscriptions "PC&GS, GONO, ì1959".

GRANDE 2, 1974 On the W coast of Luzon, Subic Bay at Grande Island. It is on the N shore of Grande Island, W of the pier, at the inshore end of a rock-filled breakwater and about 20 m. N of an abandoned building apparently being used as stockade by the U.S. Navy. Mark is a cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded in a 25.4 cm. x 25.4 cm. concrete monument. "GRANDE 2, 1974" is inscribed on top of the monument. RM No. 1 is the head of a nail, embedded on a drilled hole in a rock with cement putty at the inshore end of the breakwater, distant 24.785 m., azimuth 229° 21' 19.6". RM No. 2 is the head of a nail embedded on a concrete monument, distant 99.96 m., azimuth 278° 42' 19.6" with an arrow pointing toward the station and marked RM 2. RM No. 3 is a punched hole at the intersection of a cross cut on the end wall of the abandoned Navy stockade building, distant 21.945 m., azimuth 30° 05' 29.6".

GRANDE ISLAND LIGHT HOUSE, 1947-50 On the W coast of Luzon, on Grande Island, the station is the center of the Lighthouse on the NW side of Grande Island, at the entrance to Subic Bay. The light structure is a steel column support on a square concrete foundation.

GUAGUA CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-59 Is the cross on the bell tower of the Catholic Church at Guagua ìlocated in the town square, S of the public plaza. The church is ìbuilt of massive concrete painted light blue and is about 32.004 ìm. high.

GUAGUA STANDPIPE, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìGuagua, Bo. San Nicolas, and 14.935 m. N of the national road ìabout 500 m. before reaching the poblacion from Bacolor. Mark is ìthe top center of the cylindrical concrete standpipe, about 32 m. ìhigh.

GUIN, 1950 Is on the W tip of the point of land which forms the S side of ìPort Silanguin. It is on the hillside at an elevation approx. ì12.19 m. and 30.48 m. S of a triangular shaped group of trees ìwhich is located on the shoreline. Station marker is a 6 in. ìsquare rock with a cross chiseled on its face. A cairn of loose ìrocks was placed over station.

GUMI, 1917 Is on the N side of Manila Bay, on the NW bank of the river ìtraversed by the Yangco Steamer in its weekly trip between Orani ìand Guagua, about 6 miles up the river from Orani and 1-1/2 miles ìdown from Bo. Gumi. It is 1 mile above the sharp bend where the ìriver course changes abruptly from the S to NW, which section of ìriver is known locally as "Caylugan Pina" or "Misusu", and is 350 ìm. W of a branch from the N called "Caban Maragul". Station is in ìa small grassy point awash at high tide with nipa all about, 10 ìm. from the water on the S and 2 m. from the bank of a small ìblind creek which makes in NW. Station mark is the same as at ìstation "Api" (which see). Reference mark (see Api) is between ìthe station mark and the point formed by the small creek, distant ì3.18 m., in azimuth 305°.

HEAD, 1905 On the headland of the coast 0.8 km. NW of station Divide, and ì3.5 km. N of the mouth of the Santo Thomas River at the town of ìSan Felipe. It is near the highest point of the cliff which ìrises directly from the water's edge. The highest cluster of ìrocks on this headland was 2.5 m. NW of the station. Station ìmark is a 2 cm. hole drilled in a large rock projecting 60 cm. ìabove the ground surface. A cairn of rocks was piled over the ìstation.

HEAD, 1913 On the rocky point near the head of Silanguin Bay, about 1/2 mi. W of Bo. Silanguin. Located at about high water line among a great many large loose boulders. Station mark is a rod set in cement. A triangle is marked out in top of the cement surrounding the rod.

HERMANA MAYOR LIGHTHOUSE, 1906 On the top of a cleared ridge near the center of Hermana Mayor Island off Santa Cruz. The point located was the center of the light which is displayed from a white framed structure. The character of the light was altered in 1907, but this probably involved no structural changes in the tower or lantern.

HERMANA MAYOR LIGHTHOUSE, 1906
On the top of a cleared ridge near the center of Hermana Mayor Island off Santa Cruz. The point located was the center of the light which is displayed from a white framed structure. The character of the light was altered in 1907, but this probably involved no structural changes in the tower or lantern.

IBA, 1905 Is on the top of the small cone-shaped hill about 40 m. high ìlying about 2 km. SE of the town of Bamban and just E of Km. Post ìNo.91 on the Manila Railroad. The station is on the extreme ìsummit. Station mark is a drill hole at the center of a triangle ìcut in the top of a large rock. Subsurface mark is a bottle ìburied 75 cm. below the surface.

IBA NORTH BASE, 1904-05 Just back from the beach at the N end of the level area that lies between the town of Iba and the beach. This area is about 1.5 km. long and 0.5 km. wide, extending along the beach. N and S of Iba boat landing it is level, covered with grass and without trees except at the extremities. Station is at the N end of the plateau, about 50 m. from where the brush begins. It is about 10 m. E of the edge of the bluff and about 30 m. from high watermark in what was a rice field when station was established. It is 5 m. S of a small ravine which leads toward the beach and on the prolongation of the straight road coming from Palanginan. Station mark is a drill hole in an irregular rock, weighing about 200 kg., set with its top level with the surface. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 0.9 m. below the surface.

IBA SOUTH BASE, 1904-05-53 In the S part of the level area lying between the town of Iba and the beach. It is on a slight rise of ground just before a dip toward the S and is nearly abreast of the cemetery and about 150 m. back of the beach. Station mark is a drill hole in an irregular rock weighing about 200 km., set with its top level with the surface. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 0.9 m. below the surface.

Station is located in Brgy. Palanginan, Iba, Zambales. It is situated near the S end of the Palanginan Bridge. The bridge is on the road going to Tampisaw Beach, and can be accessed by turning left from the highway just before AQG gas station. The monument is near the SE corner of the bridge, beside a concrete wall. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground with inscription, "IBA-58, 2007, DENR-III".

ISLAND, 1905-77 On the W coast of Luzon, Province of Zambales, Town of San ìAntonio, Bo. Pundakit. Station is located on the highest point ìof Capon Grande Island known as Capones Island to the local ìresidence. Station mark is a drill hole 2 cm. dia., 4 cm. deep ìat the center of a 20 cm. x 20 cm. rock. RM 1 is a drill hole on ìa rock distant 3.91 m. in azimuth 169° 46' 58.3". RM 2 is a ìdrill hole on a rock distant 4.34 m. in azimuth 312° 56' 28.3". ìRM 3 is a drill hole on a rock distant 9.65 m. in azimuth 41° 35' ì48.3".

ISLAND, 1970 Is located along the shore on the NE portion of Butubutubu ìIsland, about 5 km. E of the town of Orani. Station is the ìintersection of three fishpond dikes forming an inverted "Y" ìshape, and is further identified by being 26 m. W of the bend of ìthe E dike. Station is also 110 m. S of the house on the N dike ìand 150 m. W of another house located on the E dike.

JET, 1954-71 Is located inside Subic Naval Base, atop Mt. Maritan, at the side ìjunction of Boston Highway and Argonaut Highway. Station mark is ìa punched hole at the center of a capped 1-1/2 in. pipe set in ìand extending 20.3 cm. above the concrete. Marked - "JET - ì4-12-54 Elev. 148.33".

KALAKLAN LIGHT, 1947-71-74 On the W coast of Luzon, Province of Zambales at Subic on the E side of Subic Bay at the N shore of the mouth of Kalaklan River. Station mark is the center of the white, cylindrical, concrete lighthouse structure at Kalaklan Pt.

KALAKLAN POINT BEACON, 1908 On the hill immediately back of the extremity of Kalaklan Pt. ìThe point located was the center of a six-pointed star, 4 m. in ìdia., painted white with a black center 1.5 m. square. This ìbeacon is one of the aide to navigation in entering Port ìOlongapo.

KNOB, 1902-06 On the NE end of Hermana Mayor Island some 15 m. back of high watermark on a small sand hill which is the only one on the point. Subsurface mark is a drill hole in a small coral rock buried 1.2 m. below the surface. Witness marks are two triangles cut on trees at distances of 9.80 m. and 6.45 m., in azimuths 49° 16' and 132° 55', respectively.

KNOLL, 1908 On the first ridge N of Subic Bay lighthouse, about 150 m. above station "Dead Tree", and on the sky line as seen from the latter, The ridge here widens out and levels into a knoll which is the culmination of two ridges, one leading up from station Dead Tree and the other from Subic Bay lighthouse. The ground is higher than that immediately back of it so that it appears as a distinct knoll, in the center of which the station is located. Station mark is a 3 cm. iron pipe set in the center of a concrete cube. This cube is 23 cm. on each side, and was set flush with the ground surface. The stump at station Dead Tree is visible directly below. Looking towards the sea a little to the right of Subic Bay lightouse is another dead tree, distant 38.1 m. To the left of the lighthouse is a pine, distant 29.2 m. bearing a cross facing the station chopped in the bark. A prolongation of the line from the lighthouse to the station leads to a dead tree in a clump of young pines below the crest, 45 m. away. An arrow is carved on a black rock 21.64 m. to the W of the station.

LACAPON, 1904 About 6 km. S of Santa Cruz in Bo. Lucapon, near the N end of a low range of hills 1 km. E of the main road. It is on top of a hill at an elevation of 95 m. About 0.7 km. NW of the station is a higher hill (110 m.) which is heavily wooded and is the highest point of this range. ESE of the station about 0.9 km. distant is a wooded hill 78 m. high. A blind trail leads the main road passing to the S of the high wooded peak and up over the ridge close to the station, leaving it on the S. Station mark is a drill hole in an irregular rock set in the ground edgewise and projecting 15 cm. Witness marks are triangles cut on 3 trees distant 15.19 m., 8.76 m. and 6.46 m. from the station, in azimuths 228° 32', 313° 07' and 68° 42', respectively.

LAFE, 1905 On the highest point of a bare ridge about 3 km. SW of the town ìof Bamban and about 1 km. W of Km. Post No. 91 on the Manila ìRailroad. A stream runs along the S side of the ridge. Station ìmark is a drill hole in the solid rock on the extreme E end of ìthe ridge.

LAST, 1905-06 On the beach about 2.2 km. S of Bo. San Miguel and 1.8 km. N of Bo. Pundaquit. It is 200 m. S of the blind end of a channel parallel to the beach and about 40 m. from high water line. It is on the range defined by the low central portion of Capones Island and the gap between two small islands NE of the former. Subsurface mark is a bottle with neck down set 1.07 meters below the surface.

LAST 2, 1977 On the W coast of Luzon, municipality of San Antonio, on the ìbeach about 2.2 km. S of Bo. San Miguel and 1.8 km. N of Bo. ìPundakit. It is 200 m. S of the blind end of the channel ìparallel to the beach and 30 m. from high water line. It is on ìrange defined by the low central portion of Capones Island and ìthe gap of the two islands of Camera Island NE of the former. ìMark is a cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod set at the ìtop of a 10 in. square concrete monument protruding 4 in. above ìthe ground with inscriptions "LAST 2, 1977, PC&GS". Subsurface ìmark is a San Miguel beer bottle buried 4 ft. below the mark. RM ì1 is the center of a 3" CW nail embedded on a 14 in. equilateral ìconcrete triangle with an arrow pointing to the station. RM 2 is ìsimilar. RM 1 is 20.83 m. from the station with azimuth 194° ì10.4'. RM 2 is 17.61 m. from the station with azimuth 310° ì26.5'.

LEDGE, 1906 On the low ledge of rocks off the point at the S side of the entrance to Nazasa Bay. The smaller one of the Tabones Islands lies in azimuth 135°. The station is about 2.7 m. SE of the water and 0.5 m. NW of a long straight crack in the rock, running NE and SW. Station mark is a triangle cut in the rock in the bottom of a shallow cleft.

LOMBOY, 1971 In Central Luzon, province of Tarlac, municipality of La Paz, ìBo. Lomboy, about 6 km. NNW of the town proper, in a rice field ìabout 40 m. W of the house of the Bo. Captain Catalan. At the ìbarrio plaza, a dirt road leading to the station branches W from ìthe La Paz-Victoria road. About 500 m. from this junction is a ìconcrete sluice gate of an irrigation canal running parallel to ìthe dirt road. The station is 14 m. W of the sluice gate and 4 ìm. W of the W bank of the canal. Station mark is a 5 in. iron ìnail embedded in a concrete monument, 0.305 sq. m., 1.219 m. deep ìand marked "LOMBOY 1971 PC&GS". Reference mark No.1 is a 5 in. ìiron nail embedded in a concrete monument, marked "RM-1", with an ìarrow pointing to the station, 7.800 m. distant in azimuth 161° ì00'. Reference mark No.2 is a cross chiseled on top of a ìconcrete sluice gate of an irrigation canal, with an arrow ìpointing to the station, 15.310 m. distant, in azimuth 221° 10'. ìReference mark No.3 is a 5 in. iron nail embedded in a concrete ìmonument, marked "RM-3" with an arrow pointing to the station, ì7.570 m. distant, in azimuth 349° 44'.

LONG, 1905 On the summit of Mt. Panamulauan which is 2.6 km. NW of the town ìof Subic. It is on the southernmost end of a long bare ridge ìconsisting of a group of hills devoid of trees. The station can ìbe reached from either Subic or Castillejos and commands a view ìof the whole of the San Marcelino Valley as well as of the Subic ìBay region. A trail starts from the W side of the tidal estuary ìW of Subic and leads over low wooded hills and across rice fields ìto the base of the hill adjacent to the one on which the station ìis situated. Station mark is a nail in a hard wood stub. ìSubsurface mark is a bottle buried 60 cm. below the surface. ìWitness mark is a triangle cut on the only tree on the hill, at a ìdistance of 6.19 m., in an azimuth of approx. 230°.

LUAN, 1904-05 On the highest part of Luan Island which is a small island about ì2 km. S of Salvador Island. It is easily reached from Masinloc. ìThe island was covered with a thick growth of small timber and ìmuch cutting had to be done to open up lines of visibility. The ìstation was on the W edge of the summit, about 60 m. from the W ìshore of the island. Station mark is a drill hole in a large, ìirregularly shaped rock, weighing some 200 kg. set in the ground ìwith its top level with the surface.

LUBAO CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-59 Is a cross on the bell tower of the Catholic church in Lubao, ìlocated in the town proper. It is reached from Km. 82.9 on the ìnational road by way of San Nicolas St. in a S direction to about ì1 km. The structure is built of big concrete blocks and about ì33.528 m. high.

MACABEBE CHURCH CROSS, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìMacabebe, and in the town square. Mark is the top of the cross on ìthe dome of the Catholic Church of Macabebe. The structure is ìbuilt of stone blocks with G.I. roofing and is about 30.48 m. ìhigh.

MACMANY, 1908-50 On the W side of Subic Bay, Zambales on the prominent ridge ìleading down to Macmany Pt. At an elevation of about 250 m. is a ìprominent knoll below which the ridge divides into two well ìdefined spurs, one leading SE down to Macmany Pt., the other ìleading NE toward the mouth of a small stream emptying into the ìbay 0.4 km. N of Macmany Pt. The station is situated on the ìhighest part of the knoll at the junction of these 2 spurs. The ìstation is most easily reached from the Macmany Pt., going up the ìridge which leads directly up to the station which is always in ìview as the hillside is entirely bare of trees, being covered ìonly with cogon grass and black boulders. Beyond the station the ìridge drops to a sharp saddle before resuming its rise. The ìstation is in a little circular depression about 0.6 m. deep and ì1.5 m. x 2.5 m. in dia. Station mark is a drill hole in the ìcenter of a triangle about 20 cm. on a side, chiseled in the flat ìsurface of an irregular slab of a rock about 0.6 m. long x 0.45 ìm. wide. RM No. 1 is a porcelain plug embedded in a cement patty ìon a large boulder about 1 m. in dia., distant 8.20 m. W of the ìstation marked with an arrow pointing towards the station. RM ìNo. 2 is a porcelain plug embedded on a cement patty on a rock ìabout 1/2 m. in dia., distant 4.78 m. N of the station and marked ì"RM No. 2", with an arrow pointing towards the station.
MAGALANG CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-53 Is the center of the bell tower of the church of Magalang.

MAGDA, 1947-50 Is located in Subic Bay, on the E side of Port Olongapo at the ìW point of Magdalen Bluff. It is at the top of the bluff about 10 ìm. back and 25 m. above the high water line and 3.04 m. back of ìthe beacon which marks the range 62-1/2° (true) to enter the ìinner basin of Port Olongapo. Station mark is the center on the ìcross of top of a 1/2 in. brass rod set in a concrete monument 30 ìcm. in dia. x 40 cm. in length buried with top projecting 10 cm. ìabove the surface of the ground. RM No.1 is the center of a 15.2 ìcm. x 15.2 cm. wooden post of the beacon which is the front range ìof the range beacons used in getting into the inner basin of Port ìOlongapo, azimuth 51° 53' 07.5", distant 3.04 m. SW of the ìstation. RM No. 2 is the center of a 2 in. iron pipe set in a ìcement monument 20 cm. in dia., azimuth 175° 58' 47.5", distant ì3.14 m. N of the station. Top of the pipe projects 18 cm. RM No. ì3 is a nail in the middle of a cement patty, azimuth 274° 10' ì27.5", distant 7.16 m. E of the station. Station is best reached ìfrom back of the bluff.

MAHA, 1947-50 Is located on the E side of Mt. Redondo on the grassy and prominent ridge which slopes down to Subic Bay at Mahabitin Pt. between the old Submarine Base and Kalaklan Light. It is located on the first knob of the slope from the bay, about 180 m. back of the road passing at the point and about 35 m. above the high water line. At the station, Mayanga Light is a little to the left of Kalaklan Light. Station mark is a 4 in. nail on the center of a triangle on top of a cement monument, 20 cm. in dia. x 40 cm. in length buried with top 10 cm. above the ground surface. Subsurface mark is the center of the mouth of a broken beer bottle buried 50 cm. below the surface of the ground. The ground is composed of broken volcanic rocks and materials. RM No.1 is a nail on a cement patty placed 3.94 m. from the station and in range with the highest point of Pequena Island. The cement patty is marked "RM 1" with an arrow pointing to the station. RM No.2 which is a 1 in. iron rod projecting 20 cm. was recovered. RM No.3 which is a similar mark with that of RM No.1 was established SSE of station.

MALASIMBO, 1905-51 To reach station from Dinalupihan, proceed along the Dinalupihan-Olongapo highway for approx. 3 km., then by trail to the summit of the ridge. Station mark is a 50 caliber casing embedded in a drill hole in a large rock on the W end of the ridge.

MALU, 1970 Is located on the W side of the mouth of an irrigation canal ìabout 4.5 km. W of Pasag River in Pampanga. Station is the SE ìcorner of a fishpond located W of the canal, and is located at ìthe E end of a 70 m. dike on the S side of the fishpond. Station ìis also about 350 m. S by W of a house which is 150 m. N of the ìdike bend on the E side of the canal.

MANGASU, 1946-47 Is located on the N side of Manila Bay, about 10.4 km. N of the ìmouth of Pasag River, in Bo. Mangasu. Station is on the right ìbank of the river going upstream, on a concrete sluice gate of a ìfish pond 22.86 m. N of a strongly built house with sawale ìsidings. The house is known in the area as "the house with ìrunning water". Station is marked with a 3/4 in. dia. drill hole ì7.6 cm. deep set on the N side of the top of a 5.03 m. x 1.17 m. ìconcrete sluice gate with a 25.4 cm. equilateral triangle etched ìaround the mark.

MANIS, 1974 At Manisbaso Pt., W side of Subic Bay, W coast of Luzon. Station mark is a cross-cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod, embedded on a rock about 8 m. seaward from the high water line. Station is enclosed in an equilateral triangle about 5.1 cm. at the sides and with accompanying inscriptions PCGS, 1974. Manisboro Pt. is about 2.0 km. WSW of Pequeña Island and about 2.416 km. NW of Mayanga Island, Subic Bay, Zambales. RM 1, RM 2 and RM 3 are heads of nails of varied sizes embedded on surrounding roads and respectively inscribed as such and with arrows all pointing towards the station. RM No. 1 - distant 3.900 m., azimuth 127° 01' 27". RM No. 2 - distant 5.700 m., azimuth 98° 48' 47". RM No. 3 - distant 9.600 m., azimuth 10° 09' 37".

MAPAIT, 1904-05 On a small hill known among the natives by the same name about 4 ìkm. SSE from the town of Masinloc, and back of the small cove ìimmediately S of Roja Pt. It is about 760 m. SSW from Roja Pt., ì190 m. from the beach, at an elevation of 35 m. To go by road ìfrom Masinloc follow the main road S for about 5 km. to the third ìdeep cut through the hills. Just after passing the cut turn to ìthe right and follow the ridge. A trail leads to the station ìabout 0.5 km. from the road. Station is on a little cleared hill ìoverlooking the bay to the N. There is a nipa shack at the W ìbase at the water edge. Station mark is a drill hole in a large ìrock set in the ground, top projecting about 8 cm.
MARINE, 1947-50 Station is the center of the Marine flagpole located inside the ìMarine Compound at the U.S.N.O.B., Olongapo, Zambales.
MARITAN POINT WATER TANK, 1908 The station is the center of the conspicuous water tank on Maritan Pt.

MASINLOC CHURCH WEST GABLE, 1904-47 The seaward gable of the Masinloc Church. In 1938, a 3.048 m. concrete tower was built over this point. The church bells are now in this tower. For triangulation point may not be in the center of this tower. For triangulation purposes this point should be use cautiously. It is however, a good station for hydrography.

MAYANGA LIGHT, 1947-74 On the W coast of Luzon, province of Zambales at Subic Bay at the highest point of Mayanga Island. Station mark is the center of the white, cylindrical concrete lighthouse structure at the highest point of the island.

MECON, 1970 Is located on the E side of the mouth of Meycongcong River in ìBulacan. Station is the SW corner of a fishpond E of the river ìmouth. Station is further identified by being about 160 m. S by W ìof a house located at the end of a canal line with mangroves.

MENOR, 1904-06 On the NE point of Hermana Manor Island, on the grassy flat about 39 m. back or W from high watermark. Station mark is a drill hole in an irregular rock set with its top 8 cm. above the ground. Witness marks are triangles cut on trees at distances of 39 m., 31.85 m., and 33.42 m. in azimuths 168° 05', 295° 14' and 20° 21', respectively.

MID, 1905 On a hill 113 m. high on the N side of the San Jose River at a distance of 1.5 km. from the sea and immediately opposite the town of San Felipe. To reach the station turn to the E on the first trail N of the river. The station is on the highest part of the hill and near its S brow. Station mark is a drill hole 4 cm. deep in the rock. A triangle was cut on the bottom limb of a bush 10.52 m. to the S and another triangle on a tree 11.61 m. to the WSW.

From Rodriguez Town Proper, in the province of Rizal, travel towards NW direction for about 6 KM then turn left and travel towards NW direction for about 1.7 KM until reaching municipality of San Jose Del Monte then turn right towards SE about 1 KM until reaching Brgy. San Isidro where the station is established.
Mark is the center of a brass rod with cross-cut on top set flush at the center of a 20 x 20 x120 centimeter concrete monument with inscription "MMA-3065, 2008, NAMRIA". The station is located at Senator Manny Villar Property, about 6 meters east of the centerline of the road.

Mark is the center of a brass rod with cross-cut on top set flush at the center of a 20 x 20 x 120 centimeter concrete monument with inscription "MMA-3066, 2008, NAMRIA". The station is located at Manny Villar Property, about 3 meters SW of guard house.
From Rodriguez Town Proper in the Province of Rizal, travel towards NW direction for about 6 KM, then turn left and travel towards NW direction for about 7.9 KM until reaching Municipality of Muzon Province of Bulacan. Turn right and continue to travel towards NE direction for about 1.7 KM until reaching Municipality of Del Monte then turn right towards SE about 1.3 KM until reaching Brgy. Tungko Mangga where the station is established.
MONCADO SOUTH GABLE LARGE BUILDING, 1905 The southern gable of a large building, described as white with ìan iron roof.

NAGCABAN, 1947-50 Is located in Subic Bay, Zambales, on the S of Port Olongapo. It is at the NW extremity of Nagcaban Pt., 2 m. from the N edge of the cliff about 10 m. above high water line, and approx. 80 m. NE of steps cut into solid rock leading from the water line to the top of the bluff. Station mark is the center of a U.S. Navy benchmark brass disk set in top of a cement filled 4 in. galvanized iron pipe projecting 40 cm. above the surface of the ground. RM No.1 is the center of a cement putty placed about 10 m. back of the N edge of the cliff and 6.88 m. from the station. Mark "RM 1" with an arrow pointing to the station. RM No.2 is a nail set in top of a cement putty 8.62 m. from the station and in range with Cubi Pt.

NAULO, 1904-06 Between the towns of Santa Cruz and Candelaria on Naulo Pt., which is the first point S of Santa Cruz Pt. Station is on the highest part of a small, prominent, wooded hill near the end of the point. A trail leads from the road to the top of the hill. As there were no rocks of any description on the hill, a large irregularly shaped rock was carried to the top for a station mark. This rock was 30 cm. x 60 cm. x 75 cm., and was set on end with 15 cm. above the surface. Station mark is a drill hole in the rock. The station was recovered in 1906 and found as described, except that the rock was split at the drill hole which still remained distinct in the larger part of the rock.
NAVY, 1947-50 Station is located at the center of the Navy flagpole infront of the Administration Building, U.S.N.O.B., Olongapo, Zambales.

NAZASA, 1906 Near the end of the point at the N side of the entrance to Nazasa Bay. The station is not on the highest part of the hill but is on a shoulder between the highest part and the pinnacle rock visible off the point. It is at the top of the cliff on the W side of the point about 150 m. from its S extremity. Station mark is a rock about 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 60 cm. set in the ground leaving an exposed surface of 30 cm. x 60 cm. A hole 2.5 cm. in dia. and 2.5 cm. deep was drilled in the rock to mark the center of the station. Witness mark No. 1 is cut on a small tree on the edge of the cliff, distant 3.75 m., in azimuth 65°. Witness mark No. 2 is a triangle on a small tree distant 9.5 m., in azimuth 4°. Stones were pile over the station mark.

NEJ - 001 From Cabanatuan City proper, proceed northwestward passing ìPampanga River Bridge about 6.0 km. up to Mayapyap junction ìthence, turn right to gravel road NEward for about 1.8 km. up to ìstation location. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass ìrod set in concrete block 0.60 cm. and inscribed on top mark with ìthe station name. It is situated on 2.0 m. wide dirt road and ì0.30 cm. paddy dike intersection about 1.0 m. from North dike 3.0 ìm. east of west paddy dike, 40.0 m. north of gravel road leading ìto Natividad. Reference mark N38 degrees 30'W, 1 km. to water ìtank and S44 degrees 34'E, 1005.73 m. to 15 x 60 cm. cyl. conc. ìmonument mark NEJ - 001 - A.

NEJ-100 (NE 26) To reach the station from Rizal town proper, travel southwestward along the general direction towards Bongabon until reaching brgy. Macapsing; turn left proceed northeastward passing by brgy. San Esteban until reaching Canaan East High School, turn right and continue travelling passing by Gen. Luna Brgy. Monument until reaching Mala Creek. Continue proceeding along Mala Creek and turn left on the dirt road towards the Espiritista Chapel. Station is located NE of chapel. It is situated on the left prominent hills in the said area, about 200 m. E of NE 25. Station mark is the head of a 3 in. steel bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. concrete monument with inscriptions "NE 26 DENR RIII".

NEJ-101 (NE 27) To reach the station from Rizal town proper, travel northwestward along the general direction towards San Jose City until reaching the irrigation canal in Sta. Monica passing by the bridge crossing the said canal and the spillway dam. Station is located along the national road about 2.0 km. from the town of Rizal. It is situated about 5.0 m. W from the centerline of the road and 10 m. W from the centerline of the canal. Note that the monument is place just adjacent to the concrete pavement of the highway. Station mark is the head of a 3 in. steel bolt centered and embedded on a 12 x 12 sq. in. concrete monument with inscriptions "NE 27 DENR".

NEJ-102 (NE 28) To reach the station from Rizal town proper, travel northwestward along the general direction towards San Jose City for about 2 km. until reaching the irrigation canal W of the road passing 2 spillway dam. Station is located along the national road about 5 m. E of the road, 150 m. N of NE 27, about 100 m. S of the access road which leads parallel to the irrigation canal. Station mark is the head of a 3 in. steel bolt embedded and centered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. concrete monument with inscription "NE 28 DENR 3".

NEJ-103 (NE 29) To reach the station from San Jose City proper, travel northward ìto Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya for about 20 km. until reaching brgy. ìDigdig, Carrangian. Turn right and continue travelling eastward ìalong the general direction to Carrangian until reaching the DENR ìCheckpoint, thence turn right and proceed southward until ìreaching the nipa hut and rice field just before reaching ìMaringalo River. Station mark is the head of a 3 in. steel bolt ìcentered and embedded on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. concrete monument ìwith inscription "NE 29 DENR 3".
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 56 27.51530 E 121 0 52.11710
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 298.0900 m.

NEJ-104 (NE 30) To reach the station from San Jose City proper, travel northward ìto Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya, until reaching brgy. Digdig, ìCarranglan. Turn right and proceed eastward along the general ìdirection until reaching the DENR Checkpoint in brgy. Sipanyan. ìTurn right and proceed southward until reaching the nipa hut and ìrice field just before reaching Maringalo River. Station is ìlocated about 30 m. W of the road, within the rice field W of the ìroad. About 200 m. SW from NE 29. DENR personnel at the ìcheckpoint is familiar to the station. Station mark is the head ìof a 3" steel bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. ìconcrete monument with inscription "NE 30 DENR III".
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 56 22.80990 E 121 0 49.54210
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 296.1490 m.

NEJ-105 (NE-35) To reach the station from San Jose City proper, travel northward ìtoward Sta. Fe along the general direction of the highway until ìreaching Lomboy Bukid, NE 35 is located along the highway about ì15 m west of kilometer post 170 and about 50 meters north from ìthe concrete landslide support, and about 200 meter south of the ìboundary marker of San Jose and Carranglan. Station mark is the ìhead of a 3 inches steel bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m x ì0.25 m concrete monument with inscription NE 35 DENR R3.
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 51 51.36900 E 121 0 55.20620
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 221.05400 m.

NEJ-106 (NE-36) To reach the station from San Jose City proper, travel northward ìtowards Sta. Fe along the general direction of the highway until ìreaching barangay Lomboy Bukid. Station is located at the ìeastern portion of the highway near the boundary concrete marker ìof San Jose City and Carranglan. Mark is the head of a 3 inch ìsteel bolt embedded and centered on a 0.25 m x 0.25 m. concrete ìmonument with inscription NE 36 DENR-3.
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 51 58.05200 E 121 0 52.44760
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 222.37000 m.

NEJ-107 (NE-37) From San Jose City proper, travel eastward towards Rizal thence ìnortheastwards towards barangay Kalinawagan. Continue traveling ìeastwards towards Villa Marina until reaching barangay boundary ìmarker of Kaliwanagan and Villa Marina, NE 37 is located about ì5.0 m north of a the said market. Station mark is the head of a ì3 inches steel bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m x 0.25 m ìconcrete monument with inscription NE 37 DENR R111.
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 48 35.22900 E 121 2 36.51570
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 202.47200 m.

NEJ-108 (NE-38) From San Jose City proper, travel eastwards to Rizal thence to ìbarangay Kalinawagan. continue traveling along the barangay road ìtowards Villa Marina until reaching the barangay boundary marker ìof Kalinawagan and Villa Marina, NE 38 is located about 200 meter ìsouth of the said boundary marker. It is situated along the ìroad, east of which is a rice field and west are mango and ìvegetable plantation. Station mark is the head of a 3 inches ìsteel bolt centered and embedded on a 0.25 m x 0.25 m. concrete ìmonument with inscription NE 38 DENR R 111
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 48 28.30730 E 121 2 37.90160
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 201.99000m.

NEJ-109 Is located inside Cuyapo Mun. Auditorium. It is situated on the SE corner of the elevated concrete pavement and about 15 m. SW of the main entrance of the said auditorium. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 10 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "NEJ-109 2007 NAMRIA".

NEJ-110 Is located in the brgy. plaza, N of Baloy Elem. School. It is situated on top of an elevated platform, about 7 m. high, which is between the stage and the basketball court of the said plaza. It is also 1 m. from the E steel railing of the platform. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "NEJ-110 2007 NAMRIA".

NEJ-111 From San Jose City, travel along the highway going to Carranglan until reaching Poblacion Carranglan. Turn left to the road across the mun. hall. Then turn left again upon reaching the crossing. Follow the road passing So. Butolan Proper, then turn right to a dirt road across the waiting shed until reaching the basketball court/solar dryer of So. San Luis. Turn left to the road parallel to Deugurug River. Follow the pathway until reaching the residence of a certain Lito Mathew. Station is located on the land owned by the Esteban Family. It is situated on the riverbank about 15 m. NW of the river, 4 m. SE of the rice paddy, about 40 m. E of Lito Mathew's residence and 40 m. S of a Mango tree. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block protruding 20 cm. from the ground surface, with inscriptions "NEJ-111 2007 NAMRIA".

NEJ-112 From San Jose City, travel along the highway going to Carranglan. Upon reaching Poblacion Carranglan, travel straight ahead and follow the main road until reaching the welcome sign of Brgy. Conversion. Station is located on the brgy. plaza of Conversion, about 40 m. W from the road centerline. It is along the E side of the basketball open court, at the back of the SE concrete bench about 0.8 m. E from the N end of the bench. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete block protruding 20 cm. from the ground surface, with inscriptions "NEJ-112 2007 NAMRIA".

NEJ-113 From San Jose City, travel along the highway going to Carranglan until reaching Puncan Bridge I. Station is located on the NW end of the said bridge, about 0.5 m. SW from the headwall of the bridge and about 5 m. NE from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered on a 15 cm. x 15 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "NEJ-113 2007 NAMRIA".

NEJ-114 From Lupao Mun. Hall, travel going to Muñoz along the Lupao-Muñoz ìHighway until reaching the brgy. monument of Purok 2, Agupalo ìWest. Station is located along the NW side of the basketball ìcourt, SW of the highway. It is situated about 0.1 m. NW from the ìcenter of the NW side of the court and 30 m. NW of the said brgy. ìmonument. NEJ - 43 From the road intersection of Carranglan town proper and Bureau of Forestry seedling station; approx. 1.6 Km. from the steel bridge on Maringalo Village. Continue traveling on the dirt road, take right fork on road junction after 0.1 Km; take right fork again on another road junction after 0.15 Km., then take the left fork on road junction after 0.40 Km. and on the last road junction after 0.5 Km., take the left fork. There is an existing foot trail on the left side of the road that leads to the station on top of the hill, approx. 0.9 Km. from the last road junction. Turn left and travel along the dirt road to the foot of the hill for 250 meters and from the foot of the hill to the station is about 100 meters walk. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in standard conc. block, 0.70 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with station name. Sub-surface mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. diameter brass rod set in conc. block, top of brass rod is 0.78 m. below station mark. Reference mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. diameter brass rods set in conc. blocks, 0.60 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name and RM numbers.

NSD, 1947-50 On the W coast of Luzon, on the E coast of Subic Bay at the rocky bluff N of the bight at the Naval Supply Depot at Maquinaya, Olongapo. It is 400 m. S of the National Highway bridge crossing Matain River, 2.40 km. NE of Mayanga Island Light, and about 1.44 km. ESE of Asaan Pt. Station is located on the slope of the bluff about 15 m. back of its outer extremity and about 8 m. above high water line. Station is on the S of 2 bluffs on the locality. Station mark is the center of a 2 in. pipe embedded in cement monument 15 cm. in dia. projecting 10 cm. above the ground surface. RM No. 1 is a nail in the middle of a cement SSW of station distant 5.100 m. RM No. 2 is a similar mark 5.446 m. NNW of station. Station may be reached by road or skiff.

PAMPA, 1970 Is located on the W side of the mouth of Pampanga River. Station ìis the intersection of the edge of the mud tract and the fishpond ìdike, and is further identified by being 13 m. NE of the S corner ìof the fishpond and 56 m. SE of the bend on the dike.

PARINNIA, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìMasantol, Bo. San Esteban. It is 3.1 km. W of the junction of ìPampanga River and the Bebe-San Esteban cut-off channel, 1.2 km. ìNE of the earth dam at Bebe-San Esteban cut-off channel, 560 m. ìNW of a concrete check gate on the N levee and 280 m. N bank of ìthe channel, 1 m. SE of a pata tree, 30.5 cm. in dia. and 3 m. E ìof a small hut inside the lot of Mr. Fidel Isip. Station mark is ìthe head of 4 in. nail embedded in a 25.4 cm. cylindrical ìconcrete monument on which is inscribed "PC&GS, PARINNIA, 1959".

PASA RM 5, 1959 At NE of Manila Bay, at the E bank of Pasag River, 1.248 km. SE ìof Bo. Batang Segundo, Sexmoan, Pampanga, just outside the ìfishpond of Mr. Roman Santos. The station is located about 5 m. E ìof the high water line and about 12 m. S of the earth dike of the ìfishpond. Station is a 1/2 in. brass rod with a crosscut on top ìembedded in a 26.67 cm. square concrete monument projecting 61 ìcm. above the ground, 35.7 m. S 3.8° E of station "PASA, 1956". ìRM No.1 is a 1/2 in. brass rod with a cross cut on top embedded ìflush with the top of a 27.9 cm. square concrete monument on top ìof the earth dike of the fishpond. An arrow pointing towards the ìstation and letters "RM 4" are inscribed.

PASAG, 1946-49 Is located on the W bank of Pasag River going upstream. It is ìabout 500 m. S of a patch of mangrove at the mouth of Timas River ìwhich joins Pasag River from the W. Station is W of the tip of a ìmangrove swamp where Guagua River branches off from Pasag River. ìStation mark is a 3/4 in. dia. drill hole 7.6 cm. deep on the S ìside of the top of a 1.295 m. x 4.419 m. concrete sluice gate of ìa fish pond owned by Dr. Limpid. An equilateral triangle is ìetched around the station.

PASAG, 1970 Is on the W coast of Luzon, on the NW portion of Manila Bay, on ìthe NE shore of Pampanga Bay, on the W side of the mouth of ìSapang Tagalog River, a tributary of Pasag river about 640 m. W ìof Pasag River mouth. The station is located on the SE most ìcorner of the fishpond owned by Mr. Sabino Cruz, and on the ìfishpond concrete sea wall fronting the sea on the S and the ìmouth of the Sapang Tagalog River on the E. Mark is the crosscut ìcenter of the brass rod set on the concrete monument protruding ìabout 15.2 cm. above the concrete sea wall, with inscription ìaround the mark "PASAG, 1970, C&GS". RM No.1 is a brass screw ìembedded on the top of the sea wall, 20.4 m. W by N of the ìstation with inscription "RM 1, PASAG, 1970". RM No.2 is a brass ìscrew embedded on the top of the sea wall, 20.65 m. N by E of the ìstation with inscription "RM 2, PASAG, 1970".

PASUDECO EAST SMOKE STACK, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìSan Fernando, on the N side at about Km. 67.6 of the national ìroad to Bataan Province. Mark is the apex of the conical cover of ìthe Pasudeco E smoke stack painted black. The structure is built ìof riveted steel plates and is about 51.816 m. high.

PLAYA, 1905 On the beach at a distance of 1.2 km. N of the seaward end of the ìroad leading from the town of San Narciso to the barrio at the ìlanding place. The station can best be reached by a road ìparallel to the beach and just inside the first field of young ìcoconut trees. This road meets the beach at a fence at the N end ìof the coconut grove. PMG-33 From Angeles City Hall, travel northward along McArthur Hi-way ìfor about 3.3 kms., then turn left at the road junction leading ìto Clark Air Base main gate. After securing access pass from the ìgate, proceed northwestward up to Sacobia River passing existing ìthru Gate 14. PMG-35 From the highway junction, about 1 km. NE of Porac town proper, ìtravel NW towards Brgy. Dolores for about 3 kms.
