PORAC CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 Is the center of the bell tower of the church in the town of ìPorac.

REAR RANGE BEACON, 1908 This station is the rear mark on the S range for the measured ìmile course in Subic Bay. It is situated in the valley leading ìback from the beach of the cove immediately SW of Subic Bay ìlighthouse. From the station the lighthouse is in azimuth 277°, ìdistant 558 m.; and the station itself is at an elevation of ìabout 3 m. above the point where a line through the top of the ìlighthouse and the opposite shoreline intersects the ground ìsurface. The station is on a grassy sloping upward steeply toward ìthe NW. 5 m. W of the station is a very small dry bed of a brook ìfringed with small bushes, and about 20 m. NW of the station were ì2 large spreading trees close together, with branches extending ìhalfway to the station and giving the effect from the bay of a ìsingle large round tree. Station mark is a nail set in the center ìof a cement block which is moulded in a wooden nail keg, about 30 ìcm. in dia. The keg is embedded in the ground and used as a form ìfor the cement. Reference mark is placed at right angles to the ìline from the station to the lighthouse, distant 4.59 m. in ìazimuth 187°. This mark is the center of a 2.5 cm. pipe ìprojecting 8 cm. above the surface of a square concrete block 30 ìcm. square and 20 cm. deep, set flush with the surface. An arrow ìpointing toward the station was chiseled on a rock at a distance ìof 11.40 m., in azimuth 187°, or in line with the station and ìreference mark. A second similar arrow was cut on a rock at a ìdistance of 18.52 m. toward the NE. A wooded beacon painted white ìwas erected over the station, facing toward Subic Bay Lighthouse. ìAt the top of the center pole was an inverted triangle.

RINES, 1908 On the third ridge N of Subic Bay lighthouse, on the second ridge ìS of the valley S of Macmany Pt. This ridge leads direcly up ìfrom Shark's Pt., a large prominent rock jutting out from the ìshore into the bay. The station is on the third shoulder of the ìridge. In ascending the ridge the station is reached before any ìtrees are encountered. There are trees to the right and left in ìthe gullies, but none on the ridge. Looking from the station, ìCubi Pt. and the N extremity of Grande Island appear in line as ìare also Mayanga Island and the beach at Macmany Pt. Up the ìridge about 30 m. above the station is a short but thick and ìwell-branched pine. Beyond this pine the ridge levels into a ìshoulder. Here were a great many black rocks outcropping from ìthe surface, and a small clump of small trees rising from a mass ìof these rocks. Looking from the station one more shoulder maybe ìseen on the sky line. Looking up the ridge, another pine, taller ìbut thinner, stood off to the left 30 m. from the crest on which ìthe station stands. Three or four very small pines were ìscattered nearby. Station mark is a cement block 18 cm. x 20 cm.ì30 cm. deep, A 3 cm. pipe was set in the block to mark the ìstation center. Reference marks are chiseled on three large, ìblack rocks jutting out of the ground the arrows pointing toward ìthe station. The tips of the arrow are 18.26 m. WSW, 23.72 m. ìNNW, and 7.90 m. NNE from the station.
ROOF, 1901 The gable at the southwestern end of the convent at Santa Cruz.

Station is located on the lot owned by Mr. Jose Santiago, in the care of Mr. Alfonso Estrada. It is situated near the W bank of the Pamatawan river, on the E side of the lot. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground with inscription, "SA-16, DENR-III".

SAN ANTONIO CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 A flag erected on the bell tower of the church at San Antonio. ìIt was presumably central, but not so stated. The construction ìof the tower should determine whether any other location was ìpossible.
SAN FELIPE CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 The center of the bell tower of the church in the town of San ìFelipe.
SAN FERNANDO CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 Is the center of the bell tower of the church at San Fernando.

SAN FERNANDO CHURCH DOME, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìSan Fernando, in the central part of the town on the E side of ìthe national road to Bataan and about 10 m. from a point where ìthe above road turns W to the province of Bataan. Station mark is ìthe tip of the concrete cross on top of the dome of the Catholic ìChurch which is covered with plain GI sheets painted white. The ìstructure is built of massive concrete. It is about 31.395 m. ìabove the ground.

SAN LUIS CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 This point was observed from four stations, being called "bell ìtower" twice and "white dome" twice. It is probable that these ìtwo are the same as all the lines intersect in a common point.
SAN MARCELINO CHURCH, SOUTHWEST CABLE, 1905 The SW gable of the church in the town of San Marcelino.

SANTA CRUZ, 1905 On the W slope of the mountain which lies 3.5 km. ESE of the town ìof Cabangan. A clear, bald spot, devoid of trees and covered with ìgrass and rocks, extends up the middle ridge of the W face. ìStation is located at the head of this ridge where the ridges ìfrom the NW and SE sides join, about 50 m. below the brow. 15 m. ìfrom the station on a line tangent to the NE edge of the houses ìvisible in Cabangan there is a tall dead snag, which is the only ìone in the vicinity below the station. At a distance of 45 m. SE ìof the station is a big lone tree, while at a distance of 50 m., ìin azimuth 281°, is a white snag which is near the line of trees ìjust back of the brow at a distance of 60 m. from the station. ìThe station is in a cluster of rocks. Station mark is a 1 cm. ìdrill hole 5 cm. deep. Just below this station hole is another ìdrill hole distance 30 cm., but there should be no confusion as ìthe station mark is above the other.

SANTA CRUZ NORTE, 1904 On the first low ridge about 1 km. NW from the town of Santa ìCruz. The ridge ends in a low bluff on the first point N of ìSanta Cruz. The station is on the highest point of the ridge at ìan elevation of 22 m., NE of said bluff and about midway to the ìroad to Infanta. The hill is fairly clear of trees but is ìcovered with tall grass. Station mark is a drill hole in the top ìof a sandstone rock frustrum of a pyramid, set with 10 cm. ìprojecting above the ground. Witness marks are cut on 3 trees at ìdistances of 6.93 m., 34.08 m., and 7.35 m., in azimuths 98° 52', ì183° 22', and 30° 52', respectively.

Station is located in Brgy. Guinabon, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is located near the concrete stairs of the Nayom Dam, on the SE end of the said dam. It is about 10 km NE of the town proper. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground with inscription, "SC-11, DENR-III".

Station is located along the National Highway in Brgy. Pagatpat, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on the other side of the road from E4M Construction store, about 30 m W of the said store and about 6 m W from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground, with inscription, "SC-19, DENR-III".

SECOND, 1905 On a pointed, sugarloaf hill situated in the foothills 4.5 km. N ìof San Marcelino. A road leads from that town to a small barrio ìat the foot of the hill. The hill is 265 m. high and can be ìidentified as one having two streams of water near the base, ìflowing from springs on the hillside. The station is on the ìsummit of the knoll. Station mark is a hole 5 cm. deep drilled ìin the rock. A cairn of rocks 75 cm. high was erected over the ìstation.

SEMBRANO, 1971 On Central Luzon, province of Tarlac, municipality of Gerona, ìBo. Sembrano on a flat area E of the western dike of Tarlac ìRiver. The area is about 100 m. NE of the barrio elementary ìschool and is the only clear approach to the bank of the river. ìFrom Gerona, an asphalted road leads to Bo. Tagumbao, thence to ìthe E bank of Tarlac River. During the summer season, vehicles ìcan cross this river going to Bo. Sembrano. Mark is a brass rod ìembedded on top of a concrete monument 30.5 cm. x 30.5 cm. sq. x ì9.14 m. deep buried on the ground and protruding about 7.6 cm. ìIt was marked "SEMBRANO 1971, PCGS". Subsurface mark is the head ìof a bottle embedded on a concrete buried 0.914 m. directly below ìthe surface mark. Reference mark No.1 is a drilled hole on the ìedge of a large concrete footing lying flush on the dike, azimuth ì147° 43' distant 48.655 m. Reference mark No.2 is a nail on top ìof a concrete monument buried on top of the dike and protruding ìabout 5.1 cm. It was marked "RM-2" with arrow pointing towards ìthe station, azimuth 98° 25', distant 4.535 m. A line ìperpendicular to the dike through this point will pass through ìthe station and will approximately touch the end of a smaller ìdike about 20 m. E of the bigger dike. Reference mark No.3 is ìsimilar to RM-2 marked "RM-3" with arrow pointing towards the ìstation azimuth 28° 33', distant 9.519 m. A foot trail leading ìto the barrio from the beach of the river nearly passes on this ìRM.

SEXMOAN CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-59 Is the center of the bell tower of the Catholic Church at ìSexmoan, located in the town square, about 33.528 m. W of the W ìbank of Guagua River and S of the public plaza. The structure is ìbuilt of stone blocks painted white and is about 21.336 m. high.
SIGNAL TOWER GRANDE ISLAND, 1947 Station not described.

SILAGUIN, 1906 On the highest point of the 230 m. hill at the extremity of the ìpoint separating Nazasa Bay from Silaguin Bay. The station is on ìrange with the larger one of the Tabones Islands and Capones ìLighthouse and is 22 m. E of the cliff on the outermost side of ìthe hill. The edge of the hill is about 2 m. distant in a SE ìdirection. Station mark is a drill hole in a rock buried almost ìflush with the ground, leaving an exposed surface of about 30 cm. ìx 35 cm. In the bottom of this hole is embedded a piece of ìsteel drill which broke off while drilling. A shallow triangle ìwas cut in the rock surrounding the drill hole. Small rocks were ìpiled over the station mark.

SILAN, 1913 On the highest point of Silanguin Island. Approached from the ìsouthward, this point appears as the most W of the three peaks ìmaking up the ridge, which is the backbone of the island. It is ìreached easiest by landing on the Silanguin Bay side and climbing ìthe N slope of the island. Mark is a standard concrete block set ìin broken stone and cement.

Station is located along the road going to Hanjin Heavy Industries Corporation, 6 m E from the road centerline and 10 m S of the Subic-Cawag Bridge 1. Mark is the head of a nail, centered in a 25 by 25 cm concrete block flushed to the ground, with inscription "SLP-IT". It is equivalent to "ZBS-3165, 2007, NAMRIA".

Station is located 3 m E of the waiting shed in Brgy. San Rafael, Purok 1. It is about 80 m NW of San Rafael Elementary School Flag pole and 10 m SE of Purok 1 marker. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground with inscription, "SM-2, DENR-III".

SPEED COURSE BEACON, 1908 Is the N beacon defining the course for the measured mile in ìSubic Bay. It is on the N shore of Subic Bay on the bluff at the ìE side of Apalit Pt., just back of the beach separating this ìpoint from Cabangan Pt. At the foot of the bluff about 25 m. E ìof the station is a small brook entering the bay at the W side of ìthe valley between these point. The station is about 10 m. above ìthe water and 10 m. below a leveled space about 10 m. square ìsituated W of the station. On this leveled space stood a large ìabandoned nipa house with roof supported on 7 wooden columns in ìfront and 4 on the side. The station was about 43 m. from the ìSE column and was 6 m. S of a well-defined path leading up the ìthe rear of the house. This path was 1.2 m. wide and was cut 1 ìm. deep. The station was also 4.3 m. N of a small trail leading ìup to the front of the house. Station mark is a 2 cm. iron-bolt ìset in the center of a galvanized iron pail filled to the top ìwith cement. The pail is also embedded for half its depth in a ìcement foundation.

STA. CRUZ SOUTH BASE, 1904 About 1.7 km. S of Santa Cruz near the southern end of the long ìstretch of straight road which begins at the S end of the bridge ìover the Santa Cruz River and leads toward Candelaria. It is on ìthe W side of the road just clear of the main track and is 54 m. ìN of the N end of the long bridge crossing the first river S of ìthe Bo. Lipay. Station mark is a drill hole in a flat gray stone ìset on edge with its top flush with the surface.
STA. CRUZ ASTRONOMICAL STATION II, 1951 Is in the W end of the plaza in the town of Santa Cruz. Station ìmark is a hole drilled in a large sandstone rock set flush with ìthe ground.

SANTA CRUS AZIMUTH MARK, 1901-04 Due S of Santa Cruz Astronomical Station, across the E edge of ìthe bay at a distance of 951.1 m. It is on top of a bank, 6 m. ìE of and 1.5 m. above high watermark. Station mark is a dressed ìcoral stone, 45 cm. x 45 cm. x 12 cm., with a hole 2 cm. in dia. ìand 8 cm. deep drilled in its top edge. The stone was set in the ìground with 8 cm. projecting above the surface and the letters ì"U.S." were cut on its N face. Subsurface mark is a brick, 4 cm. ìx 12 cm. x 25 cm., set at a depth of 75 cm. A deep cross in the ìcenter of the brick marked the station. There were two trees ìnearby, one to the NE at a distance of 33.3 m. and one a little ìN of E at a distance of 7 m.
SANTA CRUZ CHURCH, WEST GABLE, 1902-04 The center of the gable of the church at Santa Cruz, on the front ìof the building facing the beach.

STA. CRUZ NORTH BASE, 1904 About 1 km. S of the S end of the long bridge crossing the Santa ìCruz River just S of the town of Santa Cruz. It is at the S edge ìof the Bo. Lipay at a point which sees station Drill 2 and Santa ìCruz Norte. Station is on the E side of the road just clear from ìthe main track. It was directly opposite the last house on the W ìside of the road (in 1904) and was directly in front of the ìfourth house from the end of the barrio on the E side. Station ìmark is a drill hole in an egg-shaped boulder of gray rock set in ìthe road flush with the surface.

SANTA RITA, 1905-08 On the summit of Mt. Santa Rita, which is a wooded peak 479 m. ìhigh, 8.5 km. due E from Olongapo. This peak is conspicuous from ìthe Subic Bay region on account of its regular shape and the ìsharp, rectangular notch on its summit caused by the clearing of ìtrees. It is 1 km. N of the trail from Olongapo to Dinalupihan ìknown as the "Telegraph Trail". The station is at the N end of ìthe small plateau which forms the summit of the peak. In the ìclearing adjacent to the station there was a tree 15.42 m. W, a ìstump 6.34 m. SW, and another tree 13.62 m. SSW. Station mark is ìa drill hole in a fixed rock about 1 m. in dia. and projecting 30 ìcm. above the ground.
STA. RITA CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-50-51 Is on the center of the bell tower on the SE corner of the Sta. ìRita Catholic Church in Sta. Rita.

SANTA RITA TOWER, 1956 Is in the Province of Zambales, on the summit of Mt. Santa Rita, ìabout 480 m. high, 8.5 km. due E of Olongapo. Station is the ìcenter of the steel tower on top of the concrete structure at the ìsummit of Mt. Santa Rita.
STACK, 1971 The top center of the higher of two stacks at the Luisita Sugar ìCentral in San Miguel, Tarlac, Tarlac. The stack is 67.073 m. ìhigh, made of bricks and topped by an iron rim.

SUB, 1947-50 On the W side of Subic Bay. On the general compound formerly ìused as a submarine base of the U.S.N. On a knoll about 91.440 ìm. inshore and about 64.008 m. N of a creek passing through the ìarea. Station may be best reached by landing N of the northerly ìof 2 abandoned piers and follow the road leading N. Cross the ìcreek and about 64.008 m. N of it a road forked to the left. ìFollow this road. When it turns right leave the road and go ìstraight ahead to the knoll at the base of which is RM No. 1 ìwhich is a 4 in. pipe in the middle of a circular concrete base ìabout 6 ft. in dia. Station is a 2 in. G. I. pipe set in ìconcrete monument 20 cm. in dia. and 40 cm. in length projecting ì10 cm. above the ground and is circumscribed "CGS 1947 SUB". RM ìNo. 2 was not recovered. It was a 1 in. galvanized iron bolt ì91.4 cm. in length driven with top 25.4 cm. above the ground ìsurface 6.29 m. distant from the station and almost on range with ìCayuag Pt. RM No. 3 is a nail in the center of cement putty N of ìthe station.

SUBIC, 1906-47 Near the summit of Mt. Redondo which is a prominent partially ìbare hill on the W side of Subic Bay. It is at a distance of 3.7 ìkm. NW of the point and Bo. Agusuhin, and 3.5 km. SSW of Bo. ìCayuag which is in the extreme NW corner of Subic Bay at the ìmouth of Redondo Creek. Trails lead from each of the barrios. A ìroad was built by the U.S. Navy starting from the Submarine Base ìat Manisbaso Pt. in 1945, to a point about 600 m. SE of the ìstation and about 100 m. below, where a quonset hut for the ìAdmiral is located. About 400 m. SW of this station and on the ìsummit of Mt. Redondo is a U.S. Navy triangulation station marked ìwith a concrete monument 20 cm. square. The station is not at ìthe summit but is on grassy hillside about 400 m. NE of the top ìand about 110 m. lower. Station mark is a drill hole at the ìcenter of a triangle cut on a rounded boulder.

SUBIC ASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1901-05 In a coconut grove in the center of the S end of the principal ìN and S street in the town of Subic. This street leads from the ìchurch to the beach. The station was 15 m. from and 1.2 m. above ìthe mean high water line. During typhoons this beach is sometimes ìexposed to heavy surf from the SW and the town may be inundated. ìThe evidence indicates, however, that on such occasions the beach ìbuilds up. The station is 11.80 m. from the SW corner of a house ìon the E side of the street, 12 m. from the SE corner of a house ìon the W side of the street, and 242.92 m. from the center of the ìfront of church buiding. Station mark is a hole drilled in the ìcenter of a stone 15 cm. x 20 cm. x 52 cm., set so as to project ì8 cm. above the ground. 2 subsurface marks were set. Each ìconsisted of a stone 15 cm. x 20 cm. x 6 cm. with a cross cut on ìits top surface. One of these was set at a depth of 1 m. and the ìother at a depth of 81 cm. A reference mark was also placed on ìCabangan Pt. It was on the inner of 2 rocky ledges extending 20 ìm. to the S of the point, and was 0.5 m. above the high water. It ìwas marked by a hole 2 cm. in dia. and 5 cm. deep, drilled in the ìvery hard bedrock. The letters "U.S." were cut just E of the ìhole. It was further distinguished by being inside a triangle ìdefined by natural fissures or seams 2 cm. wide and 5 cm. deep. ìThe longest side of this triangle was over a meter in length and ìran N and S, while the hole was 30 cm. from the S apex, 12 cm. ìfrom the W side, and 20 cm. from the SE side. This reference mark ìwas 632 m. distant from the astronomical station, in azimuth 66° ì50' 17".

SUBIC AZIMUTH MARK, 1901-05 At the S end of a small cove in the NE corner of Pequeña Island, ìat a distance of 2.6 km. S of the astronomical station. The ìstation was on top of a boulder of about 1 m. in each dimension, ìresting in place on the bed-rock. Station mark is a hole 2 cm. ìin dia. and 4 cm. deep, with the letters "U.S." cut close to the ìE.
SUBIC CHURCH TOWER, 1905 The center of the square bell tower on the front or S face of the ìchurch in the town of Subic.
SUGAR MILL TOWER,1905 Is the center of a square black tower on a white building.

SULIPAN, 1959 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pampanga, municipality of ìApalit, Bo. Sulipan, inside the Pampanga River Control Compound. ìStation can best be reached by turning right of the N end of ìApalit highway bridge, spanning Sulipan-San Miguel Cut-Off ìChannel, and following the dirt road to Bo. Sulipan. From San ìFernando, Pampanga, turn left at Km. 54 and follow the old ìasphalted road to Bo. Sulipan. Station is 60 m. E and opposite ìthe main gate of the compound; 5 m. from the E fence of the ìcompound; 10 m. N of the E corner of the E most residential house ìinside the compound; 65 m. NE of Sulipan Elem. School. Station ìmark is a cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. brass rod embedded in a ì25.4 cm. x 25.4 cm. concrete monument on which is inscribed ì"PC&GS SULIPAN, 1959". RM No.1 is a 3 in. nail embedded in a 25.4 ìcm. x 25.4 cm. concrete monument on which is inscribed "RM 1" and ìan arrow pointing to the station, distant 7.965 m., in azimuth ì178° 12' 50". RM No.2 is a Bureau of Lands concrete monument with ìa hole at the middle and on which is inscribed "PLS", distant ì13.19 m., in azimuth 295° 42' 40". RM No. 3 is similar to RM ìNo.1, distant 12.93 m., in azimuth 63° 23' 10".

SUMMIT, 1905 On the highest point of the ridge which divides the San Marcelino ìvalley from the lowlands along the coast toward the N. It is 3.5 ìkm. NE of San Felipe on a barren peak rising abruptly from the ìhigh ridge which is partly covered with trees. A good trail ìleads to the foot of the sharp peak, which is easily recognized ìas the only sharp peak in this vicinity. A tree 30 cm. in dia. ìis situated 15 m. below and NE of the station, and a small stump ìis situated 4 m. to the S. Station mark is a drill hole in the ìtop of the rock. A cairn of rocks 1 m. high was piled over the ìstation.

SUSUNDALAGA, 1908 On the S slope toward the SW of the summit of Mt. Susongdalaga at ìan elevation of 564 m. by aneroid, the summit having an elevation ìof 640 m. by topography. This mountain is 9 km. NE of Olongapo. ìThe trip is a difficult one and as the station is not in a ìconspicous position it will be necessary to follow the directions ìfor travelling as closely as possible. The round trip will ìrequire at least 3 days and ample supplies should be carried to ìprovide for delays. The mountain is most easily reached by taking ìthe road leading N from Olongapo to the target ranges and thence ìover the trail known locally as the "Rocky Trail" leading to ìDinalupihan. This follows the S bank of the Kalaklan or Santa ìRita River for about 2.5 km. beyond the target ranges, after ìwhich it turns into a side valley to the right and then ascends a ìsteep trail with rocks to the Tanauan Plateau. On this plateau it ìtraverses alternate stretches of forest and cogon for about 3 km. ìto the crossing of Santa Rita River. This crossing is conspicous ìbecause of the junction of 3 streams at this point. Before the ìcrossing is reached Mt. Susongdalaga is plainly visible to the N ìfrom the open streches of cogon. The river crossing is near the ìfoot of the S slope of the moutain and from this point directions ìare more difficult to give. About 200 m. downstream on the NE ìbank is a small ledge of pebble conglomerate about 25 m. long and ì2 or 3 m. above the water. Over it is a well-defined deer trail ìwhich strikes into the forest uphill and to the right for a ìdistance of perhaps 100 m., after which it opens into the point ìof a long, narrow patch of cogon leading up the mountain. After ìabout 0.5 km. the cogon veers toward the left and opens into a ìlarge, grassy space at the W end of which are a number of a large ìconglomerate boulders and cliffs. From this point continuous and ìheavy forest extends to the summit requiring bolo work the entire ìdistance. Traveling N there is first a sharp drop into a ravine ìwith a fair-sized stream flowing W, and then a gradual rise of ìperhaps 100 m. followed by another sharp drop to a small brook ìflowing the same way. Working toward the NE of the main spur of ìthe mountain is soon encountered and should be recognized without ìdifficulty on account of the well-defined, steeply ascending ìridge. Although fairly sharp, it is heavily wooded and gives no ìopportunity for views, but can be followed without much ìdifficulty. At about 520 m. elevation a group of enormous ìboulders are found in the forest and beyond them the ground drops ìinto a little amphitheater free from underbrush and containing a ìnumber of Negrito shacks. By a slight detour to the right the ìridge again continuous upward to the station, which is in a ìlittle open space free from brush and partly covered with a small ìstones. Immediately above the station the vegetation consists ìmostly of bushes and the slope is more gradual. The highest point ìis not visible but lies toward the NE. The location may be ìverified from the facts tha Cubi Pt. in Subic Bay is directly in ìline with the N end of Chiquita Island, and Kalaklan Pt. is in ìthe line with a detached knoll on the northwest spur of the ìmountain about 50 meters lower than and 400 m. from the station. ìThe station is at middle of the N edge of the bare patch, which ìis only 2 or 3 m. wide and about 10 m. long in an E and W ìdirection. Station mark is a drill hole in highest part of the ìrounded upper surface of a hard rock. The hole is 1 cm. in dia. ìand 3 cm. deep and is near the S end of the rock.

SWIPE, 1902-06 On the E shore of Dasol Bay about 4 km. N of the town of Santa ìCruz and 400 m. S of the mouth of the Nayon River. A tree stump, ì15 cm. in dia. and 30 cm. high, was 2.1 m. N of station. ìSurrounding the station at a distance of 60 cm. and forming an ìequilateral triangle were three stubs, 6 cm. in dia. and 45 cm. ìlong, driven down flush with the surface. Station mark is a ìcross cut in a rock set flush with the ground.

TAB, 1906 On the top of the smaller one of the 2 Tabones Islands. Station ìmark is a drill hole about 2.5 cm. in dia. and 2.5 cm. deep, out ìin a smooth, rounding rock, the top of which is about 35 cm. ìacross and the bottom embedded in the hard conglomerate of which ìthe island is formed. A shallow triangle was cut around the mark ìand rocks were piled over it. The station is about 1 m. N of the ìrange formed by the largest boulder on the island and the S end ìof the larger Tabones Island. This boulder is about 2 m. distant ìfrom the station.

TALTAL, 1904-05-53 In Bo. Tatal about 4 km. N of the town of Masinloc. It is about ì250 m. SW of the main road and 300 m. N of the shore of Bani Bay. ìStation is on a sharp cone-shaped hill partly cleared of timber ì(the top entirely clear) and is plainly visible from the road. ìIt is an elevation of 62 m. Station mark is a drill hole in a ì400 lbs. rock, set in the ground with 20 cm. projecting.
TANK, 1977 The top of an elevated steel water tank painted silver gray ìinside the U.S. Naval Communication Center about 1.5 km. WNW from ìthe municipality of San Antonio, Zambales.
TARLAC CHURCH DOME, 1905 The center of the dome of the church in the town of Tarlac.
TARLAC WATER TANK, 1971 The center of a 1 cm. hole inside a small triangle chiseled at ìthe top portion of the 24.384 m. water tank in front of the ìprovincial capitol in Tarlac, Tarlac.

TAXI, 1957-71-74 On the W coast of Luzon, Province of Zambales, inside the Subic ìNaval Air Station. Station is located on the E side of Subic Bay ìat Cubi Pt., W of Leyte Wharf. It is about 1.8 m. from the center ìof a 0.9 m. wide open drain covered with steel gratings and about ì25 m. WNW of the westernmost extremity of the point and about 115 ìm. of the Cubi Field Beacon. Station mark is a punched hole at ìthe center of a brass cap 3 in. in dia. set flush in concrete. ì"US NAVY TRIANGULATION STA. 1957" is inscribed on the cap.

TELATAO, 1905-53 About 8 km. NW of the town of Capas and about 2.5 km. N of the ìCapas-Iba-O'Donnell road. It is on the highest point of the low ìrange of bare hills running N and S and lying in the open ìcountry. A trail leaves the road about 2 km. E of the Bangat ìRiver, and leads to the S end of the range. Follow the ridge to ìthe N to the highest point where the station will be found. ìStation mark is a drill hole at the center of a triangle cut on a ìlarge, irregularly shaped rock, weighing about 700 kg., set in ìplace for this purpose. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried at a ìdepth of 0.9 m. below the ground. RM No.1 is a triangle cut on a ìlarge rock protruding 46 km. above the ground downhill from ìstation. Azimuth 330°, distant 11.699 m. RM-2 is a triangle cut ìon a rock protruding 20 cm. above the ground down hill from ìstation. Azimuth 330°, distant 11.582 m.

TERA, 1970 Is located at the mouth of Teracan River approx. 1.5 km. SSE of ìthe mouth of Pasag River in Pampanga. Station is the SW corner of ìa fishpond W of Teracan River, and is further identified by being ì37 m. W of the SE corner and about 500 m. S of a house in the ìfishpond.

TRC-1 Is located in a NIA irrigation canal concrete floodgate 300 m. E of the natl. highway, 1.5 km. SE of Tarlac town proper. From Manila, travel along MacArthur Highway to Tarlac. A small bridge, 10 m. NW of Sombrero Food Center along the irrigation canal bank to the railroad. It is 2 m. W of the railroad on the eastern floodgate wall, which is 5 min. walk from highway. Mark is a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set on a drilled hole in a standard concrete block with cement putty, 0.03 m. above the top of the concrete railing, inscribed with station name. Reference marks (RM): RM's 1, 2 & 3 are 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rods set in a drilled hole with cement putties. RM-2 is a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set on concrete block, 0.6 m. below ground level; Sub-RM is a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set on a drilled hole on top of the concrete railing.

TRC-10 Station is located on the SW corner of Concepcion town plaza, about 20 m. SE of the frontage Concepcion church, 15 m. NNE of Sta. Rita Medical Clinic, 30 m. NW of the frontage of the town and 10 m. S of the western ring of the basketball court within the plaza. Station mark is the top/end of a 10 mm. dia. brass rod centered and embedded on a 102 10" x 10" concrete monument with inscription "BLLM No.1 Bureau of Lands".

TRC-12 Station is located at the motorpool unit of the Clark Development Corporation just 10 m. S off the junction which leads to the CDC field office in Socobia and the road to the Filipino Expo. Station mark is the cross cut head of a 1/2 in. dia. steel centered and embedded on a 10 in. concrete monument with inscription "BMNT-2 FNSP-G".

TRC-13 Station is located on the helipad of the Clark Development Corporation Office in Brgy. San Vicente, Socobia Ressetlement. About 300 m. W of the said office and about 200 m. N of Brgy. San Vicente proper. Station mark is a 3/8 in. dia. brass screw/bolt with inscription "TRC-13 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-14 Station is located in Brgy. San Vicente proper, about 15 m. W of the barangay hall and about 5 m. S of the basketball court of the said barangay. The station was established by the Land Management Sector III of the DENR and has the inscription "BMNT FNSP-6".

TRC-15 Station is located inside the Dap-Dap Resettlement Area along the hillside approximately 60 m. SE from the chapel. Mark is a head of a 2 in. concrete nail embedded and centered in a 0.20 m. x 0.20 m. cement putty flushed on the rock surface with inscribed inscriptions; "TRC-15 NAMRIA 1999."

TRC-16 Station is located inside the Dap-Dap Resettlement Area at the street corner of Blk. 86 and Blk. 87 in Brgy. San Pedro. Station mark is the head of a 2 in. embedded and centered in a 0.15 m. x 0.15 m. cement putty flushed on the gutter with inscriptions: "TRC-16 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-4016 (CVGR-16)
The station is located at Brgy. O'Donnell, Capas, Tarlac. Approximately 170 meters from CVGR-15 and 5 meters northwest of the gate.
Marked is the head of 4" concrete nail centered on a 30cm. x 30cm. concrete block mark with CVGR-16; 2009; PAF."

TRC-17 Station is located near the N gate of Capas Municipal Hall along the national highway leading to Tarlac City. Station mark is the head of a 1 in. bolt screw embedded and centered in a 0.20 m. x 0.20 m. cement putty with inscriptions: "TRC-17 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-18 Station is located at the N gate of Villa Eliza Subdivision 10 m. E from the steel gate of the subdivision. Station mark is the head of a 1 in. stainless bolt screw embedded and centered in a cement putty on the gutter with inscribed inscriptions; "TRC-18 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-19 Station is located inside the compound of Sta. Juliana Elementary School 7 m. E of the school building. Station mark is the head of a 1 in. copper bolt screw embedded and centered in a 1' x 1' standard concrete monument with inscriptions: "TRC - 19 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-2 From the municipal building of Capaz, travel S for 1.5 km. Then turn right on a concrete road. Travel W for 18 km. up to Brgy. Juliana passing through Brgys. Sta. Lucia and Camp O' Donnel. Upon reaching Brgy. Sta. Juliana; travel W, 250 m. up to the foot of the hill. Then turn left, follow the foot trail. Walk southward for 5 min. up to the station. The station is on top of the grassy hill; 500 m. SW of Brgy. Sta. Juliana and 300 m., S from the road that leads to the U.S. Airforce Target Range. Travel time from Capaz town to the station is 30 min. Station mark is a cross cut on top of a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod, centered on a 0.30 m. x 0.30 m. x 0.68 m. dia. concrete block, flush with the ground; 0.05 m. above surface. Inscribed on top with the station name. Sub-surface mark is 0.22 long empty bottle of Coca cola, centered on a 0.50 m. x 0.50 m. x 0.20 m in a dia. concrete block; set 0.78 m. below ground surface. Reference mark numbers 1, 2, 3 are drill holes on top of irregular shape solid rock; with 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement patty; 0.03 m. above surface of rock. Inscribed on top with the station name and RM numbers.

TRC-20 Station is located at the top of a hill 5 m. from the old station TRC-2 (excavated). Station mark is the head of a 2 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.15 m. x 0.15 m. cement putty flushed on the rock surface with inscriptions; "TRC-20 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-21 From Concepcion Town Proper, travel W along the natl. road for about 3 km. until reaching the highway leading to Magalang, Pampanga. Turn left and proceed along the highway and travel until reaching Brgy. San Nicolas Balas intersection. Turn left and continue traveling along the brgy. road passing by Brgy. San Antonio thence Brgy. Balutu Proper. Locate the Balutu Elem. School and turn left and follow the access road of the dike, turn left and proceed onward traveling W now along the dike for about 2 km. Station is located on a concrete dike about 1 km. N of the Brgy. Balutu marker. Mark is the head of a 3/8 in. dia. stainless bolt centered and embedded on a 4 in. x 4 in. cement putty, with inscriptions "TRC-21 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-22 From Concepcion Town Proper, travel W to S along the natl. highway leading to Magalang, Pampanga for about 5 km. until reaching San Nicolas Balas. Turn left and continue traveling along the brgy. road leading to Brgy. San Antonio. Turn left and proceed along the brgy. leading to Brgy. Balutu. Station is 200 m. W of the Balutu Elem. School, 500 m. S of station TRC-21. It is also situated inside the lot. Mark is the head of a 3/8 in. dia. stainless bolt centered and embedded on a 12" x 12" concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-22 1999 NAMRIA.

TRC-23 Station is located along the Bayanihan St. at the top corner of a 2 ft. x 2 ft. concrete flower box beside the residence of Brgy. Captain Noel Lacson. Station mark is the head of a 1 in. bolt screw embedded and centered on 0.15 m. x 0.15 m. cement putty with inscriptions; "TRC-23 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-24 Station is located 1 m. N from the concrete Sangguniang Kabataan (SK) marker. Station mark is the head of a 1 in. bolt screw embedded amd centered on a 0.20 m. x 0.20 m. cement putty with inscriptions; "TRC-24 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-25 Station is located along the national highway near the provincial boundaries of Pampanga and Tarlac. Station is situated SW abutment of a 20 m. concrete bridge. Mark is the head of a 1 in. stainless screw bolt embedded and centered in a 0.20 m. x 0.20 m. cement putty with inscriptions; "TRC-25 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-26 Station is located along the Magalang-Concepcion highway near the provincial boundaries of Pampanga and Tarlac. Station is situated at the top edge of the SW corner of a concrete dike, 7 m. W from the centerline. Mark is the head of a 1 in. stainless screw bolt embedded and centered on a 0.20 m. x 0.20 m. cement putty with inscriptions; "TRC-26 NAMRIA 1999".

TRC-27 Is located on the SW corner of a concrete bridge in Brgy. Bantog. About 20 m. SW off the LaPaz-Concepcion boundary marker. Mark is a 3/8 in. dia. stainless bolt centered and embedded on a 10 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "TRC-27 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-28 Station is located on a purok marker in Brgy. Bantog about 400 m. N off Bantog Bridge. It is located on concrete foundation of Purok No.3 marker. Station mark is a 3/8" dia. stainless bolt with its head embedded and centered on a cement putty 10 sq. cm. in dimension with inscription "TRC-28 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-29 Station is located along the Capas-Concepcion highway, on a concrete sidewalk gutter of Villa Elyssa Subdivision on Brgy. Sto. Domingo. The station is located W of the guard house of the said subdivision about 500 m. off McDonald's Restaurant along the national highway. Mark is a stainless bolt 3/8" in dia. embedded center on a 0.10 m. x 0.10 m. cement putty with the head embedded with inscription "TRC-29 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-2A
From municipal hall of Capas, travel south for 1.5km. Then turn right on a concrete road. Travel west for 17km up to Bgy. Sta Juliana passing through Bgy Sta. Lucia and Patling (O' Donnel). The station is located at the righ side of the road going to Sta. Juliana proper, it is in between 2nd and 3rd concrete barrier. Station mark is the head of 1" concrete nail centered on a 30cm x 30cm cement putty with inscriptions "TRC-2A, 2010, NAMRIA".

TRC-3 From the municipal hall of Mayantoc town, travel SE towards Brgy. Mamunit for 1.2 km. up to the foot of the hill. Then turn right, walk southward for 5 min. following the foot trail that branches off the road; and is going to the top of the hill. The station is located on the highest portion of a 300 m. long ridge. Accessible by 2 wheel drive vehicle up to the foot of the hill. Station mark is a cross cut on top of a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod centered on a 0.30 m. x 0.30 m. x 0.68 m. dia. concrete block, flush with the ground; 0.50 m. above surface. Inscribed on top with the station name. Sub-surface mark is 0.22 m. long empty bottle, centered on a 0.50 m. x 0.50 m. x 0.20 m. in dia. concrete block; 0.78 m. below ground surface. Reference marks, all 4 reference marks, are cross cut on top of 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. in dia. brass rods set in concrete block. Inscribed with the station name.

TRC-30 Station is located on an open canal concrete box about 30 m. N of the main gate of poultry farm. The poultry farm being S of the Capas-Concepcion national highway. To reach the station from Capas town proper travel along the Capas-Concepcion highway until reaching Brgy. San Juan, turn right on a barangay road which leads to the poultry farm. Station mark is a 3/8 in. stainless bolt with its head embedded and centered on a 10 cm. cement putty with inscription "TRC-30 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-34 (BLLM NO.2A) Station is located on a vacant lot owned by the local government about 400 m. S of the town hall and adjacent to the access road of highway town hall. TRC-35 Station is located NE corner of the lot owned by Diosdado Bersena, about 8 m. NE of the main gate off the house main door. The station is located on the S side of the road and can be found before entering the barangay proper. Mark is the cross cut head of a 1/2 in. dia. steel centered and embedded on 12 in. x 12 in. concrete monument with inscription "BLLM NO.5A".

TRC-36 Station is located along the Brgy. Burgos-Mababanaba national road, on an open ground near a cattle and poultry farm about 500 m. E of Brgy. Burgos proper. Mark is a 3/8" dia. stainless bolt with its head embedded and centered on a 10 in. concrete monument with inscription "TRC-36 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-37 (BBM NO.17) Station is located along McArthur Highway, on a concrete monument marker of Knights of Columbus (K of C) on Brgy. Estrada, Capas. The station is a concrete monument about 1 m. SW off the K of C concrete marker. Mark is a cross cut of a 1/2 in. dia. steel centered on a 10 in. x 10 in. concrete monument with inscription BBM NO.17.

TRC-38 Station is located on the NW corner of a concrete bridge abutment on Brgy. Poblacion Sur which leads to Brgy. Mapandan. It is about 600 m. NW of GPS station TRC-3. Mark is a 3/8" in. dia. stainless bolt with its head embedded and centered on a 10 cm. cement putty with inscription "TRC-38 1999 NAMRIA".

TRC-39 Station is located on the near SE corner of a waiting shed in San Vicente barangay proper. It is also about 30 m. NW of the Barangay Health Center. To reach the station from San Nicolas Ballas, turn left and proceed on the barangay road which leads to Brgys. Balutu and San Vicente. Turn left on the intersection to lead to Brgy. San Vicente. Marking was done by FNSP-LMS.

TRC-4 From Concepcion town proper, travel SE towards Brgy. San Antonio for about 4.5 kms. Turn left at the road junction leading to Brgy. Balutu and proceed northeastward until reaching Balutu Elementary School approximately 3.2 kms. from San Antonio. The station is located on the school's concrete stage, 102.0 cm. from its S corner and 60 cm. above the ground. Station mark is a copper nail set flush on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty with inscription "TRC-4, 1992, NAMRIA".

TRC-40 To reach the station from Concepcion town proper, travel southward to Magalang for about 50 kms. until San Nicolas Ballas barangay proper. Turn left and proceed onward at the barangay road to Brgy. San Vicente. Station is located along the barangay road and on the rice paddy intersection about 350 m. mouth of the San Vicente barangay proper. The station was established and permanently mark by the FNSP of Land Management Sector (LMS) with inscriptions "BMN Cpn 1999".
