TRC-42 is located at the south-western corner of Sta.Lucia Elementary School grounds. It is about 15 meters south of the vegetable garden and about 10 meters from the kiosk. It is on the dike abutting the school lot and approximately 50 cm. from the school's western concrete fence. It is about 13 kms. from Capas town center. Station mark is a copper nail at the center of a cement patty with inscriptions "TRC-42 2001 NAMRIA."

TRC-42, DENR R. III From Bamban town proper, travel in SE direction towards the town of Mabalacat, Pampanga along the highway until reaching Brgy. Lourdes. It is located near the N edge of a dike approx. 200 m. NW to the Lourdes Grotto and 300 m. from the highway. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.2 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-42, 2005, DENR".

TRC-4200 (S-31)
The station is located on a cement pattied in the concrete foundation 10 meters away from the monument known as the Barangay boundary of Lanat and Colubot.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4200 (S-31); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4201 (S-32)
The station is located on a cement pattied on the bridge along the road 30 meters away from BLLM 13, known as the Barangay Boundary of Colubot and Lanat.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4201 (S-32); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4203 (S-33)
The station is located on a cement pattied along the road 3 meters away from the basketball court concrete wall also known as BBM-17 and barangay boundary of Colubot and Lanat.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4203 (S-33); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4203 (S-4)
The station is located near the fence 3 meters away from the road, known as MBM-11 and Political Bounary of San Manuel Tarlac (san Vicente) and Moncada.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4203 (S-4); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4204 (S-5)
The station is located on a cement pattied along the road 4 meters away from the gate of Yasay residence known as MBM-11 the Political Boundary of San Manuel (San Vicente) and Moncada.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4204 (S-5); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4205 (BBM-1)
The station is located near the Welcome Arc of Barangay San Narciso 4 meters away from the road known as the barangay bounary of San Agustin and San Narciso.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4205 (BBM-1); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4206 (BBM-2)
The station is located 5 meters away from aacia tree 4 meters away from the bridge and 3 meters away from the irrigation known as the Tri-Bounary of San Felipe, San Narciso and San Agustin
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4206 (BBM-2); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4207 (BBM-4)
The station is located in a large cornfield known as the Barangay Boundary of Mangandingay and San Narciso.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4207 (BBM-4); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-4208 (BBM-19)
The station is located 4 meters along the way beside the road barricade known as the Tri-Bounary of San Vicente, Lanat and Colubot.
Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail flushed in a cylindrical block embedded in the ground with inscription "TRC-4208 (BBM-19); 2009; DENR/LMS III."

TRC-43, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel N. Before reaching Capas Municipal Hall, turn left on Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd. Upon reaching the cemetery, turn left on a T-intersection and continue traveling this road going to Botolan, Zambales, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine, until reaching Brgy. Sta. Lucia. It is located on the E corner of a concrete bridge near Sta. Lucia Elem. School, about 80 m. E of Km Post No. 120, about 2.5 m. from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 6 in. x 6 in. cement putty, with inscriptions "TRC-43, 2001, NAMRIA".

TRC-44 is along the dike at Bamban River, approximately 3 Kms. from ìBamban-Mabalacat Bridge. It is accessible by the dirt road north ìof and parallel to Bamban river. It is about 60 meters from a ìroad intersection. It is likewise about 60 meters from a ìbenchmark (concrete nail with inscriptions of white paint) ìlocated on the dike near the aforementioned road intersection. ìIt is likewise about 220 meters from TRC-45. Station mark is a ìcopper nail at the center of a cement patty with inscriptions ì"TRC-44 2001 NAMRIA".

TRC-44, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel N. Before reaching Capas Municipal Hall, turn left on Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd. Upon reaching the cemetery, turn right on a T-intersection and continue traveling this road going to Botolan, Zambales, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine, until reaching Sta. Lucia Elem. School. It is located on the S side of the road, about 6 m. from the WSW corner of a concrete bridge and about 3 m. from the road centerline, beside steel railings. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 20 cm. x 20 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-44, 2005, NAMRIA".

TRC-45 is along the dike at Bamban River, approximately 3 Kms. from Bamban-Mabalacat Bridge. It is accessible by the dirt road parallel to, and at the northern side of Bamban River. It is about 160 m. from a road intersection and likewise about 160 m.from a BM (concrete nail with white paint inscriptions) located on the dike near the intersection mentioned. Station mark is a copper nail at the center of a cement patty with inscriptions: "TRC-45 2001 NAMRIA".

TRC-45, DENR R. III Is located at the corner of the road going to Botolan, Zambales and Brgy. Palublub. It is also NW of Capas Nat'l. Shrine with 2 km. distances. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. x 0.2 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-45, 2005, DENR".

TRC-46, DENR R. III Is located along the Botolan-Zambales Rd., 15 min. travel time from Capas Nat'l. Shrine. It is NE from the shrine and S of the Phil. Light Armor Brigade Headquarters. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.2 m. x 0.2 m. x 0.15 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-46, 2005, DENR".

TRC-47, DENR R. III Is SE of Capas Nat'l Shrine, 30 min. travel time from the town proper of Capas. It is located along the rough road, 800 m. to the river, which is the boundary of Brgys. Patling and Bueno. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.27 m. x 0.27 m. x 0.17 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-47, 2005, DENR".

TRC-48, DENR R. III Is SE of the Capas Nat'l. Shrine, 30 min. travel time from the town proper of Capas. It is located along the rough road, 150 m. from the river (within sight), which is the boundary of Brgys. Patling and Bueno. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail, embedded and centered on a 0.27 m. x 0.27 m. x 0.17 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-48, 2005, DENR".

TRC-49, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel W for about 1 hr. along the road towards Brgy. Sta. Juliana, passing through the Capas Nat'l. Shrine. It is located at the hill top, approx. 80 m. SE to the airforce camp, 45 m. W to the road going to Brgy. Maruglo. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.25 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-49, 2005, DENR".

TRC-5 From Bamban town proper, travel northeastward along the dirt road up to Brgy. Bangcu passing through Brgys. San Pedro and Luyuns. The station is located near the house of Mr. Rolando Mallari approximately 6.5 kms. from the town proper. It is set on the 2 steps concrete stair block of the house remnant situated S of the road and about 30 m. SW of Mr. Mallari's house. Station mark is a 4" copper nail set flush on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty with inscription "TRC-5, 1992, NAMRIA".

TRC-50, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel W for about 1 hr. along the road towards Brgy. Sta. Juliana, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine. It is located 5 m. N to the edge of the road and 1 m. to the corner post of the fence. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.25 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-50, 2005, DENR".

TRC-51, DENR R. III Is located at the S edge of a concrete road, approx. 10 m. SW from the corner end of the basketball court and 2 m. from the concrete fence of house no. 71. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument, with inscription "TRC-51, 2005, DENR".

TRC-52, DENR R. III Is located at the N edge of a concrete pavement between the boundary fence of house nos. 92 and 93. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.4 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-52, 2005, DENR".

TRC-55, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, take the Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd. going to Sta. Juliana, Capas. Upon reaching Sta. Lucia Elem. School, travel for about 400 m. more then turn right on the road going to So. Pingal. Continue traveling this road until reaching O'Donnell River. From this river, walk for about 25 min. until reaching a concrete dike. It is located along this concrete dike about 10 m. from the road intersection, right side going to Brgy. Mapante. Mark is the hexagonal head of a 4 in. steel bolt embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. monument, with inscriptions "TRC-55, 2005, DENR".

TRC-56, DENR R. III From the poblacion of Capas, travel for 30 min. NW along the highway towards Brgy. Sta. Lucia then turn right (N direction) going to Brgy. Pingal, which is not accessible by 4-wheel drive vehicle. Take a walk for 30 min. or 2 km. along the dirt road after crossing O'Donnell River. It is located near a 3 m. high dike about 60 m. from the road junction. Mark is the head of a 4 in. steel bolt embedded and centered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-56, 2005, DENR".

TRC-4056 (CVGR-56)
The station is located at the top of a hill about 1 and a half hours walking from Sitio Proper of Malabatay.
Marked is the head of 4" concrete nail centered on a 30cm. x 30cm. concrete block mark with "CVGR-56; 2009; PAF."

TRC-6 The station is on top of the hill at Brgy. Lourdes about 1.2 kms. SW of Bamban town proper and about 400 m. drive up the hill from the national highway junction near the N bank of Bamban river. It is set on the diving board's concrete base of the former Mansion swimming pool on top of the second step from the E end. Station mark is a 4" copper nail set flush on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty 23 cm. above the ground and with inscription "TRC-6, 1992, NAMRIA".

TRC-65, DENR R. III Is located in Brgy. Sula, San Jose. It is situated 0.2 m. at the SE end of a 15 m. concrete bridge. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.28 m. above road surface, with inscriptions "TRC-65, 2005, DENR/NAM".

TRC-66, DENR R. III Is located in the SW approach of a 70 m. long concrete bridge over the Karayan Nga Bas-sit River. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding about 0.35 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-66, 2005, DENR".

TRC-67, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the road going to the town of Camiling. Upon reaching Brgy. Tibag, turn left on an intersection which leads to the town of San Jose. After reaching Lawacamulag Elem. School, turn left on a Y-intersection with a waiting shed on a corner, which leads to the town hall. Travel for approx. 20 mi. to reach Bulsa Bridge. It is located on the S corner of the bridge, about 2.5 m. from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-67, 2005, DENR".

TRC-68, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. Upon reaching Brgy. Tibag, turn left on an intersection, which leads to the town of San Jose. After reaching Lawacamulag Elem. School, turn left on a Y-intersection with a waiting shed on the corner, which leads to the municipal hall. Travel for approx. 20 min. until reaching a T-intersection. Take the road on the left, which leads to Brgy. Moriones. It is located on the right side of the farm-to-market road, about 4 m. from the road centerline, 10 m. SSE of the nearest house. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-68, 2005, DENR/NAMRIA".

TRC-69, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel N. Before reaching Capas Municipal Hall, turn left on Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd and turn right upon reaching a T-intersection. Continue traveling, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine, until reaching an intersection with a police precinct on the corner. Upon reaching this corner, turn right and continue traveling for 10 min. until reaching a 100 m. long concrete bridge. It is located on the SE corner of the bridge, behind the concrete railings, about 3 m. from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a cement putty, with inscriptions "TRC-69, 2005, DENR".

TRC-7 From Concepcion Town Proper, travel SE towards Brgy. San Antonio for about 4.5 kms. Turn left at the road junction leading to Brgys. Lilibangan 2 and Balutu and proceed NE until reaching Bamban River, approx. 4.7 km. from San Antonio. Travel E along the river's dirt road up to Rio Chico River near the road end and NW of the river-swamp confluence. Mark is a 4" copper nail set flushed on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. x 80 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-7 1992 NAMRIA".

TRC-70, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel N. Before reaching Capas Municipal Hall, turn left on Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd. Upon reaching the cemetery, turn right on a T-intersection and continue traveling, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine. Turn right upon reaching another T-intersection and continue traveling for 10 min. until reaching a 100 m. long concrete bridge. It is located on the NW corner of the bridge, behind the concrete railings, about 3 m. from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail, embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty protruding by about 15 cm. above ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-70, 2005, DENR".

TRC-71, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel N. Before reaching Capas Municipal Hall, turn left on Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd. Upon reaching the cemetery, turn right on a T-intersection and continue traveling, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine. Upon reaching another T-intersection, with a police precinct on a corner, turn right and continue traveling for about 15 min. more, passing through a 100 m. long bridge, until reaching Brgy. Moriones. It is located 5 m. SSW of a large galvanized-roof shed, about 100 m. ENE of Km Post No. 125, about 6 m. from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-71, 2005, DENR".

TRC-72, DENR R. III From Capas town proper, travel N. Before reaching Capas Municipal Hall, turn left on Capas-Bataan Heroes' Rd. Upon reaching the cemetery, turn right on a T-intersection and continue traveling, passing through Capas Nat'l. Shrine. Upon reaching another T-intersection, with a police precinct on a corner, turn right and continue traveling for about 15 min. more, passing through a 100 m. long bridge, until reaching Brgy. Moriones. It is located on the S side of the road, 6 m. S of Km Post No. 125, about 15 m. SW of the nearest house. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-72, 2005, DENR".

TRC-73, DENR R. III From the road junction going to O'Donnell Resettlement Area, travel NW along the barangay concrete road towards Brgy. Moriones for about 30 min., or approx. 15 km., up to the station. It is located 1 m. E of a steel signboard, 5 m. S to the road and 2 m. N to the irrigation canal. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.22 m. above the ground, with inscriptions "TRC-73, 2005, DENR".

TRC-74, DENR R. III From the road junction going to O'Donnell Resettlement Area, travel NW along the barangay concrete road towards Brgy. Moriones for about 30 min., or approx. 15 km., up to the station. It is located in the NW corner of the road junction and 5 m. E to the concrete waiting shed. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument and protruding 0.25 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-74, 2005, DENR/NAMRIA".

TRC-75, DENR R. III Is located NW of San Jose town proper, 30 min. travel time, at the top of the hill, which is accessible by any type of vehicle (eventhough the elevation is high). It is also situated SE of a monastery. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 0.33 m. x 0.33 m. x 0.25 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "TRC-75, 2005, DENR/NAMRIA".

TRC-76, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the road going to Camiling. Upon reaching Brgy. Tibag, turn left on an intersection, which leads to the town of San Jose. Upon reaching a Y-intersection, with a waiting shed on the center, take the road on the left, which leads to the municipal hall and continue traveling for approx. 25 min. to reach the station at Brgy. Lubigan. It is located on the right side of the road, which leads to Monasterio de Tarlac. The road to the station is an uphill climb with a series of concrete and rough road alternating. It is situated 5 m. from the road centerline and approx. 500 m. S of the monastery. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 20 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-76, 2005, DENR".

TRC-77, DENR R. III Is located in Brgy. Bigbiga, Mayantoc, in the NW corner of the basketball court, 5 m. from the court's circular base and approx. 10 m. N to the barangay chapel. Mark is a 12 mm. dia. circular nut embedded on a 1 cm. depth hole centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.38 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-77, 2005, DENR".

TRC-78, DENR R. III Is situated on the hilly side of Brgy. Bigbiga, about 10 min. walk NW from the national road, approx. 700 m. W of the Brgy. Bigbiga Elem. School, right side of the house of Mr. Noel Sagum. Mark is the head of a 12 mm. dia. (2 in. long) steel bolt embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.28 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-78, 2005, NAMRIA".

TRC-79, DENR R. III Is SW of Mayantoc town proper with 30 min. travel time at 20-25 km/h. It is about 3 km. from Gayung-Gayung Elem. School and is located at the compound of Mababang Paaralan Nayon Ng Binbinaca. Mark is the head of a common wire nail (no. 4) embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.2 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-79, 2005, DENR".

TRC-8 From Bamban town proper travel westward towards the national highway thence, southward along the national highway toward the town of Mabalacat, Pampanga until reaching the steel bridge called the centennial bridge. TRC-8 is located on the E corner of S abutment of the so called centennial bridge. Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail embedded and centered on a 6" x 6" cement putty with inscription "TRC-8, 1998 NAMRIA".

TRC-80, DENR R. III Is SW of Mayantoc town proper with a 30 min. travel time at 20-25 km/h. It is 3.5 km. from Gayung-Gayung Elem. School and is located at the back of the church, NW from the station. Mark is the head of a common wire nail (no. 4) embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.2 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-80, 2005, DENR".

TRC-81, DENR R. III From Talac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. After reaching Camiling "welcome" sign, turn left on the road going to Mayantoc town. This road is on the SW side of the highway near the Shell Gas Station and the road going to CENRO-Camiling. Upon reaching the town proper, turn left, then turn right on the road going to Brgy. Cub-cub. It is located SW of the road passing the Brgy. Maniniog signboard. Mark is the head of a 2 in. stainless steel bolt, with inscriptions "TRC-81, 2005, DENR".

TRC-82, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. After reaching Camiling "welcome" sign, turn left on the road going to Mayantoc town. This road is on the SW side of the highway near the Shell Gas Station and the road going to CENRO-Camiling. Upon reaching the town proper, turn left, then turn right on the road going to Brgy. Cub-cub. It is located on the SE corner of a concrete culvert near a creek, approx. 10 m. SW of a waiting shed and approx. 10 m. NE of the nearest house. Travel time from Mayantoc town proper to the station is about 20 min. Mark is the head of a 2 in. stainless steel bolt, with inscriptions "TRC-82, 2005, DENR".

TRC-83, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. After passing through Tarlac College of Agriculture and NIA-Camiling, turn left on the road leading to Mayantoc town. This road is on the SW side of the highway, near the Shell Gas Station and the road going to CENRO-Camiling. Upon reaching the town, turn left on an intersection with the public market on the right side. Turn right on the road going to Brgy. Cub-cub, then turn right on the road after passing through a concrete bridge with a basketball court on the corner. Then turn right on a Y-intersection with a Carabao monument. Then turn left on another intersection until reaching San Jose Elem. School. It is located at about 5 m. from the centerline and about 6 m. S of the school gate, near the series of plants fronting the school. Mark is the hexagonal head of a 2 in. stainless steel bolt, with inscriptions "TRC-83, 2005, DENR".

TRC-84, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. After reaching the Camiling "welcome" sign, turn left on the road going to Mayantoc town. This road is on the SW side of the highway, near the Shell Gas Station and the road going to CENRO-Camiling. Upon reaching the town, turn left on an intersection with the market on the right side of the crossing and turn right on the road going to Brgy. Cub-cub. Turn right on a Y-intersection with a Carabao monument then turn left on another Y-intersection, passing through a chapel and San Jose Elem. School. It is located on the left side of the road, along a farm dike, about 3 m. from the road centerline and 1 m. SE of a wooden electric post. Travel time from Mayantoc town proper to the station is approx. 15 min. Mark is the hexagonal head of a 2 in. stainless steel bolt.

TRC-85, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. After passing Tarlac College of Agriculture and NIA Camiling, turn left on the road going to Mayantoc town. This road is on the SW side of the highway, near the Shell Gas Station and the road going to CENRO-Camiling. Upon reaching the town proper, turn left on an intersection with the public market on the right side of the crossing and turn right on the road going to Brgy. Cub-cub. Then turn right on the road after passing through a bridge with a basketball court on the corner and right again on a Y-intersection with a Carabao monument. Turn right on another Y-intersection and continue traveling this road until reaching a bridge on an intersection. It is located on the NW corner of the bridge with a waiting shed on the corner. Travel time from Mayantoc town proper to the station is approx. 30 min. Mark is the hexagonal head of a 2 in. stainless steel bolt.

TRC-86, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. After reaching the Camiling "welcome" sign, turn left on the road going to Mayantoc town. This road is on the SW side of the highway, near the Shell Gasoline Station and the road going to CENRO-Camiling. Upon reaching the town proper, turn left on an intersection with the market on the right side of the crossing. Then turn right on the road going to Brgy. Cub-cub and another right again on the road after passing through a bridge with a basketball court on the corner. Then turn right on a Y-intersection with a Carabao monument and right again on another Y-intersection. Continue traveling this road until reaching a bridge inside the series of ricefields. It is located at Brgy. Bacsay situated on the SW side of the bridge of an irrigation canal, with inscriptions "TRC-86, 2005, DENR".

TRC-87, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling then turn left on the intersection going to San Jose town. Travel time from the highway up to San Jose Market is approx. 15 min. Travel more for about 25 min. to reach Brgy. Maamot. It is located infront of the residence of Ms. Leticia Bautista, approx. 15 m. SW of Iglesia Ni Cristo Church. Mark is the square head of a 3 in. steel bolt, with inscriptions "TRC-87, 2005, DENR".

TRC-88, DENR R. III From Tarlac City proper, take the national highway going to the town of Camiling. Then turn left on the intersection going to San Jose town. Travel time from the highway up to San Jose Market is approx. 15 min. Travel more for about 25 min. to reach Brgy. Maamot. It is located on the N corner of the lot and about 15 m. NE of the house owned by Mr. Crisencio Sabis. Mark is the square head of a 3 in. steel bolt.

TRC-89, DENR R. III Is 8 min. travel time, with a distance of 2.2 km., from the 703rd Army Headquarters NW of NIA compound. It is located along the road, on the side of the concrete block. Mark is a bolt embedded and centered on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. concrete monument protruding 0.2 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-89, 2005, DENR".

TRC-9 From Bamban town proper travel nortwestward towards the national highway, thence, northward along the national highway which leads to Capas, Tarlac until reaching a barangay road leading to Brgy. Anupul proper. Turn right and continue traveling using the said barangay road for about 300 m. In pursuing the station you will be able to notice the curve road and on your right are sugar cane plantation and on your left are mango trees. Immediately stop and locate the station which is on the soutwest corner of a lot with the mango tree plantation. Station is about 30 m. W of the curve road. For easy acces to the station, you can seek assistance from the residents in the area or from Councilor July Vitug. Station mark is the top/end of a 10 mm. dia. brass rod centered and embedded on a 10" x 10" concrete monument with inscription "BLLM No.1 BUREAU OF LANDS."

TRC-90, DENR R. III Is located at the top of the hill, SE from the concrete bridge. Travel time to the station is 5 min., with 2 km. distance, from the 703rd Army Headquarters. It is also 10 km. away from the San Jose Public Market. Mark has a silver head, 1 cm., embedded and centered on a 0.37 m. x 0.37 m. concrete monument protruding 0.26 m. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "TRC-90, 2005, DENR".

TRIB, 1950 On the W coast of luzon, Subic Bay. On a large boulder off ìPamocan Pt. on the N entrance to Triboa Bay. Station is the ìcenter of a cross on a brass rod embedded in a drill hole and ìsurrounded with cement patty on which was inscribed "TRIB 1950, ìC&GS". RM No.1 is the center of a cross chiseled on top of a ìrock directly inshore from the station, dsistant 14.57 m., ìazimuth 264° 26' 39.5". RM No. 2 is a similar mark on a cement ìpatty placed on the depression of another large boulder on a line ìtoward Cubi Pt., distant 30.44 m., azimuth 196° 05' 04.5". In ìeach of the RMs, one of the lines forming the cross is an arrow ìpointing to the station.

TUBU 1970 Is located at the SW tip of Tubutubu Island about 1.5 km. E of ìthe town of Orani. Station is the "T" intersection of the ìfishpond dikes located along the shore, and is further identified ìby being 45 m. N of a hut along the dike. Station is also 32 m. N ìof the concrete sluice gate of the same dike, and about 105 m. N ìof the station is another house located on the dike.

WEST END, 1904 On the extreme W end of the low range of hills extending in an E ìand W direction about 1 km. S of Candelaria and about 2 km. E of ìArenas Pt. The cleared hill on which station is located can be ìseen in the prolongation of the extreme W street in Candelaria. ìStation is on the first high brow of the hill from the westward. ìA higher part of the range lies to the eastward. A trail passes ìE and W across the hill just a little N of the station. Station ìmark is a drill hole in a gray rock set on edge and projecting ìabout 5 cm. above the surface. Witness marks are triangles cut ìon two trees, distant 14.17 m. and 13.20 m., in azimuths 239° ì36' and 95° 25'.

WOOD, 1905 About 7 km. E of Castillejos and the same distance NNE of Subic, ìon a bare, sharp-pointed spot near the summit of the main ridge ìNW of Subic Bay. It is at an elevation of 610 m., while the ìnearest peak 1.5 km. further E has an elevation of 823 m., and ìthere are still higher points beyond. Information as to the ìlocation of the trail can probably be secured from the municipal ìpolice at Castillejos. Negritos inhabit the mountains adjacent ìto the station and it is well to secure one for a guide before ìventuring into this locality. The Chief of the tribe living SE ìof Castillejos will furnish a guide acquainted with the locality ìof the station. The only means for verifying the approximate ìposition on the ground will be by means of directions to ìtriangulation points which are easily distinguishable from the ìtopography, such as Santa Rita, Grande and Subic Astronomical ìStation (close to Subic church tower). It is a difficult trip, ìand supplies for a minimum of two or three days are necessary as ìwell as preparations to sleep in the open at night. Station mark ìis a hole in the rock at the center of a triangle. A large pile ìof stones was left over the point.

ZBS-1 Is located inside the Philippine Army Headquarters at the intersection of road inside the camp, approx. 4.35 km. from Masinloc/Palauig junction going to Iba; 0.85 km. SW from Bulawen Elementary School and 0.200 km. W from electric post No.162. Accessible by a two wheel drive vehicle. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a standard concrete block, 0.70 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Sub-surface mark is a bottle set in concrete block, top of bottle is 0.78 m. below station mark. Reference marks is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rods set in concrete blocks 0.60 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name and RM numbers.

ZBS-10 Is situated on the concrete roof of Sto. Niño Barangay Hall, approx. 850 m. from San Felipe town highway junction passing thru Fucuticilla St. It is 3 m. SW of the NE roof corner, 0.80 m. from the roof E edge and 2.65 m. above the ground level. Station mark is a concrete nail set flush on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty with inscription "ZBS-10, 1992, NAMRIA".

ZBS-11 To reach the station from Cabangan Town Proper, travel S along the general direction of the nat'l. road for about 2.5 km. until reaching a highway junction leading to Brgys. Camiing, Laoag Norte and Lomboy. Turn right and head W towards the coast following the general direction of the brgy. road leading to Brgy. Lomboy. Station is located within Lomboy Fisherman Coop. compound. It is situated on top of a concrete water tank of an abandoned resthouse, the water tank located adjacent to the service road and about 20 m. W of the coastline. Mark is the head of concrete nail centered and embbedded on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty set flushed on top of a concrete water tank 5.1 m. above the groundm with inscriptions "ZBS-11 1992 NAMRIA".
Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, surveyor/s must be equipped with a navigational-grade GPS, a compass and a topomap.

ZBS-12 (LOST) Is on an open ground beside the lot owned by Mr. Walter Gamperle approx. 0.5 km. from the highway junction leading to Brgy. Porac. The junction is about 7 km. from Botolan town proper and SW of the town. The station is set on a house 5 steps concrete stair remains about 40 m. NE of the house of Mr. Semperle and 2.43 m. N of the house fence. It is also 54 cm. and 15.5 cm. from the N and W edges, respectively. Mark is a 4" copper nail set flushed on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty protruding 14 cm. above the ground level, with inscriptions "ZBS-12 1992 NAMRIA".

ZBS-13 (LOST) Is situated on the seawall (0.5 m. wide) of the lot owned by Mr. Tamayo beside Camp Conrado D. Yap Zambales Provincial PNP Command, approx. 1.4 km. W of Iba Municipal Hall and 500 m. from the highway junction leading to Brgy. Panibuatan passing by Iba Airfield. It is 30.4 m. N of the concrete fence of the adjacent lot owned by Former Representative Antonio Diaz and 14 cm. from the seawall's E edge. Station mark is a concrete nail set flush on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty with inscription "ZBS-13 1992, NAMRIA".

ZBS-14 to reach the station from Iba town proper, travel northward along the general direction of the national road towards the town of Palauig for about 11 kms until reaching a road intersection, the intersection being 200 m S of Km. Post 222 and reads a sign pointing the direction of the brgy. Locloc. Turn left and head westward for about 1.7 kms. and locate Radona's and Algaba's residence. ZBS-14 is situated on a farmlot own by the Radona's about 37 m SE of the SE corner of a residencial lot of the Radona's 32 m E of an Agoho tree, 16 m N of a Casuy tree and 50 m NW of Alex Algaba's residence. Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail centered and embedded on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 70 cm concrete block which protrudes 5 cm above the gradeline with inscription "ZBS-14, 1992 NAMRIA".
Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, surveyor must be equipped with a compass, a topomap and a navigational grade GPS.

ZBS-17 Is in Zambales at the E coast of Subic Bay about 1.5 NM SE of Grande Island. It is located at Binanga Pt. just below the E side of the cliff. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded on a 0.15 m. x 0.15 m. cement putty with inscription ZBS-17 NAMRIA.

ZBS-18 Is in Zambales, Subic Bay. At the E coast about 1.7 km. SE of Grande Island and 4 km. SW of the western part of SBMA airport. It is located at Camayan Pt. on top of a three-sided concrete wall structure along the road. Station mark is the head of a 1/2" steel bolt embedded on a 6" x 6" cement putty with inscription ZBS-18 1995 NAMRIA.

ZBS-19 Is in Zambales, Subic Bay, Grande Island. Located at the inshore end of the NW breakwater, about 300 m. W of the Pier. Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail, embedded and set flush to the surrounding surface with inscription, "ZBS-19, 1995".

ZBS-2 to reach the station from San Antonio-San Marcelino junction in San Narciso travel eastward along the general direction of the national highway for about 4.7 kms. until reaching a road intersecting the highway which leads to sitio Dallepawen. Turn left and continue traveling for about 300 m until reaching a concrete bridge. ZBS-2 is situated on the SW corner of the said bridge. All RMs are 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rods set on drilled hole in the bridge railings. Station mark is the head of a copper nail centered and embedded on a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty with inscription "ZBS-2, 2004, NAMRIA". Stampings were restored after the previous markings where chipped off.

ZBS-20 Is in Zambales, Olongapo city, SBMA. Located at the WSW point of SBMA Airport, situated on top of a stone riprap outside the road cement blocks. Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail embedded on a 0.15 m. cement putty with inscriptions "ZBS-20, 1995, NAMRIA".

ZBS-21 Is in the province of Zambales, city of Olongapo, at the Subic Bay Metropolitan Authority. It is located outside the Subic Bay International Airport near the shoreline on the NE part of the runway. It is approx. 25 m. N of valve pit #45, 50 m. NW of valve pit #44, which are located on the side of a road leading to Cubi Point Westward and Coastal Subic Compound Eastward. Mark is a 10 cm. dia. iron plate, cross-marked at the center, placed on a concrete base, enclosed by a 20 cm. yellow-painted square, marked PWC 91, 1974.

ZBS-22 Is in Zambales, Olongapo, Subic Bay, at the E coast of the bay. At Maritan Pt., located 200 m. SE of the offshore end pier of coastal, Subic Bay Terminal Inc. Station mark is the head of a copper nail, embedded and cemented flush to the seawall, N of the defunct and abandoned pier, with inscription "ZBS-22, 1995, NAMRIA".

ZBS-23 Is in Olongapo City, Zambales, at SBMA. Station is located at the E coast of the bay at Rivera Pt. Pier. Mark is the head of a copper nail embedded and set flush to the concrete pier, about 2.5 m. W of the SE end corner, with inscription "ZBS-23, 1995, NAMRIA".

ZBS-24 Is in the Province of Zambales, City of Olongapo, Brgy. Kalaklan. It is about 8 m. SW of Kalaklan Lighthouse which is situated at the N side of Kalaklan River's mouth. Station mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set on the center of a cement putty on top of a concrete structure with inscription "ZBS-24, 1995, NAMRIA".

ZBS-25 = MACMANY, 1908 On the W side of Subic Bay, Zambales on the prominent ridge leading down to Macmany Point. At an elevation of about 250 m.is a prominent knoll below which the ridge divides into two well-defined spurs, one leading SE down to Macmany Point, the other leading NE toward the mouth of small stream emptying into the bay 0.4 km. N of Macmany Point. The station is situated on the highest part of the knoll at the junction of these two spurs. The station is most easily reached from the Macmany Point, going up the ridge which leads directly up to the station which is always in view as the hillside is entirely bare of trees, being covered only with cogon grass black boulders. Beyond the station, the ridge drops to a sharp saddle before resuming its rise. The station is in a little circular depression about 0.6 m. deep and 1.5 m. to 2.5 m. in dia. Station mark is a drill hole in the center of a triangle about 20 cm. on a side, chiseled in the flat surface of an irregular slab of a rock about 0.6 m. long x 0.45 m. wide. RM No. 1 is porcelain plug embedded in a cement patty on a large boulder about 1 m. in dia., distant 8.20 m. W of the station marked with an arrow pointing towards the station. RM No. 2 is a porcelain plug embedded on a cement patty on a rock about 1/2 m. in dia., distant 4.78 m. N of the station and marked "RM No. 2", with an arrow pointing towards the station.
Recoverd as described, slightly buried but in good condition.

ZBS-26 Is in Zambales, at the W coast of the Subic Bay. It is situated on a hill at Sueste Pt., on a steel cylindrical post about 0.70 m. high above the ground 30 m. SSW of the old light house. Station mark is a round gash 2 mm. deep at the center of the steel plate welded on top of the 10 mm. dia. post without inscription.

ZBS-27 Is in Zambales, Subic, on a hill about 500 m. N of Agusuhin pt. (locally known as Quarry). It is located about 25 m. above the house of Daniel Paguio. The hill is surrounded by assorted trees. It can be reached by about 25 min. travel via motorized pumpboat from Subic town proper. Station mark is a head of a 4" copper nail set on the center of a cement putty on top of a 1 m. irregularly shaped rock with inscriptions ZBS-27, 1995, NAMRIA.

ZBS-28 Is in Zambales, City of Olongapo, Brgy. Kalaklan. Located at the highest point of the hill occupied by the Olongapo City cemetery, on a rectangular concrete water tank. Station mark is the head of a copper nail embedded and set flush to the surface, 0.60 m. from the NW corner of the tank with inscription, "ZBS-28, 95, NAMRIA."

ZBS-29 Is in Zambales, Subic Bay, about 1.4 km. S of Cayag pt. It is located a step below the SE corner of a fishpond owned by Mr. Felipe Delgado. Station can be reached at about 10 min. travel time via motorized pumpboat from Subic town proper. Station mark is a head of 4" copper nai set on the center of a cement putty on top of a concrete seawall with inscription ZBS-29, 1995, NAMRIA.

ZBS-3 Is accessible for all types of vehicles. It's about 5 min. drive from Sta. Cruz proper to Gama Elementary School and from this school, drive for about 350 m., then turn rigth eastward. Station is approx. 1.2 km. SE of the national road and barrio road intersection. It is at the SE end of E irrigation canal headwall. Station mark is a cross-cut on top of 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod centered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. x 0.70 m. concrete block flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Sub-surface mark ZBS-3 with 7-up bottle neck embedded on 15 cm. concrete foundation of irrigation canal covered with sand; 0.01 cm. deep. Reference mark RM-1, RM-3 & RM-4 are 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. brass rods with cement patties embedded on top of irrigation canal headwall. RM-2 is a concrete monument 25 cm. x 25 cm. x 60 cm. dia.

ZBS-30 Is in Zambales, town of San Marcelino, Brgy. Consuelo Norte. Located at the SE point of Simminublan hill, about 500 m. N of San Marcelino town proper. Station mark is the head of a copper nail embedded and set flush to the rocky surface of the hill about 20 m. high with some group of houses below and one just 3.0 m. E of the station. The mark is inscribed with, "ZBS-30, 1995, NAMRIA."

ZBS-3001 The mark is located E of Lupa Elementary School of Santa Cruz, Zambales. It is situated 20 m s of the water tank outside the perimeter fence of the said school and 15 m E of the school. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS 3001, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3002 From Iba Municipal Hall, travel along National Road going to Santa Cruz until reaching the Y-road at Barangay Lucapon South. Turn right to the road going to ACOJE Mining Company. Follow the road until reaching the lot property DAR about 5 KM from the National Highway. Station mark is on the land property of DAR along the SE side of the road going to ACOJE. It is situated about 5m E from the inetersection of the road going to ACOJE and 1.54 KM Subol Road, which is yet to be constructed by DAR. Mark is about 25 m SE of the mango tree about 2m NW of the barbwire fence. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centere on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3002, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3003 The station is situated towards north NAPOCOR Compound, it is within the barangay road at a distance 6m from the centerline of the road, and about 150 m SW of Bani Barangay Hall and north of Zambales Bay. Mark is lcoated about 70 m N of the intersection of the barangay Road Entrance to NAPOCOR. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3003, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3004 Station is located at Barngay Bulitin, Masinloc, Zambales about 2 KM east of Iglesi Ni Kristo Chapel. Mark is the head of a 4 inch. copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3004, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3005 From Iba Town Proper, take national road going to Palauig. After passing the 20m bridge, turn right and travel about 500 m. Station is located on the left side of Salaza Barangay Road. Mark is the head of 4 inch. copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3005, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3006 From Iba Town Proper, take National Road going to Masinloc until reaching the junction going to Palauig. Continue traveling for about 8 KM upon reaching the first Barangay Road going to Sitio Dampay. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty on the ground with inscription "PAL-18, DENR-III, 2004".

ZBS-3007 The station mark is located approximately 20m. from the intersection of two barangay roads namely Santiago Rd and Kinaraan Rd. It about 15 m N of a waiting shed about 50 m S of a concrete barrier. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3007, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3008 The mark is located along the abandoned runway at Sitio Mandaloy, Barangay Taltal, Masinloc, Zambales. It situated 20 m S runway centerline, about 50 m NE powerline post and about 100 m S Mr. Dionisio Bagsao Residence. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3008, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3009
From Iba, travel along National Road going to Cabangan. Then turn left to the road going to Barangay San Rafael, turn right at the first crossing until reaching Barangay Hall. Station mark is centered at the top of 10 m high water tank S of the stage, E of the Barangay Hall W of Barangay Chapel. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3009, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3010
Station mark is located on the concrete approach of a bridge at southern portion about 20 cm from the edge. It is situated about 40 m SW of Saint Benedict Convent, east of South China Sea and at the SE of SUMMER ICHIBAN BEACH RESORT. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3010, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3011 The mark is located in Sitio Cabaruan, Barangay East Feria, San Felipe, Zambales. It is situated on the SW corner of the basketball court of the said sitio. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3011, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3012 From San Marcelino Municipal Hall, travel along the road going to Barangay Laoag until reaching the Y-road going to the dike and going to Barangay San Rafael. Turn right to the Y-road until reaching Barangay San Rafael. Station mark is inside the compound of San Rafael Barangay Hall. It is located about 10 m W of the west corner of the mini chapel and 0.5 m SE from the 11th pillar of the cyclone wire fence (11th pillar from the NNE corner of the compound). Mark is along the imaginary line extending the W corner of the Barangay Hall about 30m NW. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3012, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3013
From San Antonio Municipal Hall, travel along the road going to San Marcellino. Turn right to GOVIC Highway (Road going to San Antonio Valley Subdivisio) until reaching the bridge. Station mark is along the SW side of the road, about 5m from the road centerline. It is situated about 11 m NW from the W end of the bridge, about 7m NE from the riprap and 2.6 KM from the National Road. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-3013, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3015
Station is located in Brgy. Guinabon, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is located inside the lot owned by the Meradios Family. It is about 50 m N of the house of Jenaro Meradios, and on the opposite side of the dirt road from the houses of Alex and Arnel Meradios. It is about 100 m E of the Nayon River. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground, with inscription, "ZBS-3015, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3016
Station is located near the concrete stairs of the Nayom Dam, on the SE end of the said dam. It is about 10 Km. NE of the town proper. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set flushed at the center of a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty with inscriptions, "ZBS-3016, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3017
Station is located in Brgy. Guinabon, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on the N end of the Guinabon bridge, on the right side of the concrete railing coming from the Nat'l Highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3017, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3018
Station is located in Brgy. Guinabon, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated along the irrigation canal leading to the Nayom Dam, about 600 m SE of the said dam. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground, with inscription, "ZBS-3018, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3019
Station is located in Brgy. Doliman, Infanta, Zambales. It is situated on the NE corner of the concrete base of an old basketball court, S of the road heading to Doliman Elem. School. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscription, "ZBS-3019, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3020
Station is located in Brgy. Doliman, Infanta, Zambales. It is situated inside the compound of Doliman Elem. School, beside the school's basketball court. It is on the NE corner of the court, 20 m E of the main school bldg. and 50 m N of the school's flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscription, "ZBS-3020, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3021
Station is located inside the Brgy. Multipurpose Compound in Brgy. Guinabon, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is located on the right side of the basketball court, near the entrance gate of the compound. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty, set flush to the surface with inscriptions, "ZBS-3021, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3022
Station is located in Brgy. Guinabon, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated near the rice field, about 20 m N of the dirt road and 10 m S of a house. It is about 9 Km. NE of Sta. Cruz town proper, and 7 Km. from the Highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3022, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3023
Station is located in Brgy. Canaynayan, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is located along the road leading to Purok 4 proper. It is on the SW end of the steel bridge, along the concrete railings. It is about 5 Km. from the town proper and 3 Km. from the highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3023, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3024
Station is located in Brgy. Canaynayan, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on the vacant lot, N of the river, about 30 m N from the riverbank and 5 m E of an electrical post. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3024, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3025
Station is located in Brgy. Potol, Infanta, Zambales. It is situated on the open space in front of the Iglesia ni Cristo of Brgy. Potol. It is on the N bank of the Nayom River. It is about 7 Km. from Sta. Cruz town proper, and 4.5 Km. from the highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3025, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3026
Station is located in Brgy. Potol, Infanta, Zambales. It is situated inside the Potol Brgy. Compound, on the NW side of the basketball court near the Brgy. Hall. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3026, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3027
Station is located in Brgy. Canaynayan, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on top of the irrigation canal, near a road intersection, of a gravel and the concrete road heading to the brgy. proper from the Nat'l Highway. It is about 4 Km. from the Nat'l Highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty set flush to the surface, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3027, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3028
Station is located in Brgy. Canaynayan in Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on top of an irrigation canal beside the dirt road. On the opposite side of the road from the canal is a ricefield. It is about 4.5 Km. from the Nat'l Highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty, set flush to the surface, with inscription, "ZBS-3028, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3029
Station is located along the Nat'l Highway in Brgy. Gama, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on the SW end of the Nayom Bridge, 7 m W of the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground, with inscription, "ZBS-3029, 2007, NAMRIA.

ZBS-3030
Station is located along the Nat'l Highway. It is located in front of and on the other side of the road from E4M Construction store, about 30 m W of the said store and about 6 m W from the road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail set flushed at the center of a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty with inscriptions, "ZBS-3030, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3031
Station is located in Brgy. Lupa, Sta. Cruz, Zambales. it is situated along the road heading to Brgy. Tubo-tubo North. It is situated about 6 m S of the road centerline and 15 m SW of the waiting shed. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, set flush to the ground, with inscriptions, "ZBS-3031, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3032
Station is located in Brgy. Tubo-tubo Norte in Sta. Cruz, Zambales. It is situated on top of the concrete riprap of an RCP, about 6 m W of the road centerline. It can be accessed by turning right just before the Sta. Cruz Bridge when heading towards the town proper then travel for about 2 Km. until reaching a left turn towards the caves, make a turn then follow the road, turning right until reaching the station. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, set in a 25 cm x 25 cm cement putty flushed to the ground with inscriptions, "ZBS-3032, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-3033
Station is located in Brgy. Tubo-tubo Sur in Sta. Cruz, Zambales. ZBS-4 No description

ZBS-41 (OC-15) Is located along the road of Purok 13 in Brgy. Bareto, Olongapo City, 50 m. S of the national highway. Station mark is a copper nail 10 cm. x 0.5 mm. in dia. set on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. in size and flushed 40 cm. deep and only 10 cm. protruding from the ground with the station name inscribed at the top of the station.

ZBS-42 (OC-16) Is located along the road leading to the Sta. Lucia Subd. It is on the SE edge of the road, 15 m. from the gate of the subdivision, 1.5 m. from the sidewalk. Station mark is a copper nail 10 cm. x 0.5 mm. in dia., set on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. in size and 40 cm. flushed below the ground and only 10 cm. protruding from the ground. ZBS-43 (OC-22) Is located along Neptune St. corner Sander St. in Brgy. Gordon Heights, Olongapo City. Station is along the SW of Neptune St., infront of No. 9 Neptune St. Station mark is a copper nail 10 cm. x 0.5 mm. in dia., set on the concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. in size and 40 cm. flushed below the ground with only 10 cm. protruding. Station name is inscribed at the top of the station.

ZBS-44 To reach the station from Olongapo City, travel along the nat'l. highway, which leads to Iba, until reaching Bucao Bridge. Station is located on the right side of the bridge about 10 to 15 m. from the foot of the bridge.

ZBS-45 to reach the station from San Juan barangay hall, travel eastward to NEward along the general direction of the road for about 1.5 kms. toward Baquilan resettlement and San Juan cemetery. Upon reaching a Y-intersection further N from the resettlement turn left and head W for about 500 m until reaching a footrail leading to a prominent hill (the E side of which is the cemetery) and hike 100 m to the station. ZBS-45 is located on the W side of the said prominent hill, about 500 m SW of the cemetery and 750 m N of ZBS-49. Station mark is the head of a copper nail centered and embedded on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 200 cm concrete monument protruding 100 cms. above the ground surface with inscription "CORNER-52, LAT/LONG, LC MAP 645".
Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, surveyors must be equipped with a navigational grade GPS, a topomap and and a compass.

ZBS-47 to reach the station from Botolan town proper, travel eastward along Botolan-Tarlac road for about 8 kms. passing by brgy. San Juan until reaching Baquilan river (bridge ruins exist after it was destroyed by lahar). Continue traveling by foot, by four wheel drive vehicle or by carabao drawn cart SEward to Mt. Mulbao passing by brgy. Nagpare until reaching the remains of former brgy. proper of Malumboy (90 min. walk). Continue further for a couple of meters until reaching the Botolan-Tarlac road ruins in the said brgy. where the station is situated. ZBS-47 is located 3 m SE of the W end of the road. Station mark is the head of a 3" copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 50 cm concrete block with inscription "ZBS-47, 2004 NAMRIA".
Note: To facilitate easy access to station, surveyors must be equipped with a navigation grade GPS, a topomap and a compass.

ZBS-48 To reach the station from Botolan town proper, travel E along the Botolan-Tarlac Rd. for about 8 kms. passing by Brgy. San Juan until reaching Baquilan River (bridge ruins exist after it was destroyed by lahar). Continue traveling by foot, by 4-wheel drive vehicle or by carabao-drawn cart SE to Mt. Mulbao in Brgy. Malumboy. Thence head SW crossing Bacao River to a small hill, elevation 50 m. directly opposite of station ZBS-47. Station is located on the top of the hill about 20 m. E of a Mango tree and 1.1 km. bearing 33° 47' of ZBS-47. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 50 cm. concrete block, with inscriptions "ZBS-48 2004 NAMRIA".
*Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, surveyors must be equipped with a navigation-grade GPS, a topomap and a compass.

ZBS-49 To reach the station from Botolan town proper, travel E along the general direction of the road for about 5 km. until reaching San Juan Brgy. Hall, continue further for about 1 km. and locate a junkshop 385 m. E of station ZBS-51 and 400 m. E of the Caltex LPG Refilling Station. Station is located 5 m. S of the centerline of the road, 1 m. E of the NE corner of the junkshop and 8 m. N of the N side of Bucao River. Mark is the head of a 3" concrete nail embedded and centered in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 50 cm. concrete block, with inscriptions "DENR-R3 BOT-34".
*Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, surveyors must be equipped with a navigational-grade GPS, a topomap and a compass.

ZBS-5 Station is located at La Paz Plaza, approximately 1.4 kms. from San Narciso town highway junction passing thru Granvia Street. It is set on the stage's concrete roof, 3.10 m. N of the SW roof corner and 61 cm. E of the center of W roof oval-shape edge. The stage is about 50 m. from the shoreline, facing seaward and W of the La Paz lighthouse and war monument . Station mark is a concrete nail embedded on the stage's concrete roof with inscription TRISPO 3 and 2.7 m above the ground level. (Intervisible to ZBS-9).

ZBS-50 To reach the station from Bucao Bridge, the bridge being 3.5 kms. SW of the town proper, head E for about 300 m. following an access road to So. Bucao, the access road being 20 m. SW of Bucao Bridge. Continue travelling by foot following the trail for about 2.5 kms. crossing a creek, which joins Bucao River, until reaching the foot of Mt. Munti, elevation 200 m., and locate forest boundary mon. cor. 77 on the side of the trail. Mark is the exposed end of a 10 mm dia. steel bar centered and embedded on a 20 cm. x 20 cm. x 200 cm., 100 cm. of which protrudes above the ground, with inscriptions "DENR R-3 COR 77 LAT & LONG".
*Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, the surveyor must be equipped with a navigational-grade GPS, a topomap and a compass.

ZBS-51 To reach the station from Botolan town proper, travel E along the ìgeneral direction of the road for about 5 km. until reaching San ìJuan Brgy. Hall passing by a road junction in Brgy. Batonlapoc. ìContinue travelling further for about 1 km. until reaching a ìCaltex LPG Refilling Station. Station is located 15 m. E of the ìsaid refilling station's gate and adjacent is an irrigational ìcanal, which runs E along the brgy. road. Mark is the head of ìcopper nail centered and embedded on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 50 cm. ìconcrete block, with inscriptions "DENR-3 BOT-33".
*Note: To facilitate easy access to the station, surveyor must be ìequipped with a navigational-grade GPS, a topomap and a compass.

ZBS-52 (RJG-2) Is in SBMA Freeport Zone, located on the center front entrance of the boardwalk helipad, about 6 m. from the centerline of the road, opposite side of the unfinished Legenda Bldg. Mark is a bronze disk set flushed to the ground, with inscription "RJG-2".

ZBS-53 The Mark is located in the Barngay Center of Barangay Sabang, Santa Cruz, Zambales. It is situated 1m S of the south center sideline of the basketball court of the said barangay. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty on the ground with inscription "ZBS-53, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-54 From Iba Municipal, travel along national road going to Sta Cruz until reaching the Y-road at Barangay Lucapon South. Turn right to the road going to ACOJE Mining Company. Follow the road, pasing the wooden bridge until reaching the "NW-SE" chain of electric post. COntinue travelling passing a sharp curve road until reaching the 5th and 6th electric post. (NOTE: The two side by side electriv post at the left side of the road before reaching the sharp curve is considered as the 1st post.) Station mark is located along the NW side of the road going to ACOJE Mining Company, about 8 m. from the road centerline. Mark is situated on the intersection of imaginary line extending the 5th post 50 m NE and extending the 6th post 50 m NW. The station is about 1KM from the wooden bridge and 5 KM from the national highway. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-54, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-55 The station is located SW of the barangay road approximately 6m from the centerline, about 150m NE of transmission post, about 75 m from concrete canal. Both side of the road is an idle rice field. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete monuemnt flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-55, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-56 Station is on an open ground of Barangay Santa Rita Hall. approximately 1.5 KM from Masinloc Town Proper and Santa Cruz Junction. Facing the stage, station is on the right side. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-56, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-57 From Iba Town Proper take the National road going to Palauig. Upon reaching Barangay Salasa turn right after the 100m bridge. Continue traveling until reaching Barangay Sta. Marta. Station mark is located top of the irrigation canal gate. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-57, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-58 The station is inside Barangay Center of Dirita, Iba, Zambales. It is approximately 1m. from the foot of the basketball court at east direction. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cmconcrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "IBA-56, 2007,DENR".

ZBS-59 From Iba, travel along National Road going to Botolan until reaching the triangular island at the junction. Travel straight ahead passing welcome sign of Barangay San Juan until reaching Barangay Hall of San Juan. Station mark is located at the top of a 10 m water tank beside the barangay hall. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-59, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-6 (LOST) From San Antonio town proper, proceed to Evangelista St. and travel northwestward until reaching the barangay plaza of San Miguel approximately 3.2 kilometers. From the plaza, walk westward and sross the concrete footbridge about 1 m x 10 m. The station is just 54 m. W from the footbridge's W end and about 60 m. from the shoreline. Station mar is a 12 mm. dia. brass rod set flush on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument protruding 20 cm. above the ground level and with inscription TRISPO 1.

ZBS-60 From Cabangan, travel southward along the National Road for about 300 m until reaching Barangay San Antonio Proper. Station mark is located inside the Barngay Hall compound about 6 m E of Barangay road. It is situated about 10 m S of basketball court and Children's Park. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-60, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-61 From Cabangan Proper, travel southward on National Road for about 6 to 8 KMS until reaching the junction going to Barangay Kakilingan. Turn left and head westward towards the twin river of Kakilingan and Maloma. Station mark is located along the newly constructed concrete dike approximately 300 m from the barangay proper. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-61, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-62 the mark is located in the EXECUTIVE PARK of Barangay La Paz, San Narciso. It is situated on the NW corner of the stage of said plaza about 15 m W of Magsaysay Boulevard. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block fkushed on the ground with inscription ZBS-62, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-63 From San Marcelino Municipal Hall, travel along the road going to Barangay Laoag until reaching the dike. Travel east along the dike for about 10 km until reaching the 3 m high water tank. Turn left to the road going downward until reaching the baskeball court of Sitio Dalanadan, Aglao. Station mark is located about 1.5 m N from the north side of the court, about 15 m E from the road centerline, 8m E from the NW coner of the court, and approxiamately 5m SW of the Mulit- Purpose Building. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-63, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-64 From San Fernando City, travel toward Castillejos Proper via Olongapo City. The station is situated at Barangay Magsaysay which is about 1 km NW of Castillejos Municipal Hall. Mark is located at the left shoulder of the road and is measured 2m from the culvert parapet. Mark is the head of a 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-64, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-65 From San Fernando City, travel toward Subic Municipal Proper until reaching the public market which is found at the left side of the National Highway. Station is located at the NE edge of the concrete slab of the stage in front of Subic Public Market. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm cement putty flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-65, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-66 From San Fernando City, travel toward Olongapo CIty until reaching the "Kalapati Monument" located at New Cbalan junction. At the junction, turn right and follow the concrete road until reaching the second intersection road on the right side. Station mark is located at the corner of Saturn St. and Purok-2 St, and measured about 10 m N from the electric post. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete monuemnt flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-66, 2007, NAMRIA".

ZBS-67 The mark is located in Barangay DALLIPAWEN, San Narciso, Zambales. It is situated 2 m S of the bridge and 3 m E of the Barangay Road, The bridge is about 300 m N of the National Road leading to San Marcelino, Zambales. Mark is the head of 4 inch copper nail, centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete block flushed on the ground with inscription "ZBS-67, 2007, NAMRIA". ZBS-7 No description

ZBS-8 From Subic town proper, travel N along the national highway for about 3 km. Turn left and proceed SW up to Phil. Shipyard and Engineering Corp. (PHILSECO) about 2.7 km. from the highway. The station is located on the wharf at the SW corner of PHILSECO compound. It is 22.8 m. from the wharf W end near the creek and 2.78 m. from its S edge. Mark is a 4" copper nail set flush on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty, with inscription "ZBS-8, 1992 NAMRIA".

ZBS-9 Is located on an open ground near the coastline which is part of the forested land owned by Mr. Gerry Fernandez, approx. 2 km. from La Paz Plaza passing northward thru Magsaysay Blvd. The plaza is about 1.4 km. W of San Narciso town and can be reached by passing thru Granvia St. at the town proper. The station is 21.5 m. from the SW fence corner of the former prawn hatchery compound and 28 m. from the W house. The caretaker of the land is Mr. Juan Arbizo. Station mark is a 4" copper nail set flush on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument with inscription "ZBS-9, 1992, NAMRIA".
